Her business goal is to grow her business and open other stalls in Nairobi within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will provide employment to many jobless Kenyans when her business grows.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, de 46 años, es una mujer admirable. Cuidó sola a los 3 hijos que tubo, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos: Jesús y Carmen, a los que cuida en una casa alquilada en el distrito de Chilca. Cuando muy joven comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades, pues tenía que sacar adelante a sus hijos. Fue entonces que comenzó a forjar su camino, su principal cualidad es la cocina; por ello pensó en aprovechar su talento y abrir un restaurante. Poco a poco, compró lo necesario para encaminar su negocio. Al principio fue difícil, pero ahora cuenta con una cocina industrial y un local equipado, todo ello gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación. Tiene gran clientela, pues la zona donde se encuentra es comercial y hay afluencia de personas, sobre todo los fines de semana; en la feria que se realiza. Ahora ella espera mejorar los platos que sirve, para tener mayor clientela y mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este es el vigésimotercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Marina de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de arroz, azúcar, maíz y demás productos de primera necesidad para la elaboración de los platos de comida.
texts.en:
Marina, 46 years old, is an admirable woman. Alone she cared for her three children, two of which are living with her: Jesús and Carmen. She cared for them in a rented house in the district of Chilca. When very young she began to work in different areas as she had to bring up her children. It was then she began to pave a path. 

Her main skills are in the kitchen, so she thought of taking advantage of her talent and opened a restaurant. Little by little she bought what was needed to put the business on the right track. At first it was difficult, but now she has an industrial kitchen and an equipped location, all thanks to her dedication and hard work. She has great clients, since her business is located in a commercial area where there are lots of people, especially on the weekends, because of the fair that takes place. 

Now she hope to improve the dishes that they serve, in order to have more clients and higher income. She belongs to the communal bank IDME and this is the 23rd loan with MFP, where she waits for their cooperation in order to continue with her plans. On the other hand, she promises once again to make her payments. She likes being a part of the communal bank because all the members are responsible and caring. Marina will use the money from the loan to buy rice, sugar, corn and other staples necessary for the preparation of food dishes.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and corn for the preparation of food

loans.name: Lili

texts.es: Lili, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y carismática, además de ser muy trabajadora y empeñosa. Vive con Emiterio y sus cuatro hijos de 20, 17, 12,  y 7 años de edad. Juntos habitan en su casa que es propia. El trabajo que realiza Lili es la venta de abarrotes en general, para lo cual abrió un bodega en su propia casa, con un capital fruto de los ahorros con su pareja, y a base de dedicación y trabajo logró hacerlo crecer su negocio. A lo largo de estos 18 años que lleva funcionando su bodega, atendiendo con los productos de primera necesidad a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos mayores en la atención al público. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es tener tiempo libre para dedicarle a sus hijos. Gracias a este trabajo, ella puede apoyar con los gastos de su hogar, además de que la convierte en una mujer independiente, asimismo ha logrado comprar algunos artefactos electrodoméstico, para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. Este será el crédito número 3 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, por eso dice será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en su totalidad en más productos para su bodega, como arroz, azúcar, aceites y demás al por mayor, así podrá tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
43-year old Lili is a lively, charismatic woman who is also hardworking and industrious. She lives with her husband Emiterio and their four children aged 20, 17, 12, and 7. She sells groceries from a store in her house. She started the business with the money that she and her husband saved up. Through dedication and hard work she has managed to build up the business over the past eighteen years. 

Lili sells basic necessities and her customers are mainly neighbours. Her older children help to serve customers in the store. She likes the work because she has free time to spend with her children, and it brings in money to help with household expenses. The work has allowed her to become independent, and she has managed to buy various electric appliances giving the family a better quality of life. 

This will be Lili’s third loan with MFP, and she is happy with the financial support she has received. She says that she will repay the money punctually. With the loan she plans to buy more merchandise for her store such as rice, sugar, and oil at wholesale prices so she can make more profit.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en:
Yusuf is a married man with 8 children 5 of whom attend school. His wife is a farmer who contributes to the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Yusuf has operated a charcoal selling business for the past seven years; his potential clients are his neighbors and friends. He faces a major challenge of transporting his stock from the point of purchase to his places of sale. He dreams of owning a pick-up truck.

With the KES 40,000 he wants to purchase more charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Duo Inspiracion Group

texts.es: Duo Inspiracion. Este duo lo integran dos personas luchadoras entusiastas y optimista por la vida, doña Ana Elizabeth inicio vendiendo productos comestibles al ber que su negocio marchaba bien incluyo un producto mas y fue la venta de huevos,todos los dias sale a vender por sectores de sus comunidad donde veve,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles, ya que espera en esta oportunidad aumentar sus ventas con el credito,  doña sabina dice hay mucho por que luchar y trabajar dia a dia y desde que murio su esposo ella sola saco adelante a sus hijos vendiendo ropa para dama niño, caballero,siendo ella la lider del grupo por su experiancia que tiene en el area de la venta ella  esta solicitando este credito para la compra de sueteres, gorros,colchas,para la temporada de fin de años ya que esa epoca hace mucho frio y de esa manera seguir ayudando a sus hijos para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Duo Inspiración [Inspiration Duo]. This duo is made up two fighters who are enthusiastic and optimistic about life. 

Ana Elizabeth started out selling grocery products. Seeing that her business was going well she included another product- the sale of eggs. Every day she sells around the community where she lives. She is requesting this loan to buy grocery products. She hopes that this opportunity will increase sales through her loan. 

Sabina says she has much to fight and work for everyday. Since her husband died, she alone has supported their children by selling women's, children's and men's clothing. She is the leader of this group because of the experience she has in the area of sales. She is requesting this loan to buy sweaters, hats and bedspreads for the year-end season since it is very cold. In this way she can continue helping her children so that they'll have a better future.

loans.use: to buy cold-weather clothing like sweaters and hats.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La Sra. Julia nacida en la ciudad de La Paz, vive en la zona de San Antonio,  casada con el señor Rene  de ocupación  chofer, tiene la actividad de elaboración de tejido de ponchos el cual los realiza a pedido y también se dedica a administración de vehículo, que su esposo maneja,  el cual le genera mas ingresos, tienen 3 hijos de 16, 14 y  9 años de edad todos estudiantes, el dinero del crédito la cliente lo requiere para  realizar el mantenimiento del vehículo como ser cambio de las alfombras y el mantenimiento de los asientos, ya que por el uso que le dan se gasto mucho, la Sra., Julia es una persona muy trabajadora que junto a su esposo se dedican a trabajar para llevar el sustento a sus hijos, quienes son su motor para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Julia, who was born in the city of La Paz, lives in the San Antonio area. She is married to Rene, who is a driver by profession. She knits ponchos, which she makes to order. She also coordinates the maintenance of a vehicle that her husband drives, which brings in more income. They have three children, ages sixteen, fourteen, and nine; all three are students. 

Julia needs the money from this loan to perform vehicle maintenance, such as replacing the carpets and repairing the seats, which get very worn out from so much use. Julia is very hard-working, and she works together with her husband to support their children, who are their inspiration to get ahead.

loans.use: to perform vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Bolot

texts.ru:
Болоту 48 лет, женат и воспитывает четверых детей.
Болот родился в простой и многодетной семье фермера, и с детства помогал отцу по хозяйству. Мать работала в соседнем селе на фабрике по производству ниток и тканей. После окончания школы Болот поступил на учебу в автошколу, где проучился 6 месяцев. Закончив учебу, устроился в родном колхозе на работу в качестве водителя грузовых автомашин. В 1979 году в возрасте 17 лет Болот женился, и первое время Болот с женой жили с родителями. В 1982 году, отслужив в армии два года, Болот вернулся в родное село, к своей семье, и снова стал работать в местном колхозе. В этом же году у Болота родился первый сын, а в 1984 году – второй. В этом же году супруга Болота устроилась на работу в местный магазин, и  на заработанные деньги Болот с женой покупали скот. Через некоторое время колхоз выделил Болоту участок земли в родном селе и распродав часть скота, Болот построил на участке небольшой дом с надворными постройками, куда он со своей семьей переезжает от родителей. Болот по-прежнему продолжал работать в колхозе, супруга устроилась в местную сельскую управу в качестве кассира. 
Семья Болота росла, и росли потребности. Зарплаты шофера не хватало, и Болот устроился на работу на спиртовой завод в качестве плотника. Проработав там 5 лет, попал под сокращение. В 2008 году выходит замуж старшая дочка Болота и для того, чтобы выдать замуж дочь и собрать ей приданное, Болоту пришлось распродать часть скота.
В данное время, благодаря  упорству и трудолюбию, у Болота в хозяйстве имеется 3 дойных коровы и 18 овец. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Болот обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. В ближайших планах Болота - строительство большого сарая и увеличение поголовья домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Bolotu is 48 years old, married, and is raising four children. Bolot grew up in an ordinary and large farm family, and has helped his father keep up the farm since he was a child. His mother worked at a yarn and fabric factory in a nearby village. After graduating from school, Bolot went to driving school, where he studied for six months. After finishing his studies, he got a job at a local collective farm as a truck driver. In 1979, Bolot got married at the age of 17. At first Bolot and his wife lived with his parents. In 1982, after serving in the army for two years, Bolot returned to his hometown and to his family, and once again began to work at the local collective farm. That same year Bolot's first son was born, and a second son was born in 1984. That same year Bolot's wife got a job at a local store, and they used the money to buy livestock. Shortly thereafter, the collective farm allocated Bolot a parcel of land in his hometown, and, after having sold some of their livestock, Bolot built a small house with some outbuildings. Then Bolot and his family moved there from his parents' place. Bolot continued to work at the collective farm, and his wife got a job as a cashier at a local agricultural office.

Bolot's family grew, and so did their needs. A driver's salary was not enough, and Bolot got a job as a carpenter at a alcohol manufacturing plant. After working there for five years, he got laid off. In 2008, Bolot's oldest daughter was to be married, and Bolot had to sell some of his livestock to marry off his daughter and put together a dowry for her.

Right now, thanks to his persistence and industriousness, Bolot has 3 milking cows and 18 sheep on his farm. In order to increase his livestock headcount, Bolot has gone to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase more livestock. Bolot's short-term plans include building a large barn and increasing his livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Claudia Marisol

texts.es:
Claudia Marisol tiene 31 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 15, 10 y 8 años de edad, los 3 estudian, vive en la Colonia las Torres de Choloma, Cortes. Su esposo trabaja en una maquila como operario.
Claudia inicio su propio negocio con la ayuda de su hermana hace año y medio, es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora.  Ella elabora y vende tortillas de maíz desde las 6:00 a 10:00 de la mañana y de 1:00 a 6:00 de la tarde todos los días. El negocio ha crecido en clientes. Y para mantenerlo a solicitado 3 prestamos con el actual y los ha invertido en materia prima como harina de maíz para elaborar las tortillas. De este préstamo actual va destinar una parte para reparación del techo de su casa. Su meta es que sus hijos terminen los estudios y mejorar la vivienda.
texts.en:
Claudia Marisol, 31, is married and has three children who are 15, 10 and 8 years old; all three attend school.  She lives in the Las Torres neighborhood in Choloma, Cortes.  Her husband is employed at an assembly plant.

Claudia started her own business with help from her sister a year and a half ago.  She is a responsible, very hardworking person.  She makes corn tortillas to sell from 6am until 10am and then from 1pm until 6pm every day.  The business’ clientele has grown.

To stay in business she’s asked for three loans that she’s invested in the purchase of raw materials like corn flour to make tortillas.  With this current loan, she will use part of it to repair her roof.  Her goal is that her children complete their schooling and to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy corn flour and to repair her roof.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 63 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married with three children. 

Luzminda has a general store and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Luzminda has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Shalon Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Keyla que vende ropa nueva y sandalias desde hace 3 años, es casada y con un hijo menor, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva y variada y sandalias.Aleyda vende comida y Rosa vende cosméticos variados de la Avon.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising members, one of whom is Keyla, who has been selling new clothes and sandals for the past 3 years. She is married and has one child under 18.

She will use the loan to invest in new and varied clothes and sandals. Aleyda sells food and Rosa sells different Avon cosmetcs.

loans.use: to buy new and varied clothes and sandals

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
SERGIO: Es un señor cordial de 35 años de edad, originario pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, casado con 4 hijos: 3 adolescentes que estudian su secundaria y un pequeño. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia, trabaja de manera informal como pescador artesanal, de esta manera genera sus propios ingresos, para contribuir con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos. Solicita financiamiento, para comprar materiales: mallas galvanizadas, madera, clavo, para la reparación de las nasas y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Distribuye los mariscos y pescados a una empresa pesquera del municipio. El sueña con tener su propio centro de acopio de mariscos. 

En la fotografía lo acompaña uno de sus hijos.

loans.use: comprar materiales: mallas galvanizadas, madera, clavo, para la reparación de las nasas y cubrir los costos de mano de obra.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married and has two children.She lives in Tandika in Dar es Salaam.Rehema had a training in tailoring offered by a Baptist Church in Dar es Salaam.She runs a tailoring business,specialised in women and children clothes.She had employed one assistant in her business.She is planning to expand her business by adding two sewing machines and one more assistant.
Rehema also sells eggs as a subsidiary business.She buys eggs from poultry keepers and resell them in retail.She also need to improve this business by adding trays for carrying eggs. To facilitate her two businesses, Rehema is in need of USD 550

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: I am a 25-year-old father of one. I intend to diversify my business to include clothes.

loans.use: Expand my business

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is a farmer in the sector of Salitre. On his farm he cultivates rice and soy beans while also raising cattle. He and his wife work very diligently on the farm in order to feed their two kids who are 8 and 13 years old. His wife also makes cheese and sells milk produced from their cows. Primarily though, they sustain their family with their rice production as most people from the area do. They hope to invest in fertilizer and seeds in order to increase their crop output.

Miguel is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the 10 de enero Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named 10 de enero. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the 10 de enero Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season in the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There are not many financial institutions that provides services to the productive sector of the local economy. The primary access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in the rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Farm Rice

loans.name: Farima

texts.en:
Farima lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with all the members of her family. She is an embroiderer. She works at home because her husband does not allow her to take a shop in the bazaar.

She wants to expand her home business so she wants to take a group loan to buy all the necessary materials to make a good income and help her family. She is excited about this loan.

loans.use: To buy extra materials

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.es:
Maria Irma is from San Nicolás de los Garza, in Nuevo León. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a merchant, however, the income he receives is not sufficient to cover the needs of the family. Three of their children are in school, and it is very difficult to cover their expenses, which is why Maria began her own business four years ago selling fruits and vegetables. Fortunately, her business has grown. She now works in the markets. In order to provide good service, her oldest son, who is 14 years old, helps her.

The desire to give her children a good education has motivated Maria to work harder every day. She is requesting a loan of $250.00, which she will use to buy merchandise, so that she can continue growing her business. She offers to repay the loan in 3 months. Today is the time to help. Decide to contribute to the development of this business and improve the life of this family. They are sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Irma es originaria de San Nicolás de los Garza en Nuevo León, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo es comerciante, sin embargo el ingreso que obtiene es muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, tres de sus hijos están en la escuela y era muy difícil cubrir todos los gastos por lo que Maria inició su propio negocio con la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace cuatro años, afortunadamente ha logrado crecer con su negocio, ahora se instala en los mercados y para poder ofrecer un buen servicio recibe la ayuda de su hijo mayor, de 14 años de edad.

El deseo de darle a sus hijos una buena educación ha motivado a Maria a esforzarse más cada día, ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella ofrece devolver el préstamo en 3 meses. Hoy es tiempo de ayudar, decídete a contribuir al desarrollo de este negocio y mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Senam

texts.fr:
Mrs Senam G. was born in 1978 in Lomé in the prefecture of Golfe and today, has a small business selling rice. She is married and mother of three (3) children. The demands of the household are heavier than her meager income and things are difficult. Her husband, a minister, doesn't contribute enough to the household and despite courage and willingness, her household is prey to daily difficulties. Because of this, she is asking for a loan of $1000 that she will use to increase her business capital and expand her business.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Senam G. est née en 1978 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe et a aujourd’hui un petit commerce de vente de riz. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants et les charges du ménage devenant plus lourdes que le maigre revenu de Madame Senam G., la misère s’est installée dans la famille. Son mari, pasteur, ne contribue pas efficacement aux charges du ménage et malgré son courage et sa volonté son ménage est en proie à des difficultés quotidiennes. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 qu’elle utilisera pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et étendre ainsi son activité.

loans.use: buying and selling of bags of rice

loans.name: Leak

texts.en:
Mr. K. Leak married in 1970 and has three sons and one daughter. He has been in the business of growing rice since 1979, and he also fishes. His spouse, Mrs. Chhum Hean, is currently in the business of making and selling cupcakes at home. She started this business in 2000. All of their sons are married and living in different houses with their families. Only one daughter is living under their custody, but she works at the garment factory.

He is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time, in the amount of $400. He will use this money to purchase a water pumping machine for the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase water pumping machine.

loans.name: Crecia

texts.es:
A characteristic of Mrs Crecia, is the dedication that she brings to her work, as much in the cultivation of her land, as in the breeding of Guinea pigs, thanks to which she earns enough income to satisfy the needs of her home. Some climatic factors damaged her sown fields last year and, on account of this fact, she had large losses. Nevertheless she still maintains that enthusiasm and takes care to make the next crop even more profitable. Crecia is very determined at the moment to set goals and, in spite of the fact that she now also works breeding Guinea pigs, she needs to prepare her land for cultivation. To once more take up her work as a farmer and to work her lands, she requests the aid of your noble heart.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva volunteer

Una característica de doña Crecia, es la dedicación que le otorga a sus labores, tanto en sus terrenos de cultivo, como en la crianza de cuyes, gracias a las cuales obtiene ingresos económicos para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar.Algunos factores climáticos perjudicaron sus sembríos el año pasado y a causa de este hecho tuvo grandes pérdidas. Sin embargo aún mantiene ese entusiasmo y esmero para hacer de la próxima cosecha una de las más rentables.Crecia es muy decidida al momento de plantearse metas y a pesar de dedicarse por ahora a la crianza de cuyes, tiene la necesidad de producir sus terrenos de cultivo. Para retomar sus labores como agricultora y trabajar en sus terrenos, solicita la ayuda de vuestro noble corazón.

loans.use: To prepare land for cultivation

loans.name: Alejandra Marisol

texts.es:
Alejandra Q. is a hard working lady who has for the past 5 years worked selling fruits such as apple, grapes, and pears at the market of Bisne in Chinandega. Sometimes this business forces her to sell her products walking through the streets because, even though she has a section at the market, when the sales are low, she finds ways of selling in the streets of the city.

Because of her lack of resources, Mrs. Alejandra has a great need to invest in her business to increase her profits. This is the reason she has sought support from Ceprodel, obtaining loans, which she has directly invested in buying apples, grapes and pears, allowing her to support herself through her hard work day to day.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Alejandra Q. es una dama muy trabajadora que desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de frutas como manzanas, uvas y peras en el mercado el Bisne de Chinandega. En ocasiones este negocio le obliga a que venda sus productos ambulante ya que a pesar de tener su tramo en el mercado, al estar bajas las ventas busca la manera de cómo vender en las calles de la ciudad.

Una gran necesidad que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado la señora Alejandra es que debido a sus bajos recursos económicos no ha logrado invertir en su negocio para percibir mas ingresos. Es por este motivo que se ha apoyado de Ceprodel, obteniendo prestamos que los ha invertido directamente en la compra de las manzanas, uvas y peras de este modo es que todos los días se gana la vida muy esforzadamente.

loans.use: Buying fruit (Compra de las frutas)

loans.name: Satupaitea Pitonuu - Group 1

texts.en: Satupaitea Pitonuu Centre started in December of last year.  The first group of women who joined and were trained with the program are largely from households subsisting on fishing activities.  The husbands and sons fish while the female members of the household sell the catch.  Kirisitina F., the leader of this group, heard about the savings and loans services of SPBD and started motivating ladies in her village to join the program. They aspire to improve their fishing equipment to bring in better catches in the future.  They have undergone the four week training and have submitted their business plans and budgets for their initial loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase a wooden canoe for fishing, swimming shoes, goggles, spears and nets

loans.name: Zeboniso

texts.ru:
Zeboniso Mirzoevna N. lives in the Fayzabad region. She is 43 years old, married and has six children. She has a secondary technical education. She is now in the clothing retail business and has a vendor space on the central market of Fayzabad. She has more than five years experience in this business. There is no other work in the area so she has to support her family on her own. This business is the only source of income for the family. Zeboniso wants to buy seasonal clothing at this time and decided to apply for a loan to increase the variety of her store. She plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Назарова Зебонисо Мирзоевна проживает в районе Файзабад. Возраст 43 года, замужем , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее техническое.Клиентка занимается куплей продажей одежды .Торгует на центральном рынке района Файзабад. Имеет опыт в бизнесе более 5 лет . Так как работы в районе нет,ей приходится самой содержать такую большую семью. Бизнес является единственным исчтоником дохода семьи.В данный момент Зебонисо хочет завести сезонную одежду для продажи. Зебонисо решила взять кредит для увеличения ассортимента магазина.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi N. sells foodstuffs. She is married and has four children. She wants to increase her income because her husband’s income is insufficient to meet the needs of the family. To do so, she needs more stock.

She is asking for $325 as additional capital to buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her food sales.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 37-year-old father of one child. He lives with his family in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Hussein sews curtains. This is the sixth time he has applied to Al Majmoua for a loan. He needs to buy material to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy material for his curtain business

loans.name: Okeke

texts.en:
Okeke A. is 35-years-old and is married with three children. She lives in ojo Igbede, Lagos state, Nigeria.

She sells televisions and stereos in the Alaba international market. Okeke has been in this business since 1997 after three months of training in the business. She is requesting a loan to buy more televisions and stereos so that she can improve in her business inventory, thereby increasing her sales and profit margin.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventories of televisions and stereos for resale

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty I. is 40 years old and married with 8 children. She and her family live in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She sells second-hand clothes. She has been in this business since 1990 and she learned this business for 10 months from a friend. She needs the loan amount of US$ 700 to buy more second-hand clothes for re-sale. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Nurmahmad

texts.en:
Nurmahmad E. is 37 years old. He is married with two school-age children. At first Nurmahmad worked as a car driver. But what he earned was not enough to feed his family. That’s why 10 years ago he decided on also running a farming business.

Nurmahmad is a strong man who works hard every day to obtain a good harvest, never wasting a moment of valuable time. Thanks to his efforts he has been able to provide for the well-being and education of his family. Nurmahmad grows potatoes, onions, and carrots. He feels fortunate to have the opportunity to obtain some financing for his lands. He plans to invest in seeds and some pesticides.

For this reason Nurmahmad is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni (1175 USD) for the term of 10 months. The loan will help him avoid borrowing from informal lenders who charge way too much and take a large part of the profits he makes from his crops. He expresses his gratitude to everyone who decided to support him.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and some pesticides for growing seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=35911&_tpos=2&_tpg=1

Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos. Isabel es casada, tiene 56 años y 4 hijos, Isabel tiene una imprenta en un local alquilado ubicado a 1 cuadra del parque principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos que le ayudan en sus tiempos libres, Isabel realiza diferentes trabajos de imprenta como impresión, elaboración de recuerdos para diferentes compromisos, tarjetas, la atención en su negocios es desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, Isabel hace 2 meses compro una maquina que le permitirá realizar otros trabajos novedosos, pero aun le falta algunas maquinas para implementar su imprenta.

Isabel necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de recordatorios, tarjetas y guillotina. Los sueños de Isabel son implementar su imprenta con maquinarias modernas, ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Empecemos Communal Bank. Isabel is married, 56 years old, and has 4 children. Isabel has a printing business, which she runs with the help of her children, who help her in their free time. She rents a shop one block from the main park in the city of Ayacucho. Isabel does different types of printing, such as impression, production of souvenirs for various events, and cards. Her business is open from 8 in the morning until 8 at night. Two months ago, Isabel purchased a machine that enables her to produce new kinds of products, but she still wants some other machines to expand her printing.

Isabel needs a loan of 2500 Peruvian Soles, which she will invest in purchasing cards and a paper cutter. Isabel's dreams are to set up her printing shop with modern machines, expand her business, and that her children become professionals.

First Loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=35911&_tpos=2&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in purchasing cards and a paper cutter

loans.name: Neak

texts.en:
Mrs. Neak H. is a villager in Trapeang Pring Village in the Takeo Province. She is 36 years old and the mother of two children. Both of her children attend the local school.

She has a small grocery business and she is also a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Heng Sreng, repairs bikes. Though both work, they still have poor living conditions.

In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Neak H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

Mr. Heng Sreng is also in the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy pig food.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarin O., 52, is a local farmer who has been growing rice and vegetables for income for about 20 years. She is married and has no children. Her husband, Mr. Mean Meas, is 64 years old and is a local carpenter who makes tables, chairs and beds for sale. They live in Loloksar Commune, Pursat Province.

Sarin needs to have two oxen to use to help her work by plowing the field; hence, she is deciding to seek a loan of $350 to make that possible.

loans.use: To purchase two oxen

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Madame Akossiwa A. est âgée de quarante deux ans (42), elle vend des articles de mercerie dans le quartier d’adidogomé awatame. Elle fait cette activité depuis 2005 et a déjà obtenu un crédit de 150 000 de WAGES qu’elle a remboursé sans difficultés. La demande est très forte surtout en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d’année. Elle sollicite un deuxième crédit qui lui permettra de s’approvisionner en articles de mercerie pour convenablement répondre à la demande.
Madame AFAMEHE a deux (02) enfants et est mariée à FOLLY Ata qui est un électricien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akossiwa A. is 42 years old, she sells sewing supplies in the neighborhood of Adidogomé Awatame. She has practiced this activity since 2005 and has already received a loan of 150,000 from WAGES that she paid back in full. The demand is very high especially at this time of end of the year festivities. She is requesting a second loan that will allow her to stock up on sewing supplies in order to meet the demand. Mrs. AFAMEHE has two children and is married to Ata FOLLY who is an electrician.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing articles

loans.name: Okil

texts.en: Okil A. is 60 years old and married with six children.  He has worked as a taxi driver in Isfara, Tajikistan, for over a year but previously spent many years working as a bus driver.  Okil is committed to good customer service is keen to improve and expand his business every year.  Currently his taxi needs thorough repairs in order to effectively transport customers through Isfara's narrow streets.  In order to pay for the general repairs to his vehicle, Okil is requesting a loan of $1,025.

loans.use: To pay for general repairs to taxi.

loans.name: Sefelmira

texts.es:
Aunque Sefelmira ha estado recibiendo los préstamos de EDAPROSPO desde más de un año. Desde mayo del año pasado abandono su anterior negocio, la producción de sandalias, por que ya no le era rentable. Ahora se dedica a la fabricación de bolsitas de plástico y cartón, y a cualquier otro trabajo se presente. Normalmente trabaja en una fábrica, pero a veces se lleva las bolsitas a casa para avanzar el trabajo por la noche.

A sus cuarenta y cuatro años Sefelmira tiene que arreglársela como puede, con varios trabajos. Entre su esposo, su hijo mayor y ella son propietarios de tres mototaxis, que a través de muchos sacrificios gozan de sus ingresos, trabajándolos ellos mismos o alquilándolos.

Más adelante le gustaría poder abrir una tienda para tener unos ingresos más estables y asegurar un futuro para su familia.
texts.en:
Even though Sefelmira has been receiving loans from EDAPROSPO for more than one year, she closed down her previous sandal production business last May because it was no longer profitable. She now makes paper and plastic gift bags, as well as takes any other job that arises, for a living. She normally works in a factory, but sometimes she takes the bags home so that she can make progress on her work at night.

At 44 years of age, Sefelmira has to sort it out as best she can with several jobs. Between her husband, her eldest son and her, they own three motorcycle taxis, which, after many sacrifices, now produce profits for them. They work with the vehicles themselves or sometimes they rent them out.

In the future, she would like to be able to open up her own store so that she can earn a steady income and secure a bright future for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle taxi maintenance

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en: Augusta I. is 60 years old and married with 6 children. She has a tailoring shop where she sews lovely clothes for her customers. She also sells tailoring materials to her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of N 150,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials for re-sale

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda L., 35, is a resident of Laredico, Salawagan, Quezon.To complement her husband's income, she engaged in a hog fattening  business and, at the same time, processes native delicacies such as puto (rice cakes), botse (baked goods with coconut filling), siopao and siakoy (sweetened bread formed into a braid). Recently, she received a loan from HSPFI amounting to PHP 15000, which she used to purchase 6 piglets (3 are seen in the picture) to fatten and feed for the animals' daily consumption.  Her long term goal for her business is to improve the cages for long use in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets and feeds for animals' daily consumption

loans.name: Oluwole

texts.en: Oluwole Shogbesan is 41 years old and married with three children. He sells spare generator parts. He is requesting a  loan in the amount of N100,000 ($700 USD) to purchase additional parts to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase generator parts to resell

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mme A. Afi est née le 31/12/1973 à Tsévié. Mariée, elle est mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de riz préparée grâce à laquelle elle subvient aux besoins de la famille. Afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires, elle sollicite un financement pour stocker du riz en vue de satisfaire régulièrement sa clientèle et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Afi A. was born on December 31, 1973 in Tsévié. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Her principal business is selling cooked rice, which allows her to cover family expenses. So as to increase her turnover, she is requesting a loan to stock up on rice which will allow her to regularly satisfy the needs of her clientele and improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: preparation and sale of cooked rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise agouti

loans.name: Asatillo

texts.ru: Буриев Асатилло проживает в городе ТУрсун-заде. Возраст 42 года, замужем и имеет пятерых детей.Имеет высшее образование . По специальности зооинженер. Проработал четыре года. В данный момент работает в сельском хозяйстве. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить качественные семена и удобрения для посева. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 10 лет.Получаемый урожай он использует для продажи на рынке , но часть продуктов оставляет своей семье  с запасом.
texts.en:
Asatillo B. lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. He is 42 years old, married and has five children. Asatillo has a bachelor's degree in Veterinary Engineering and four years of job experience. For the last 10 years he has been making his living as a farmer. He sells most of his harvest at the market, but keeps some of the produce for his family's own needs. Asatillo has applied for this loan in order to buy quality seeds and fertilizer for the spring planting.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Soda

texts.fr:
soda F. est une femme commerçante qui habite au quartier cité lamy de thies ,elle est mariée et est mère de trois enfants;son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des parfums et de l'encens
elle sollicite ce pret pour renforcer son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Soda F. is a merchant who lives in the Cité Lamy district of Thies. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Her business consists in buying and selling perfumes and incense.

She is requesting this loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling perfumes

loans.name: Ghazala Liaqat Group

texts.en:
Ghazala baji, wife of L., has resided in the city of Lahore, Pakistan, for the past ten years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods.

Ghazala baji is a very active lady. She performs her duties and manages her family very effectively. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community. People are used to coming to him for groceries because of the reasonable prices and good quality. She is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to advance her husband’s grocery shop. 

This loan consists of four additional people: 

Nasira baji wants a loan to buy plastic water bottles to sell.

Farzana baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Salma baji wants a loan to buy another water-buffalo for her animal-selling business.

Shagufta baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies (pipes, taps) to sell.

In the photo, Ghazala baji is standing in the center of the group, showing her member Salma baji’s water-buffalo.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Shelaw Group

texts.en:
Shelaw wants to take out a loan for her beauty salon. Ahmeda wants to take out a loan for her husband who does animal husbandry. Malali wants to take out a loan for a tailoring business, and Torpayki wants to take out a loan for her embroidery business.

Shelaw is the leader of the Shelaw group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take out a loan for the progress of their business: to make it larger. They have requested a group loan 40,000 afghani. They are saying that Kiva is the best loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For a beauty salon

loans.name: Awoussi

texts.fr: cette femmme est une résidente du quartier de gbossimé à Lomé, elle est mariée et est mère de 02 enfants, elle fait le commerce de sacs de maïs, voulant agrandir son commerce elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 30 sacs de maïs, elle vend son produit dans le marché local de son quartier.
texts.en:
This is a woman who resides in the Gbossimé district in Lomé. She is married and the mother of two children. She has a business selling corn. However, wanting to expand her commerce, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 30 sacks of corn. She sells her merchandise at the local marketplace in her district.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For buying sacks of corn

loans.name: Mateo Miguel

texts.es: Don Mateo Miguel T. T., cuanta con 30 años de edad es casado actualmente vive con sus tres hijos y con su esposa se dedica a la artesanía en la elaboración de cortes típicos, y se cuenta en el lugar conosido como caserío Chuipachaj de la Aldea Chipuac del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán cuenta con un pequeño taller elaborando esta producción no cuenta con operarios por la situación de sus ingresos que no son suficientes y la demanda actual a la que presenta a crecido por tal motivo se acerco a las oficinas de la Asociacion ASDIR  para adquirir un pequeño préstamo así poder comprar materia prima, para la ampliación de capital generando empleo y mas productos de su pequeño taller ayudando a generar mejor sus ingresos a si darles una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Mateo Miguel T. T. is 30 years old, married, and has three children. He is dedicated to the art of making traditional fabrics from his small workshop in the village of Chuipachaj de la Aldea Chipuac, which is in the town and district of Totonicapán. He does not generate enough revenue to hire any workers. However, his current demand is growing, so he visited the offices of Asociación ASDIR in order to secure a small loan to purchase raw materials. The increase in capital will result in more employment and more products from his small workshop, as well as generate additional income to give his family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Tchotcho

texts.fr: Cette dame assure seule l’éducation scolaire de ses 02 enfants. Elle habite le quartier de Bè-Souza à Lomé. En 2000, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de sacs de maïs, parce qu’elle était débordée par les besoins de sa famille. Cette activité lui a donc permis, non seulement de se prendre en charge, mais aussi de subvenir aux besoins de sa progéniture. Elle a loué un entrepôt de vente de maïs  qui lui réussit bien ces temps-ci. Elle arrive à maîtriser peu à peu les rouages de ce commerce ; mais elle a un besoin criant de renouveler son stock, c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES. Elle est persuadée que ce prêt apportera un changement positif dans son commerce.
texts.en:
This lady by herself ensures that her two children are educated.  She lives in the Bè-Souza district in Lomé.  In 2000, she started doing commerce in sacks of corn because she was overwhelmed by family needs.  Her business enables her not only to support herself but also to provide for her offspring.  She has leased a warehouse for selling corn, and this has been very successful for her recently.  She's managing to master all the fine points of this business;  but she has a glaring need to renew her inventory;  this is why she's requesting a WAGES loan.  She is convinced this loan will bring a positive change to her commerce. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Ile

texts.en: Ile M. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread  and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking flour materials.  Ile is 32 years old and is Married with a husband that is a driver. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more baking flour

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca, who is 54 years old, manages a fish pond business within her village. She is widowed and has been blessed with four children but all of them are already married.

Francisca would like to develop her fish pond so that she is able to earn a bigger profit for her family needs. In this regard, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders. She will be glad if this loan amount is granted.

loans.use: To develop her fish pond

loans.name: Zahir

texts.en: Zahir has been in the food sales business for 3 years. He was born in 1988, is single, and lives in the Fuzuli region. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: to buy foodstuufs to sell

loans.name: Amilita

texts.en:
Amilita P. is from the village of Bobontugan, Jasaan Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Amilita is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Amilita owns a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Amilita has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Amilita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. Amilita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Amilita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy, 43 years old, farms rice for a living. She is married and has four children. Her oldest child is now 24 years old. She used to borrow from individuals who charged high interest. She was not able to save because of it. When she heard of CEVI, she immediately joined and was fortunate to qualify as a member. She is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. She will also buy gasoline for her tractor. This loan will help Lucy finance her farm, and she will also be able to save because of the loan interest offered at CEVI.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Saniya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Saniya sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Fantombougou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de commerce. 
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci d’avoir constamment un appui financier pour leurs activités. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents  ont été correctement remboursés. 
Quant à l’utilisation de ce nouveau prêt, elles  comptent acheter, une grande quantité de tubercules auprès des revendeurs venant de Sikasso, des condiments alimentaires  en gros à Bamako pour la restauration. 
Elles effectuent leurs ventes  sur place au marché de Fana et au bord du goudron à la sortie de la ville (au niveau du poste de contrôle) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles estiment réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de  45.000FCFA  par mois. Les bénéfices sont partagés entre la nourriture,  la santé et  les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Saniya group are married women who average 35-years-old with 3 children. With their husband and children, they live in large traditional families in the Fantomougou village, in the Fana district of the Mali Republic. They know each other through neighbor and work connections. They collaborate with the microfincance institution Soro Yiriwaso, taking care to always have financial support for their activities. They are on their tenth loan together and have repaid all of their previous loans in full. With this new loan, they count on buying a large quantity of tubers from vendors in Sikasso and wholesale food condiments in Bamako for catering. They make their sales at the Fana market and on the sidewalk at the edge of the village (at the border control checkpoint) to both male and female customers.They estimate making a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA. The profits are shared and go toward food, health, and social activities.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tubers and condiments

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji P. is currently in the business of selling cooked food in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer and sodas to sell.  Keji is 28 years old and is married. Her  husband is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock crates of beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Josefa del Carmen G. Garcia de 38 años de edad, es casada y con su esposo, viven en la comunidad el Edén, su esposo trabaja como agricultor y guarda de seguridad, ellos tienen 3 hijos de las edades de 18, 13 y 9 años, el mayor trabaja y le apoya en los gastos del hogar los otros dos estudian y en las horas libres le apoyan en los trabajos de la tierra, para un futuro la señora Josefa planea comprar un vehículo para transportar las cosechas, se dedican a la agricultura desde hace 21 años y las dificultades que se les han presentado han sido la  falta de agua potable en la zona, ella cuenta con agua en su hogar cada 10 a 12 días, esto es por la zona marginada donde habita la familia, aun así ellos no deja de trabajar por mejorar sus condiciones de vida, agradecería le apoyaran en la compra de mayores insumos tales como fertilizantes, para brindarle un mejor mantenimiento a sus tierras con este crédito venderían la cosecha de forma rápida pudiendo recuperar lo invertido y captando las utilidades para nuevas inversiones a futuro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa del Carmen G. Garcia is 38 years old, married and lives with her husband in the community of El Eden; her husband works as a farmer and security guard. They have 3 children, ages 18, 13 and 9; the oldest works and helps with the household expenses; the other two go to school and in their free time they help working the land. In the future, Mrs. Josefa plans to buy a vehicle to transport their crops; she has been working in agriculture for 21 years, and one the biggest challenges she has faced is the lack of drinking water in the area; she only get water in her house every 10-12 days because her family lives in a marginal zone. In spite of the challenges, they have not stopped working to improve their living conditions; she would appreciate the support in buying more consumables such as fertilizers to improve the management of her land. With this loan, she would sell her corps faster allowing her to recover her investments and to earn profits for new investments in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies to maintain her crops

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace O. is a 38-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay Linao, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns a living through her general store, buying and selling rice grains, and swine fattening.  Grace’s 41-year-old husband Larry works as a laborer and carpenter.  They have 2 children ages 11 and 17 who currently go to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Grace joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income with the general store and swine fattening. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000.

Grace is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 was used to fund operations for her general store and had a positive impact on both the business and her family living conditions. This will be her 24th loan and she will use the PHP 24,000 to further grow her business.  Grace is working hard to achieve her dreams for her family,  to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for general store.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Danaya ont en moyenne  29 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Wela, un des villages relevant de la sous-préfecture de Konobougou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  les céréales et les fruits et légumes
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  3 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  1 fût d’huile alimentaire, des poivres, des tomates fraîches, des oignons, des aubergines et quelques chargements de fruits et légumes. 
 Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et  à Konobougou. Elles effectuent leurs ventes, à Wela, au marché de Konobougou ville et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Danaya Group, on average, are 29 years old and have two children. All of them live in extended traditional families in Wela, one of the villages in the subprefecture of Konobougou, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They have known each other through family ties and are active in buying and selling food products, such as condiments, cereals, fruit and vegetable. After having repaid their previous three loans on schedule, the women of Danaya Group apply for their fourth solidarity loan which they will use to buy one barrel of edible oil, sweet peppers, fresh tomatoes, onions, eggplants and a few cartloads of fruit and vegetable. They get their supplies in Bamako, the capital of Mali, and in Konobougou. They retail their goods in Wela, at the market of Konobougou and at the surrounding trade fairs, for cash and credit, to a clientele made up of women and men. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 CFA francs each. They will spend part of their profit on healthcare, food and school fees and reinvest part of it in their businesses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
el señor Modesto G. tiene 47 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos estan en la escuela. Su mujer trabaja en una empacadora de camaron y le ayuda con algunos gastos del hogar.
Modesto se dedica a atender una pulperia que tiene en su casa de habitacion desde hace 2 años, sus ventas son diarias de lunes a domingo, vende productos tales como arroz, maiz, harina, refrescos, jugos, lacteos, embutidos, agua en bolsa y otros.
esta solicitando el credito para la compra de abarroteria en general al por mayor, asi los compra mas baratos y obtiene mayores ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cumplir con todas sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Modesto G., 47, lives with his partner; they have 4 children, two of whom are in school. His wife works at a shrimp packing plant and contributes to household expenses. Modesto has had a grocery store in his home for the last 2 years. He is open for business seven days a week; he sell such things as: rice, corn, flour, soft-drinks, dairy products, cured meats, bags of water, etc. He is asking for funds to buy groceries in general at wholesale so that he can get them for a lower price and earn higher profits when he sells them; he needs these profits to meet all his obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, tortillas, coffee, batteries, matches, candles, rice, soups, pasta, sauces.

loans.name: Talaileva

texts.en:
Talaileva S. is 49 and married with 6 children (ages 2 - 10).  She owns a business venture, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Talaileva has 2 years of experience in this business.  Talaileva needs a loan of WST $1500 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Talaileva joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Talaileva's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

"The following social metrics for Talaileva S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.6 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Alicia Marina

texts.es:
Alicia J. es socia del banco Comunal  El Mirador, ella  vive en el centro de la parroquia Turi que quiere decir “hermano” en quichua, sus atardeceres son muy hermosos ya que ésta comunidad se encuentra ubicada sobre una colina empinada proporcionando una vista espectacular de las luces de la ciudad en la tarde y noche así como de la cadena montañosa que la rodea.

Nuestra socia tiene 36 años  se encuentra casada y fruto de su amor engendró tres hijos  que  se encuentran de 16, 15, 13 años todos estudiantes de colegio, su esposo es empleado domestico, en cambio  Alicia tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres hace diez años  en ella atiende desde las 6 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m.,  y los ratos libres también se dedica a la cría de pollos que luego los vende pelados y también tiene gallinas ponedoras y comercializa sus huevos, con el esfuerzo de su unión conyugal han construido su casa propia.

Lleva tres ciclos en su banco comunal  con los créditos recibidos ha comprado sus animales poco apoco, ahora con el nuevo crédito va a adquirir arroz, azúcar, sal, aceite, atún, artículos de limpieza y aseo personal para abastecerla e incrementarla un poco más,  su meta es comprarse un auto  y seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Alicia J. is a member of the El Mirador (The Lookout) communal bank. She lives in the middle of Turi, which means “brother” in Quechua, parish. Its sunsets are beautiful because this community is located on a steep hillside which provides a spectacular view of the city lights in the late evening and night as well as of the mountains surrounding it. Alicia is 36 years old, married, and has three children, who are 16, 15 and 13 years of age; all are students. Her husband is a domestic employee. Alicia has had a small grocery store for the past 10 years that she opens for business from 6am to 8pm. During her free time she raises chickens, that she later sells dressed, as well as laying hens that produce eggs for sale. She, together with her husband, has made it possible for them to build their own house. She has been in three loan cycles with her communal bank and has used her loans to gradually buy her animals. She will use the new loan to buy rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil, tuna, cleaning supplies and personal hygiene items to stock her store a bit more. Her goal is to buy a car and to continue to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil, tuna, cleaning supplies, personal hygiene items.

loans.name: Dith

texts.en: Dith K. is 54 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She grows and sells vegetables at the local market to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 2 in profit a day, whilst her husband is a construction worker. On average, he makes US$ 3 per day. This couple has six children; two are in school and three are employed as garment factory workers. Dith K. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase wood to finish her construction.

loans.use: house improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase yam heads

loans.name: Bulowooza B Nabirye Irene Group

texts.en: N. Irene, a hardworking businesswoman, is 28 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. She has been running a business selling used clothes for over one year. She is using the loan to purchase a stock of used clothes for sale. She is a promising businesswoman whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of used clothes for sale

loans.name: Penh

texts.en:
Penh S., 38, is widowed and lives with her two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products.

S. sells groceries for a gross income of about USD 10 per day. She is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase piglets to raise and pig feed.

In the future, S. would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and pig feed

loans.name: Honest People Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Honest People” group. They are small-scale-business people based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profits and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Mabinty K. who is pictured on the left. She is age thirty and was born in Makeni. She is married with one child. Her husband is a businessman and her child is in primary school.

Mabinty has been in business for fifteen years now. She sells used-clothes for men, women and children. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy bales of used clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy bales of used-clothes for men, women and children

loans.name: Rosemela

texts.en:
Rosemela D. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 42 years old. Rosemela is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemela owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste and also selling and dealing products from different suppliers in the local community. Rosemela has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosemela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rosemela is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosemela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & for working capital for her store

loans.name: Martina  Onjak

texts.en:
Martina Onjak, 41, is married to James O., a businessman in Kehancha, a border town in Western Kenya. They have five children aged between 18 and 12 years old; the first born is in college while the youngest is in fourth grade.

Martina runs a hotel in Kehancha, near the administrative offices. Her clientele consists mainly of people working in the administrative offices and market shoppers. She prepares local popular dishes such as fish and omena (small fish). She has operated the business for the last 13 years and plans to use her fourth loan from Kadet Limited to expand her business by buying more foodstuffs such as sugar, flour and fish. She also plans to expand her other business of textile making.

Her future plan is to invest in rental houses by constructing them in Kehancha, where there is demand. With this, she believes the family income will increase.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff for the hotel business.

loans.name: Chicken Wing And Dry Goods Group

texts.en:
Alex N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of two borrowers called Chicken Wing and Dry Goods. Alex is 31, married, and has two children who range from 10 to 13 years old.

He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support.

For 8 years, he has been selling pig feet in Duala Market in Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 25,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 55,000 Liberian dollars business loan to buy more cartons of pig feet.

He describes himself as determined. His goal is to grow his business, make a profit, and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of pig feet.

loans.name: Paul Ndungu

texts.en:
Paul Ndungu M. is a 44 year old taxi operator along the busy Thika road area. He offers transport services to neighbors and passersby within his area of operation. He is able to make a profit of Kshs 20,000 per month and this is able to provide for his family's needs, which includes his wife and three children. He has been operating the taxi for the last three years.

Paul joined KADET after introduction by other clients, and he has applied for a loan which he will use to spruce up his taxi van and thus attract more clients to use his vehicle.

Paul hopes to expand his business to other markets and own and manage a fleet of taxi vehicles.

loans.use: To spruce up his taxi vehicle.

loans.name: Reyner

texts.es:
Reyner A. OC. es un joven  de apenas 18 años de edad que vive en  Hernández de Alajuela.  Su familia siempre se ha dedicado a la ganadería de Doble propósito. A pesar del amor que le tiene al negocio familiar el ha decidido ir  a la universidad, y para hacerlo el necesita un préstamo de ¢599,000 (quinientos noventa y nueve  mil colones)   para  comprar ganado de doble propósito y así tener un negocio que le permita pagar sus estudios de Ingeniería agrónoma.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será primer prestamos es asegura que es de mucha motivación tener un préstamo de Kiva.
texts.en:
Reyner A. OC., a young man who just turned 18, lives in Hernández de Alajuela. His family has always raised dual-purpose cattle [for milk and meat]. Despite his love for his family's business, he has decided to attend university. In order to do so, he needs a loan of ¢599,000 (five hundred, ninety-nine thousand colones) to buy dual-purpose cattle. In this way, he will have a business that will allow him to pay for his studies in agricultural engineering. He is a member of the "Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo," ["United Communal Credit Enterprise for Development"] one of EDESA's 100 communal banks in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he is very excited to receive a Kiva loan.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cows (for milk and meat)

loans.name: Lider Ruales

texts.es:
Lider Ruales L. tiene 45 anos. Es casado y vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 8 hijos de edades 25 hasta 7 anos.
