Lider es un socio de la ventanilla rural Progreso Comunitario, que está ubicada a dos horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

A Lider se dedica al cultivo de cacao y cría chanchos. Realiza las compras de sus productos en Babahoyo y las ventas de sus productos en Mata de Cacao. Solicita el crédito para mejorar el cacao y comprar más chanchos. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría mejorar sus cultivos. Su sueno es mejorar su vivienda. A veces se desafía por las plantas que se mueren por una enfermedad que se llama ¨el machete.¨ 

Le gusta jugar el boli e ir a los gallos.
texts.en:
Lider Ruales L. is 45 years old.  He is married and lives in the Chillanes canton in Bolivar province.  He has 8 children who range from 7 to 25 years of age.  

Lider is a member of the rural communal bank "Progreso Comunitario," which is located 2 hours from Chillanes.  There are 11 members in all, and the majority of them cultivate cocoa or have their own small businesses.

Lider has a business cultivating cocoa and raising pigs.  He buys his products in Babahoyo, and sells his products in Mata de Cacao.  He requests a loan to improve his cocoa plantings and to buy more pigs.  With the support of this loan he will be able to improve his crops.  His dream is to improve his house.  At times he faces challenges because the plants die from a disease that is called "el machete." 

He enjoys playing volleyball and going to cockfights.

loans.use: to improve his cocoa plantings and to buy more pigs

loans.name: Rasheedan's Group

texts.en:
Rasheedan is a 52-year-old housewife who lives with her family in a three-room brick house in Faisalabad, an industrial city well known for its textile products. She is married to M. R. who has a business selling stamp papers (used for legal documentation). He has been operating this business for the past five years. 

Rasheedan is the mother of two sons who work in a textile mill. Rasheedan couldn’t educate her children due to poor financial conditions – that’s why they are unable to find good jobs and work for very little income. 

Rasheedan has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With this loan, her husband will buy stamp papers in larger quantity for reselling. She is hopeful that her husband will get a good outcome from this loan investment and his income will improve. 

Rasheedan is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed a meeting. In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Rasheedan.

loans.use: To buy stamp papers in larger quantity for reselling

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old single man living with his parents in Lebanon. He has more than fifteen years of experience in car repair and has run his own small repair shop for three years. His shop is situated in a busy area so he has been able to gain many customers and help his father with the household expenses. With his loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he wants to increase his capital and buy needed equipment. In the future, he hopes to diversify and sell car oil in his shop.

loans.use: purchase needed equipment

loans.name: Noonkuta Ene

texts.en:
Noonkuta Ene L. is 42 years old and married to Moses L.. They have two children. Noonkuta is a farmer and she does the farming on her own piece of land, which she has been doing for the last thirteen years.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered as members in KADET. This will be her third loan, which she is planning to spend preparing the land for planting tomatoes. Tomatoes have been doing well in her area due to good climatic conditions and she hopes to use the profits from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Noonkuta’s dream is build a nice house and educate her children. Despite her age, Noonkuta is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and chemicals.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina A. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 54 years old. Edwina is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Edwina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling Filipino delicacies like homemade sausage or chorizo in the local community. She also buys and sells dried fish. Edwina has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Edwina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edwina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Edwina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients & for working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Edwina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients & for working capital

loans.name: Jjungwe Bukooka Alinyikira Development Group - Mityana

texts.en: 37-year-old S. Salongo's has been affiliated with the Jjungwe Bukooka Alinyikira development group in Mityana for the past decade. His means of subsistence over the course of this decade have been a liquor and beer sales business in Bujungwe. It is a business he began with capital from his earlier charcoal sales business. Diligence and determination are words that describe Salongo. His clientele cut across from wholesalers to hawkers. Salongo is happily married with 8 kids. To supplement his profit from beer sales, he also sells coffee. With this loan, he says he is going to purchase more liquor and crates of beer for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more liquor and crates of beer for resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents. He has owned a barber shop since 2008. His father is the only income provider of the family. He has eight years of experience in the same field and he helps his dad from time to time to get additionA. income. 
Today, he is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase oil bath equipment and tools, which will allow him to provide new needed services to his customers. This will enable him to expand his business by increasing the number of customers and consequently the family’s profits.

loans.use: To purchase oil bath equipment and tools

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil una zona urbana con su esposo. Reparte comida en un pequeño local, a diferentes personas el cual le ha ayudado a mejorar los ingresos de su familia. 

Empezó repartiendo comida con la ayuda de su esposo hasta que consiguió tener un pequeño comedor. Comprando víveres como arroz, frejoles, azúcar y comienza a preparar la comida desde muy temprano hasta que reparte los almuerzos con ayuda de su esposo. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro por eso quiere continuar con su negocio comprando arroz, frejoles, carnes. 

En el futuro quiere tener un restaurante para poder mejorar los ingresos del su familia.
texts.en:
María lives in El Guasmo de Guayaquil, an urban zone, with her husband.  She sells food from a small locale to various people.  This has helped her improve family income.

She started preparing food with her husband’s help until she managed to acquire a small dining room.  Buying foodstuffs like rice, beans and sugar she starts to prepare meals starting very early that she then delivers with help from her husband.  She has a lot of hopes for the future so wants to continue with her business by buying rice, beans and meats.

In the future she wants to have a restaurant to improve her family income.

loans.use: For rice, beans and meats.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice  was born in 1974.  She is a mother of four children.  The youngest is two years old while the eldest is nineteen years . Two of her children are in school, and the other two are not in school because she currently can’t afford to pay all their school fees. Beatrice sells charcoal, and she is requesting a loan in order to buy more sacks of charcoal. She hopes to put her children in school with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: Buying more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Innoncent

texts.en:
Innoncent is 35 years old.  He is married and has two children between 12 months and 3.5 years old. He sells different goods such as lotions, biscuits, sugar, etc. He has been in this business for about ten years.  His shop is open from 8am until 7pm every day except on weekends. His business is well-organized and he employs one other person.

Innoncent has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through adding a variety of goods to sell.

With this loan, Innoncent has a vision of growing his business to the level where he can even start wholesaling. If he starts wholesaling, he hopes to earn more profits than before, which in turn will be used to further reinvest in his business and save for the future.

loans.use: To expand his boutique

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is a married woman who lives in Cadiz, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari store and an electronic re-loading business. Her husband Armando, who is 47 years old, works as a machine operator to earn his living. They have three children who are between 15 and 24 years old. Ronalyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ronalyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her second  loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future house repair. Ronalyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is a married woman with 3 children living in her own house in Hioma, Uganda. For seven years she has been trading in maize and beans. She faces a challenge of inadequate business capital and inthe future, she hopes to set up a store. Vivian needs the loan for to buy maize and beans for seling.

loans.use: Buying maize and beans for selling

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy tools and spare parts for the bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor is married to Mr. Korb and they have four children.  One is a construction worker, another one is employed in a garment factory, and the others are studying in the local public school.
Mrs. Nhor is a scarf weaver who earns some income to support her family while her husband is a traditional medicine man and a farmer who owns a small piece of land.  He grows rice to sell to support his family. In the rice field it is time for plowing, but Mrs. Nhor can’t plow her field because she does not have enough oxen to plow.  To improve rice production, Mrs. Nhor would like a loan to buy an ox for plowing.

loans.use: to buy an ox

loans.name: Juana Rosario

texts.es: Juana Rosario tiene 59 años, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 5 años en su negocio, pero ha sido una persona muy responsable y que disfruta de actividad pues ella se ha caracterizado por brindar un buen servicio. Juana tiene que levantarse temprano pues la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a ver los diferentes productos que ofrece a sus vecinos, familiares, amigos y público en general. El motivo de este crédito es para la compra de perfumes, calzado, ropa en general, lociones, cremas y tratamientos.
texts.en: Juana Rosario is 59 years old and sells general merchandise.  She has had this business for more than 5 years, and she is a very responsible person who enjoys her work and is known for providing good service.  Juana has to get up early, since she has customers arriving to see the different products that she offers to her neighbors, relatives, friends and to the public in general.  She will use this loan to purchase perfumes, footwear, clothing in general, lotions, creams and hair treatments.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, footwear, clothing in general, lotions, creams and hair treatments.

loans.name: Cruz Maria

texts.es:
Cruz tiene  26 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos menores hijos en una casa propia ubicada en el asentamiento humano (comunidad en desarrollo, de condición pobre) San Martín de Porres de la ciudad de Tambogrande- Piura. Los vecinos de Cruz consideran que ésta es una buena persona y que su familia es muy unida.

El esposo de Cruz se dedica a labores de agricultura, aportando con sus ingresos al sostenimiento familiar. Mientras que Cruz se dedica a vender producto comestibles en una bodega ubicada en su propia casa. Ella cuenta con una clientela ya estable, que son los pobladores de su zona. Además, cuenta con 3 años de experiencia en este negocio.

Cruz solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de 1 lote de mercadería en artículos de primera necesidad (leche, agua, azúcar, aceite, arroz, huevos) para surtir más su negocio e incrementar sus ventas y así seguir creciendo económicamente.

Cruz  es una clienta conocida  de Edpyme Alternativa, tiene un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Cruz, 26, lives with her husband and two minor children in her own house located in the San Martín de Porres Asentamiento Humano (a community in development, in poor condition) in the city of Tambogrande-Piura.  Cruz’s neighbors consider her to be a good person and that her family is very unified.

Cruz’s husband works in farming and contributes income to family support while Cruz sells groceries in a store located in her home.  She has a stable clientele among residents in her area.  Besides, she has three years experience in this business.

Cruz is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan that she’ll use to buy a lot of groceries (milk, water, sugar, oil, rice, eggs) to stock her store and increase sales to continue growing economically.

Cruz is a well-known client of Edpyme Alternativa and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a lot of groceries.

loans.name: Ayidokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOKPO est composé de seize personnes qui habitent la même agglomération et qui exercent la même activité. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Véronique est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Véronique est née en 1962 au  Bénin. Véronique est veuve et vit seule avec ses enfants au Bénin. Véronique a quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont deux sont encore à sa charge. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Véronique vend depuis vingt ans de la tomate fraîche. A côté de cette activité, Véronique vend  aussi de l’huile de palme au Bénin. Véronique s’approvisionne également au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Véronique sollicite  ensemble avec son groupe, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The AYIDOKPO group consists of sixteen people who live in the same area and practice the same activity. This is their first time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activity. 

The group’s representative is Veronique, seen in the photo with her hand raised. She was born in Benin in 1962. Veronique is a widow who lives alone with her children in Benin. She has four children, all of whom have received schooling. Two are still in her care. 

To support herself and her children, Veronique started selling fresh tomatoes twenty years ago. As a secondary activity, she also sells palm oil in Benin, where she acquires her stock. 

Veronica, together with the other group members, is seeking this first loan to achieve customer satisfaction and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy cans of palm oil and baskets of fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Teresa De La Cruz

texts.es: Teresa De la Cruz se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene la edad de 53 años. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella tiene que ofrecer sus productos a de manera ambulante ya que tiene ciertos clientes que le compran sus productos al por mayor,  lo que le resulta mucho más favorable. Es una mujer que logrado adquirir experiencia y que ha enfrentado muchas dificultades como son los problemas de salud ya que algunas veces no puede recorrer lugares muy distantes, pero a pesar de este problema ha luchado por salir adelante. Ella solicita este crédito para capital de materia prima como perfumes, cremas, colonias, ropa, calzado y ropa interior.
texts.en: Teresa De la Cruz sells general merchandise.  She’s 53 years old.  She’s been in this line of work for over 7 years.  She has to sell her goods as a vendor because she has certain customers that buy from her at wholesale which is much more favorable.  She is a woman who has managed to acquire experience and who has faced many difficulties, like health problems, which sometimes keep her from being able to go to distant places.  However, despite this problem she’s striven to get ahead.  She needs this loan to buy raw materials like perfumes, creams, colognes, clothes, footwear and underwear.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cologne, clothes, footwear and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a horse

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor Jose luis tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos uno de ellos esta en edad escolar, jose luis  trabaja en su propio vehículo de transporte desde hace mas de 3 años, cubriendo la ruta Ica- Santiago, el vive en casa propia,el crédito que esta solicitando es para darle mantenimiento a su unidad de transporte tales como cambio de llantas y algunas reparaciones al motor, el sueño que tiene jose luis es con el tiempo adquirir otra unidad de transporta para darlo en alquiler y así generar mas ingresos para su familia, jose luis esta muy agradecido con el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José Luis is 28 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is of school age.

José Luis has been working with his own vehicle for more than three years.  He works the Icá - Santiago route.

José Luis lives in his own home and is requesting this loan to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle.  He will have his tires changed and have some repairs made to his engine.  José Luis' dream is to acquire another vehicle so that he can rent it out and thereby make more income for his family.  He is grateful for the support he has received.

loans.use: to have his maintenance work carried out on his vehicle, to buy tires and to have his vehicle's engine repaired

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 55 years old and married with two children.

Josefa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Josefa has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from a carinderia (restaurant).

Josefa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 34-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with four children between the ages of three and 10 years old.  All are in school apart from the youngest. His wife works with him at his place of business. 

For the past seven years, he has owned a general store selling beans, rice, mineral water, tea leaves and other items. This business has enabled them to meet the needs of their children and improve their standard of living.

He needs a loan to buy more items to sell in store so that he can continue to make a profit.

With future profits, he will begin building a house to rent out so he can earn additional income.

loans.use: to buy items such as beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Katy Belen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Katy Belen; ella tiene 23 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de juguetes y también vende radios y relojes, ella tiene un puesto en el mercado de Urubamba, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de juguetes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar juguetes como pelotas, rompecabezas y muñecas y también para comprar relojes y radios al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Katy belongs to the "Sayhua 3" community bank in the district of Urubamba, department of Cusco, Peru. She is 23 years old, married and has a son. She makes a living selling toys as well as radios and watches at a sales post in the Urubamba market. She works from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m., and the businesses help her make headway for her son. Katy wants to expand her business selling toys and is requesting the loan to purchase items such as balls, puzzles and dolls, as well as buy watches and radios at wholesale. She feels happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase toys such as balls, puzzles and dolls as well as watches and radio at wholesale.

loans.name: Aldrin

texts.en:
Aldrin is married and the father of one school-aged child. The family is settling down in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, where his small piggery is located. He has extra jobs sometimes, but the living resources come primarily from raising these animals. Aldrin has been doing this activity for over two years and is continuing today. He earns a total of about PHP 5.000 a month.

Aldrin joined GDMPC earlier this year to have access to financial services. He is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase swine fattening feeds to augment their growth. When having this done, Aldrin expects to sell them at a higher price, and the profit therein will be used to procure additional piglets to raise and to widen their barred enclosure.

loans.use: To purchase swine fattening feeds to augment their growth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 23 years old and is married with one child. She lives in the Philippines. For the past two years, she has run a retail shop where she sells gasoline by the liter. She is a new HSPFI member. 

Roselyn is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to gallons of gasoline to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline to sell

loans.name: Word Of God Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
In a group of 10 made up of nine women and a man, Augustine, who is 53 years old, leads the group to access the loan capital. He also organizes them for group meetings and ensures that all repayment schedules are met accordingly.

Industrious Augustine is the father of six children who are between 8 and 20 years old. He says all are currently in school.  As the bread winner, Augustine works very hard to ensure that the needs of his family are adequately met. He is into poultry farming.  It is his desire to give all of his children the best education he can afford.  Having been in the poultry rearing business for three years, Augustine intends to save and put up a building to house his family.

Most of the group members are into all kinds of trading activities.  The group requests for a loan amount to enable them to procure goods and raw materials in bulk to revamp their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase poultry feed

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
Entre sartenes, harina y horno caliente  encontramos a Don Jose, un humilde panadero, originario  Madriz departamento localizado en la zona Norte de Nicaragua, pero  tiene 46 años de vivir en la ciudad de León, tiene 60 años de edad, padre de 5 hijos todo ellos independientes. El tiene 45 años de experiencia en este negocio, pues empezó desde muy joven como ayudante de panaderos, el limpiaba sartenes, acomodaba el pan ,también vendía pan después paso a elaborar con sus propias manos el pan, mezclar los diferentes tipos de harina y así fue surgiendo poco a poco hasta que un día logro poner su negocio junto con su  esposa  de panadería el cual tiene 20 años de tenerlo , ella falleció así que le toco hacerse cargo el mismo junto con sus hijos , de esta manera sobrevivió el y su familia a lo largo  de estos años. 
El solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima tales como harina, manteca, levadura, azúcar , queso y leña. Con esta inversión podrá suplir la materia prima que necesita para producir más   y  mejora sus ventas. El desea hacerle unas remodelaciones a su panadería y apoyar a  uno de sus hijos a poner su negocio de panadería.
texts.en:
Among pans, flour, and a hot oven we find Jose, a humble baker.  He is originally from the department of Madriz in the northern region of Nicaragua, but he has lived in the city of León for 46 years.  He is 60 years old and a father of five children, all of whom are independent.  He has 45 years of experience in this business as he started out as a baker's helper when he was very young cleaning pans, arranging bread, and also selling bread.  Later he went on to bake bread with his own hands, mixing different kinds of flour, and from there he progressed little by little until one day he was able to start the bakery business with his wife that he's had for 20 years.  She passed away, and so it was up to him and his children to take charge, which is how he and his family have survived throughout the years.
  
He is asking for this loan to buy raw materials, such as flour, lard, yeast, sugar, cheese, and firewood.  With this investment he will be able to supply the raw material he needs to produce more and to improve his sales.  He wants to remodel his bakery and to help one of his sons to open his own bakery business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as flour, lard, yeast, sugar, cheese, and firewood

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is a 33 year old hard working business man. He is married and blessed with three children. He has been operating Baba Juniour business as a  bread distributor for the last six years. He has employed two people to help him to manage the business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He wants to diversify into puncture repair business and thus he is requesting for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a puncture machine. Since Isaac joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loan funds to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy a puncture machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials like flour, eggs, lard, firewood, and corn.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela de 32 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 3 años donde ofrece servicio y buena calidad. Este ingreso que percibe es para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de hogar y escolares de sus hijos. Es madre y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y un buen nivel académico. Para Manuela su prioridad es bienestar de su familia y mejor atención por tal motivo inicio con su negocio ya que le permitiría realizar los quehaceres del hogar y atender el negocio sin tener que descuidar a sus hijos. Manuela quiere comprar ropa de temporada como lo es pants, blusas de manga larga, suéteres, chamarras de todo tipo de tallas para satisfacer las necesidades de su clienta.
texts.en: Manuela, who is 32 years old, has been selling used clothing for three years, offering service and good quality. The income that she receives goes to help her husband with the household expenses and the schooling of their children. She is the mother of three children to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life and a good level of education. For Manuela, her priority is the well being of her family and to be able to care for her children, so for that reason she began her business, since it would permit her to complete her household duties and tend to her business without having to neglect her children. Manuela wants to buy seasonal clothing such as pants, long-sleeved blouses, sweaters, and jackets of all types and sizes to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the cold season.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 57 years old, married and lives with her three children in Capucao, Ozamis City. For the last 20 years, she has earned about PHP 10,000 a month by farming. Last year, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is requesting loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for her farm. This will be her third loan from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Ana Daisy

texts.es:
Ana, quiere tener otra oportunidad de invertir en el negocio, por eso solicita un prestamo para la compra de maiz, aceite, condimentos, gaseosas, esto para fortalecer el negocio, y para mantener lo necesario para la preparacion de su venta.
Ella considera que su condicion junto a la de su familia han mejorado, siendo ahora mejor que antes, con un negocio más estable.
texts.en:
Ana wants another opportunity to invest in her business, and so she is requesting a loan for purchasing corn, oil, condiments and soda to strengthen her business and to have everything necessary to hand for preparing what she sells.

She considers that her and her family's conditions have improved, and is now feeling better about things than previously, with a business that's more stable.

loans.use: to purchase corn, oil, condiments and sodas.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elena esta solicitando un préstamo ya que ha tenido problemas con el techo de su casa, esta en malas condiciones y cuando llueve a tenido problemas de humedad y con la instalación eléctrica de la casa; es por eso que solicita el crédito y reparar el techo y así estar mas tranquila porque aparte de ya no tener problema con la humedad y la electricidad, esta protegiendo su familia de las enfermedades.
Doña Maria Elena trabaja en limpieza de una casa particular y  su esposo como velador de una compañía, ya que tiene un hijo estudiando en la universidad. Desean que el patrimonio de su hijo este en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Elena is applying for a loan because she has had problems with the roof on her house. It is in bad condition, and when it rains she has problems with moisture and with the house’s electrical system.

She is applying for the loan to repair the roof and, thus, live more peacefully so that she will no longer have problems with moisture or electricity. This will protect her family from illness.

Doña Maria Elena works cleaning a private house, and her husband works as a watchman at a company. They have a son studying at the university. They want their son’s inheritance to be in good condition.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne is 32 years old and is married with three children aged between 3 and 9 years old. He takes care of four dependents. He has two years' experience selling various goods such as: lotions, sugar, soap, toothpaste, cooking oil, etc. The hours of his business are from 6.30am to 5pm per day each week and he currently employs one person to help him. 

Etienne has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase various goods such as: lotions, sugar, soap, toothpaste, cooking oil, etc. to sell. With any profits from the loan, Etienne would like to satisfy his family's basic needs and start saving for his future and he will be able to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as: lotions, sugar, soap, toothpaste, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is a 47-year-old married woman with 7 children. Her children are aged between 12 and 27 years old. Lucena's husband works as a fisherman.

Lucena owns and manages a sari-sari store in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells items like eggs, soap, shampoo, cooking oil, vinegar and canned goods. Lucena also sells vegetables to her community. She earns about 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month from this business.

Lucena has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as vegetables, canned goods and eggs. She hopes this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as vegetables, canned goods and eggs.

loans.name: Jarma

texts.en:
Jarma is single with one child.  Jarma is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Jarma is a businesswoman who raises pigs to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 2 years.  She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase feed for her pigs.  She has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Jarma hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El Sr. Ricardo tiene 42 años de edad estado civil casado con la señora Norah viven en la comunidad de Liquintaya, en el municipio de Colomi, ellos son agricultores producen papa, oca, haba con rotación de cultivos en terreno de 1,8 Has que es herencia de sus padres, tiene mucha experiencia en el rubro, la comunidad se encuentra a 52 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba. El Sr. Ricardo es de escasos recursos, necesita dinero de urgencia para comprar insumos agrícolas productos agroquímicos, semilla de avena forrajera para realizar tratamiento fitosanitario, sembrar forraje para sus ganados así garantizar la seguridad alimentaria y la economía de la familia, el ahorro que tenía gasto en la mejora de su vivienda porque quiso dar a sus hijos un ambiente más cómodo.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 42 years old and married to Norah. He lives in the community of Liquintaya in the municipality of Colimi. They both work in agriculture growing potatoes, yams, and beans and they rotate the crops on a piece of land measuring 1.8 hectares which they inherited from his parents. He is very experienced in farming. The community is located 52 km from the city of Cochabamba.

Ricardo has a very low income, and he needs money urgently to buy agricultural supplies and agrochemicals as well as fodder oat seeds. He wants to carry out plant health treatment and sow fodder crops for his animals. In this way he will be able to feed his family and guarantee their income. He spent his savings on improvements to his house because he wanted it to be more comfortable for his children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and agrochemicals.

loans.name: El Ceibo Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Xiomara mujer de 38 años de edad, acompañada, con cuatro hijos de 17, 13, 12 y 2 años, su negocio es la venta de carne de res en el mercado  desde hace 8 años, es cliente de la institución desde hace 5 años. El crédito lo solicita para comprar más inventario de carne de res. Patricia mujer de 27 años de edad su negocio es la venta de fritanga y Carolina mujer de 35 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de juguetes de madera.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurial members. One of the women is Xiomara, who is 38 years old, and has 4 children: ages 17, 13, 12, and 2. For 8 years, her business has been selling beef in the market. She has been a client of this institution for 5 years.  She requests this loan to buy more inventory of beef.

Patricia, a 27 year old woman, sells greasy food from a small restaurant. Carolina, a 35 year old woman, sells wooden toys.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of beef

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria Rosalina M. is married, 41 years old, a native of Chimonhama district of Magude, and has 3 stepchildren. She met her husband, who is a fisherman, 8 years ago, and according to her, he started his work in 1976, worked with a motor boat, and that point, the volume of capture was satisfactory and he was able to pay the expenses resulting from the business.

The partnership with the Microfinance Institution started out of the need to change the wooden boat for a fiberglass boat that would be more appropriate for getting a higher volume of fish.

So, with the money he had, he approached the Institution to get help for the amount still needed to be able to move forward with his project.

Maria does not have training in managing credit, and her level of schooling is low, having completed basic education. Up to now, she has made 2 loan requests. The loan request made is of 20,000 meticais for the acquisition of an engine with greater capacity in order to travel further to where the level of production (capture) is quite high.

The activity developed is extremely important since, on the one hand, it helps populations with seafood as an alternative in their diet, and on the other hand, it contributes to the reduction of unemployment rates. She currently employs more than eight (8) permanent workers and an additional five (5) seasonal workers.

The product resulting from the capture is sold to consumers and resellers from Catembe and the City of Maputo.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Bairro Chali-Catembe→Maputo-Moçambique Cliente: Maria Rosalina M. Sector de actividade: Pesca Valor de empréstimo: 20,000.00MTN (769.00 US$) Aplicação do empréstimo: Compra de motor de barco Início: 14/11/2006 Fim: 13/11/2007 Maria Rosalina M., é casada maritalmente tem 41 anos de idade, natural de Chimonhama distrito de Magude e tem 3 enteados. Conheceu o seu marido que é pescador a 8 anos e segundo ela este iniciara sua actividade em 1976 e trabalhava com barco a motor e nessa altura o trabalho e o nível de captura era satisfatório e conseguia pagar as despesas decorrentes da actividade.

A parceria com a Instituição microfinanceira inicia da necessidade de mudar o barco de madeira e comprar outro de fibra mais ajustado a realidade por forma a conseguir mais rendimentos de pesca. Assim, com parte do dinheiro que tinha aproximou-se da Instituição para ter auxílio do valor em falta por forma a dar cobro ao seu projecto.

Ela não tem formação em gestão de crédito e o nível de escolarização é baixo tendo concluido o nível básico, até ao dado momento fez 2 pedidos de empréstimo.

O pedido de empréstimo que fê-lo é de 20,000.00MTN para aquisição dum motor com maior capacidade por forma chegar a milhas mais distantes onde o nível de produção(captura) é bastante elevado. A actividade desenvolvida por esta é de extrema importância pois por um lado ajuda as populações com mariscos como alternativa na dieta alimentar e por outro contribuir na redução dos índices de desemprego. Emprega actualmente mais de oito (8) trabalhadores efectivos e outros cinco (5) sazonais.

O produto resultado da captura vende-o aos consumidores e revendedeiras da Catembe e Cidade de Maputo.

loans.use: Buying boat motor

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Born on June 31, 1978 in Mission Tové in the Zio region, Mr. Kossi A. is a married father of two (02) children. He is a motorcycle taxi driver and his wife is a saleswoman who helps with the household needs and education of their children.

However, this income is insufficient for their needs and he is requesting for the first time a credit of $800 for the end of this month, to buy at motorcycle taxi. His current motorcycle often breaks down and does not even belong to him. He works and gives the income to the owner who pays him in return. With his own motorcycle, he will work freely and for himself. The realization of this project will make it possible to improve the living conditions of all his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 31 juin 1978 à Mission Tové dans la préfecture de Zio, Monsieur A. Kossi est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Il est chauffeur de taxi moto avec une femme revendeuse qui l’aide dans les besoins du foyer et dans la scolarisation des enfants. Ces revenus étant insuffisants, il sollicite pour la première fois pour la fin de ce mois un crédit de $800 pour s’acheter un taxi moto, car la moto actuelle trop vieille tombe souvent en panne et ne lui appartient même pas. Il travaille et rend compte au propriétaire qui le paie en retour. Acec sa propre moto, il travaillera librement et pour lui-même. La réalisation de ce projet permettra d'améliorer les conditions de vie de toute sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur has a private hairdressing business in Kirkuk. She lives with her family in the poorest area in Kirkuk. She works hard to bring in income to support her brother who is disabled. She is the only worker in her home.

This loan is her first loan from a Microfinance Institution. She want to bring more equipment and hire a women to work with her in the business. She is 36 years old and is single. Kadeja says she is very interested in getting a loan to develop herself and raise her income.

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.use: Development, and to hire women to work

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Mrs. Prun O. is a 61 year old widow living in Kampong Cham Province with her children.  Her children have all stayed around home to help their mother, and they have a variety of jobs.  One daughter works in a garment factory, one son is a mototaxi driver, and the youngest son runs a small booth filling up gasoline.  Mrs. Prun O. works with the youngest son at his stand, and she sells jewelry to her neighbors.  This loan is being used to fund the gasoline stand and Mrs. Prun O.'s jewelry business.  Both of these businesses are profitable and the demand for both has been high lately.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline and jewelry for her family's businesses.

loans.name: Kika

texts.en: Kika F. is a strong 35-year old mother of eleven children from the village of Faleasiu. Having eleven children is not making her nervous or struggle in bringing them up. Her husband is a brick layer by profession who works at Graigs Construction, and also doing extra work for himself on Saturdays, which is giving him extra earnings apart from his salary. Kika’s business is a food stall, doing sandwiches, donuts, fried chicken and sausages. She supplies to the village primary school 5 days a week. With her previous loan she purchased a new gas stove to place in her house for easy preparation of her food. With her requested loan she plans to buy equipment like a frying pan, toaster and other equipment to help provide the best product.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase equipment and ingredients for her products.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Mrs. Gregoria is 64 years old, has 6 children and lives in the province of Recuay, district of Catac-Ancash. She is a member of the Communal Town Bank of Tourism of Catac. She currently lives alone and owns a grocery store which she has created thanks to loans from the Manuela Ramos Movement. At her age she is very pleased to see that the revenues of her business are sufficient to cover the expenses of her home. With this loan from Manuela Ramos of $350 (which she will repay in 6 installments) she will buy wholesale sugar, rice, oil, noodles, and flour to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Gregoria tiene 64 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos y vive en el Provincia de Recuay, Distrito de Catac – Ancash. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Villa Turística de Catac, actualmente vive sola, tiene una tienda de Abarrotes la cual ha ido creciendo gracias a los prestamos del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, a su edad se siente bien al ver que los ingresos de su negocio son suficientes para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000.00 soles ($ 333.00 aprox.) el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará Azúcar, Arroz, Aceite, Fideos, harina, al por mayor para surtir su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grocery items.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola A. is 53 years old, divorced with 3 children, and hails from Lagos, Nigeria. She sells beans and peppers and grinds tomatoes. She has been in this business since 2000 and requests a loan to buy a grinding machine.  She believes this will help her serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy more grinding machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
B. Nodira is 37 years old. She is married with three children. 

To help her husband in supporting the family Nodira runs her own business. She sells jewelry. Nodira has been in this business for more than two years.  Initially she started 500.00 US Dollars in working capital. Currently her turnover capital has increased to 3000.00 US Dollars. 

Nodira requests 2 000.00 Somoni (600.00 US Dollars). She is planning to purchase new items of jewelry like earrings, rings, bracelets, and chains to expand her inventory. This is the Nodira's first loan and she promises to observe all the procedures concerning the payment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase new items of jewelry for inventory

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon S. is a 47-year-old fish and vegetable seller in the Preak Kdey Village in Kandal Province; she also takes care of five children, three of whom are students and two of whom are brick kiln laborers. Yon earns about $3 a day. Her husband, Mr. Khim Korn, is a motorcycle taxi driver and fisherman. He generally earns about $5 a day.

To increase family income, Yon is requesting a loan of $1100 to enlarge her vegetable business and buy a second-hand fishing boat for her husband’s fishing. This loan will also help to pay for her children’s school fees and daily living expenses.

loans.use: To expand her vegetable business and buy a second-hand fishing boat for her husband's fishing

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 52-year-old widow with six children living in Drobo, Ghana. For the past two decades, she has earned a living running a pharmacy with her husband, but after he passed away, the business began to struggle. Here, she is pictured with one of her sons in the store.

Emma is applying for a loan of $625 U.S. dollars to buy more inventory, such as anti-malaria pills, pain killers, cough syrups. She hopes to expand the store so that she may pay for her children's education. Two of her children are currently in college studying nursing and they rely on Emma's help.

Emma is a member of the group called Magdalene. The group uses the peer pressure principle on members to re-pay part of their loan amount.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for a pharmacy

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es:
I'm very close to finish building my home. All I'm lacking is finish for the exterior and electrical panels. I'm requesting a loan of $1,200 to complete construction and thus be able to better protect my family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Ya me esta faltando poco para terminar la construcción de la casa. Solo me esta haciendo falto los acabados del exterior y las protecciones. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls. Para la terminación de los acabados del exterior de la casa y así estará mas protegida mi familia, cuando yo no este en la casa.

loans.use: Complete finishing home's exterior / Terminación de los acabados del exterior de la casa

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 50-year-old mother of three. She lives with her family in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Wafaa sells clothing. This is the first time she has applied to Al Majmoua for a loan. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is a woman who, throughout the years, has cultivated in herself and her children the honorable goal of work and self-improvement. She has undertaken several business activities that have helped her support her household. Currently Julia owns a small bodega (grocery and sundries store). She has seven children and still cares for four of them, who are still pursuing their studies. Her wish is to increase capital for setting up her business and to continue her work.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Doña Julia es una mujer que a lo largo de los años ha cultivado en ella misma y en sus hijos el noble deseo de trabajo y superación, ella ha emprendido diversos negocios que la ayudaron a sustentar su hogar y ahora cuenta con una pequeña bodega. Julia todavía tiene a su cargo a 4 de sus 7 hijos, quienes aun están estudiando, su deseo es incrementar su capital para implementar su pequeña tienda y continuar su trabajo

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
The women’s group “Virtuous Women,” was formed thanks to a committee in the same area that helped form this group. There were four meetings before the loan in which 16 women participated, all of whom agreed to the conditions of the program, and whose businesses were formed thanks to a 300,000 GS loan that each has received on the part of the Paraguayan Foundation and Kiva. They actually find themselves in their fifth cycle and during all of those months that they have related to the Paraguayan Foundation family, it has converted itself into one of the best women’s committees in the area. In this cycle each one has received loans of between 300,000 and 1.2 million Gs. The committee is actually formed of 17 sacrificing women, and the majority of them are the heads of their households, and because of this are very thankful to the Paraguayan Foundation for having given them the opportunity to raise and help their families.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

El comite de mujeres " Mujeres Virtuosas", se conformo gracias a un comite de la misma zona quienes ayudaron a conformar el grupo. Se realizaron cuatro reuniones previas al credito en donde participaron 16 señoras de las cuales toas estuvieron de acuerdo con las condiciones del programa, y cuyos negocios fueron creciendo gracias al credito de 300.000GS cada una que han recibido por parte de Fundacion Paraguaya y Kiva. Actualmente se encuentran en el 5to ciclo y durante todos estos meses que han pertenecido a la gran familia de la Fundacion Paraguaya se han convertido en uno de los mejores comités de mujeres de la zona. En este ciclo cada una han recibido creditos de entre 300.000 Gs y 1.200.000Gs. El comite actualmente esta conformado por 17 señoras muy sacrificadas y la mayoria de ellas son cabeza de familia es por eso que agradecen mucho a la Fundacion Paraguaya por haberles dado la oportunidad de crecer y ayudar a sus familias.

loans.use: Purchase of milk, vegetables, needles, cloth, and other merchandise

loans.name: Ilgor

texts.en:
This is the story of Ilgor T. who, at the young age of 25, has managed to make a path for himself, working the land he inherited from his parents, with great effort but, above all, with great love, as that land constitutes his patrimony.

In spite of being already independent and not having responsibilities towards others, he wishes to increase his production, so that, when he decides to start a family, he’ll be able to offer them financial stability and a cozy place to share many happy moments. He saves every day toward this goal, and remains a good son to his parents, helping out financially whenever necessary and providing a little extra money for his younger brothers’ well-being.

In this way, Ilgor helps his loved ones and works to ensure a promising future for himself. In order for his dreams and wishes to come true, he needs the support of your generous heart. Today Ilgor asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for a term of 12 months. With this loan, he’ll be able to improve his produce and increase his income and savings to then start his family. With your collaboration he’ll be able to crystallize his dreams in a short time.

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizers and paying for labor force for his land

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas. Olga es casada, tiene 61 años y 4 hijos, Olga junto a su esposo tienen locutorios, brinda servicios D. llamadas telefónica a diferentes destinos, además venD. tarjetas telefónicas y también realiza recargas virtuales, tiene 2 locales que son alquilados y están ubicados en lugares estratégicos en avenidas, para lo cual cuenta con 2 empleados que atienden durante el día y durante las noches atienden ella y su esposo.

Olga necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. tarjetas telefónicas. Olga sueña con mejorar sus negocios y tener otras sucursales.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Golondrinas Communal Bank ("The Swallows"). She is 61 and married with 4 children. Olga and her husband have a call center, providing telephone services to various destinations. They also sell telephone cards and electronic recharging. She has two rented spaces in strategic locations on major streets. She has 2 employees who work during the day, and she and her husband work in the evenings. Olga needs a loan of $375 that will be invested in the purchase of telephone cards. Olga dreams of improving her business and opening other branches.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Olga needs a loan of $375 that will be invested in the purchase of telephone cards.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
Холов Шухрат, 1972 года рождения, он женат и у них 3 детей. Начал свой бизнес с продажи хлеба. Бизнесом занимается уже 5 лет. Сейчас Шухрат продает товары народного потребления и продукты питания на дехканском рынке Гисара. В его ассортименте можно увидеть макаронные изделия, разновидность масел для приготовления пищи, сахар и сахарная продукция, дрожи, разновидность зубной пасты и стиральных порошков. Свой товар закупает в оптовых магазинах Сафар-Центра. Провожая своих покупателей любезными словами, оставляет хорошее впечатление.  
Шухрату нужны средства для закупа растительного масла и он хочет получить займ в сумме 1500 сомони.
texts.en:
Shuhrat K. was born in 1972, he is married and has 3 children. He started his business by selling bread. Shuhrat has been in business for 5 years now. Today he sells ethnic products and food products at the Gissar farmer’s market. His product assortment includes pastas, oils for cooking food, sugar and confectionary products, yeast, and a variety of toothpastes and detergents. Shuhrat purchases his products at the wholesale stores in Safar-Center. Shuhrat says goodbye to his customers with nice words, leaving a good impression.

Shuhrat needs funds to purchase vegetable oil and he would like to take out a loan for 1500 somoni ($450).

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetable oil

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Mr. Sony N. is 29 years old and he now lives in the Tep Phyrom village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has two children who are too young to work or study. He repairs motorcycles. His wife, Mrs. Choeun Phat, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living.

Their family has less very little income to support their household. Thus, Mr. Sony N. requests a loan to add to his savings to build a house to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: Add to his savings to build a house for the family to improve living conditions

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander owns a small kiosk and sells household supplies at the central city market. He started this business eight years ago. His gross income is 7,000 UAH per month. The goods he sells are in high demand and his business goes well. Alexander is a hard-working person and he would like to develop his business even more. 

Alexander would like to get a loan of 3,000 to increase the inventory. He hopes that this loan will be another small step in his business growth. Alexander's goal is to have stable source of income for his family.

loans.use: to increase the inventory

loans.name: Oruj

texts.en: Oruj I., age 49, is married and has four children. Twenty-two years ago, he started his business of raising cattle. His primary business is with the local restaurants. Also, during harvest season, Oruj works as a farm hand to help with the harvest. Despite having two jobs, his business is still quite small and doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Oruj requests a loan to buy more calves to raise and thereby expand his business. He will use the profit generated by the business to repay the loan on time. Oruj thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel además de ser una señora joven y alegre también es muy trabajadora. Por las mañanas cuida de un niño desde hace seis años. Mientras que por las tardes sale a vender diariamente frituras y platos típicos de su país en la puerta de su casa.

Eventualmente, la contratan como cocinera en distintas fiestas. En estas fiestas algunas veces ella también vende pollos al por mayor con la idea de ofrecer un servicio más completo. También la contratan par a la limpieza de casas y locales.

Gracias a su trabajo ella puede educar y alimentar a sus dos hijos, uno de once años y la segunda de solo cuatro años. Su esposo la ayuda con los gastos trabajando como taxista.

En un futuro le gustaría poder abrir una tienda de abarrotes o ropa.
texts.en:
Besides Maribel being a young and happy lady, she's a very busy woman as well. In the morning she has taken care of a child for the past 6 years. During the afternoons, she sells fried treats and the typical plates of her country from the door of her house.

She is often hired to cook at parties and festivals. At the festivals sometimes she also sells chicken. She also works by cleaning houses and businesses.

Thanks to her work, she has been able to send her two children to school and to provide for their needs. One of her children is 11 and the other is only 4 years old. Maribel's husband helps her with the costs of their home by working as a taxi driver.

In the future she would like to open a clothing store or a grocery store.

(Translated by Jian and Elliot of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients in bulk, including chickens to roast

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Loeng Thon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people who live in Preak Svay village in Kandal province make up the village bank loan. Each member will use the loan for different purposes.

M.. Srey Loeng T. is a farmer who earns a living from the bananas that she grows on a small piece of land she owns. She is 26 years old and the mother of two children. One attends the local school and the youngest, at 5 years old, is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Pak Pol, helps her in the plantation. M.. Srey Loeng T. has an obstacle because her field has infertile soil so she asks for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

Mr. ToU. K. did not attend the meeting but his wife did, so she is presented in the picture instead him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make the field more productive.

loans.name: Ahinadjè

texts.fr:
AHISSOU Ahinadjè est née à Porto Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. Ahinadjè est mariée et mère de 02 enfants tous scolarisés. Ahinadjè vit actuellement à Takon dans commune de Sakété, département de Plateau. Ahinadjè est vendeuse d'huile rouge qu'elle obtient après transformation de noix de palme. Ahinadjè a besoin de se constituer un fonds de roulement conséquent afin d'avoir plus de revenu dans cette activité de transformation de noix de palme. C'est pourquoi Ahinadjè s'est adressée à ALIDé pour avoir un crédit. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
AHISSOU Ahinadjè was born in Porto Novo, administrative and political capital of Benin. Ahinadjè is married and the mother of 2 children, all in school. Ahinadjè currently lives in Takon in the area of Sakété, department of the Plains. Ahinadjè sells red oil that she obtains after transforming palm nut. Ahinadjè needs to build meaningful capital in order to generate more revenue from this activity of palm nut transformation. This is why Ahinadjè came to ALIDé to get a loan. The meaning of ALIDé in the local language of Benin, the Fon, is « a path always exists for the poorest ». Benin is a small country in West Africa next to Nigeria where the GNP per capita is $1,500. ALIDé offers special 0% loans to very vulnerable people and is part of a group that will soon launch a microinsurance program for the beneficiaries of microcredit.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy palm nut

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es: Tatiana tiene 33 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres, que la apoyan mucho en sus propósitos de negocio. Ella tiene una pequeña bodega en la casa de sus padres, donde vende abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 2 años, y atiende durante todo el día.  El éxito de su tienda es porque se encuentra en una zona por donde transita gran cantidad de personas, y ella se encarga de atenderlos con gran amabilidad para que se conviertan en sus clientes. El sueño de Tatiana es hacer crecer su bodega hasta convertirla en un minimarket. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta la idea de trabajar en un banco comunal porque nota que se aprende el trabajo en equipo y responsabilidad. Como todos sus compañeros, Tatiana se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El dinero que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Tatiana is 33 years old, single, and lives with her parents, who very much support her business plans. Tatiana has a little store built into her parents' house, out of which she sells groceries and other basic necessities. She has run this shop for two years now, working in it every day. The success of her store rests on the fact that large numbers of people pass through her neighbourhood all the time and also, that she attends to her customers' needs in such a friendly way that they soon become regular clients. Tatiana's dream is to keep expanding her business until it becomes a mini-market. This is her first loan from MFP, and she likes the idea of working in a communal bank because it is about responsibility and teamwork. Like her fellow borrowers, Tatiana is committed to making her loan payments punctually. She will use the loan to buy groceries and other basic necessities to stock up her store.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To offer a wider range of merchandise

loans.name: Shodikhon

texts.en:
Shodikhon is a hard working person and he makes an effort to give his beloved son the best. He decided to stay in his homeland so that he could develop it, and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals. With experience gained over 11 years in the purchase and sale of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family. He would now like to purchase the cattle that can create more income for his large family. For this reason he requests US $1300. Shodikhon thanks you very much for your help.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make and sell palm oil

loans.name: Reynilda

texts.en: Reynilda B. is from the village of Biasong. She is 38 years old, married, and has seven school-aged children. Reynilda manufactures and sells clay products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over 34 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2004, Reynilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Reynilda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Abdulhamid

texts.ru: Абдулхамид Саидов проживат в городе Куляб. Возраст 40 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей.  Абдулхамид по образованию является инженером. Он более 7 лет заниается услугой такси. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы отремонтировать свою машину, т.к. этот вид услуги является единственным источником дохода.
texts.en:
Abdulhamid S. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 40 years old, married and has 3 children. Abdulhamid is an engineer by trade. He has been working as a taxi driver for over 7 years. Our client is requesting this loan in order to repair his car since this business is his sole source of income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Gina

texts.es:
Gina es socia del Bancomunal Las Luciérnagas.
Gina es casada tiene 31 años, un hijo de 3 años quien está  a su cuidado.
Gina estudio educación inicial trabajando en un colegio, pero lo dejo  por que ganaba muy poco, se puso a trabajar con su esposo, el  tiene una tienda de confección de  cortinas y decoración de interiores, ella  también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza es vendedora estrella.
Desde que está en Finca  con las charlas recibidas aprendió a sacar, a llevar sus cuentas 
Gina necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de productos de belleza.
El sueño de Gina es poner su tienda de decoración y ser directora de belleza.
texts.en:
Gina is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Luciérnagas" (The Fireflies). She is 31 years old, married, and has a 3-year-old child in her care. Gina studied Early Childhood Education at school, but left the job because she made very little money. She began to work with her husband, who had a shop for curtain-making and interior decorating. She also started to work selling beauty products and is an excellent salesperson. Since she has been a part of the bank, the talks they have recieved have taught her to pay bills and do accounting. Gina requires a loan of 800 soles in order to buy beauty products. Her dream is to open a decorating store and be director of beauty.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
For the past 13 years, Adolat has operated a business of selling fabrics that are specifically intended for sewing national dresses. She sells her wares in the famous market called “Panjshanbe” in Khujand, Tajikistan. A hard-working mother of three, Adolat has successfully grown her business, inspired by her goal to establish a stable income for her family.

Currently, Adolat is seeking a loan of $2,700 USD to enlarge her variety of goods for sale. With the increased profits, she hopes to continue supporting her children's education. She hopes that someday her children will become educated professionals in their sphere of knowledge.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Bulubandi North Zaina Kagoya Group

texts.en:
Zaina K. is thirty-five years old and she is representing her group. She is a married lady who is blessed with five children of whom three are going to school. She works very hard to educate her children.

Zaina has a business dealing in matooke (bananas) which she has been operating for over five years. She is using the loan to purchase matooke from deep villages to bring to town to sell.

loans.use: To purchase matooke from deep villages

loans.name: Juana Jesús

texts.es: Doña Juana G. tiene 32 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Tejedora,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 Telares, habita junto  a su Esposo , él y su Esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 7 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Chotacaj, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana G. is 32 years old, married and a weaver. "Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres" has a workshop with 3 looms. She lives with her husband and both are weavers and they have two employees. They have been making "Cortes" for 7 years at their home located in the Village Chotacaj, of the Aldea Vásquez of the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Presently orders from her customers have increased but the economical conditions are not sufficient so she can increase her capital and therefore she approached Asociación ASDIR to request a loan in order to buy material and thus increase sales. She also wants to make her family get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material for crafts making.

loans.name: Shola

texts.en: Shola is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children. He sells sarongs. He hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Jude

texts.en:
Jude is a 35 year old father to two who operates his boda boda (motor bike taxi) business in Nairobi. He has run this business for one year on a hired motorbike after employment as a rider. He is requesting for a loan of Kes. 74,000 to purchase his own motorbike. He hopes that he will buy a plot and build a home for his family one day. He also plans to enlarge his business and own three motor bikes and a vehicle for taxi. He describes himself as hardworking and determined.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Having gone through failure, Rosario does not allow herself to dwell on the past; instead, she goes on with her life. At 38, she is married and has 5 children to love and care for. She carefully tends her corn farm to achieve a good harvest. Rosario’s family depends on the income from her farm for their daily needs. A member of CEV, she requested for a loan of Php 12,000. She will use this loan to acquire the supplies that she needs for her farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: This is Carmelita C., 47 years old, from Baseco Compound, Port Area, Manila. Her husband. Pedro, 47, is a vendor and they have three children. Carmelita has a general store situated just in front of her house. In front of the store, she also sells fish balls. She has been enjoying her business for the last six years and now earns P16,000 a month. From profits that she has been saving, she was able to retrieve a piece of land which was used as loan collateral to a loan shark. Carmelita joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007. She applied for a new loan of P10,000 which she will use to buy more items to sell at her store, including non-perishable grocery items. In the future, Carmelita wants to see her general store become bigger than it is now. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To re-stock on grocery items for sale

loans.name: Constancia Simao

texts.pt:
Constância Simiao Muitu nasceu na cidade de Maputo, capital de Moçambique tem 40 anos de idade, mãe de 2 filhos de 15 e 21 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez o nível médio, neste momento esta a concorrer para a faculdade.
