Vive na casa própria com a família, o marido é professor, numa das escolas na cidade de Maputo e para alem da sua família sustenta mais 2 familiares enviando dinheiro.

Nunca mudou de residência, é professora permanente há mais de 9 anos, formada pelo Centro de Formação de Professores de Namaacha e pelo Instituto de Magistério Primário da Matola. Tem um salário mensal de cerca de 6.500.00mt com o qual consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária após as despesas caseiras, o marido também ajuda através de seu salário.

Já teve empréstimos com uma instituição financeira denominada NOVO BANCO no valor de 20.000.00mt, o qual foi destinado para o início da sua obra de construção da sua casa. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus colegas e amigos assim decidiu solicitar empréstimos, sendo este o seu 3º crédito no valor de 20.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt e 18.000.00mt também para a mesma actividade.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo também afim de poder aceder a mais créditos no futuro e concluir a sua obra, para poder oferecer melhores condições de habitação a sua família.
texts.en:
Constância Simiao Muitu was born in the city of Maputo, the capital of Mozambique. She is 40 years old and has two children, ages 15 and 21. The whole family attends school. Constância completed technical school and is about to apply to the university. She lives in her own home with her family. Her husband is a professor in one of the schools in the city of Maputo. Besides her family they also support two relatives by sending them money. She has never left Maputo and has been a full time professor for more than 9 years. She trained at the Center for Teacher Training of Namaacha and the Institute of Elementary Education in Matola. She earns a monthly salary around 6.500.00 MT and is able to save a bit in her bank account after paying the household expenses. Her husband also helps with his salary. Constância previously had loans with Novo Banco in the amount of 20.000.00 MT which were used to start construction on her home. She learned about Hluvuku through colleagues and friends and decided to take out a loan. This is her third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00 MT, which she plans to use to purchase materials (iron, cement, sand, etc.) to continue construction on her home. Her previous loans were for 10.000.00 MT and 18.000.00 MT, also for the same purpose. She promises to pay back this loan on time so that she will have access to future loans in order to finish her home and provide her family with better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (cement blocks, cement, etc. )

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa is a 40-year-old married woman with six children aged between 10 and 20. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a five-roomed house where she is staying with eight people. Kasifa takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day.

Kasifa incurs transport costs to and from buying charcoal from villages of Mubende, one of the districts in central Uganda, and she uses public transport to and from Mubende. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Kasifa works six days a week. She receives an average of twenty customers a day and sells to all categories of people. She doesn’t pay monthly rent, since she works from her home. Her major business challenges are increasing prices of charcoal and transportation.

Kasifa has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for twelve years, servicing her twentieth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal for her shop. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Hijo

texts.en:
Hijo M. is currently in the business of selling fresh vegetables in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables and fruit to sell.  Hijo is 44 years old and her husband is a peasant. She has six children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan she plans to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase fresh fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en: Bayram S. was born in 1950. He is married and has two children. Bayram lives in Baku city, and has been in building houses business for 3 years. Now, in order to improve his business, he is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to  buy the necessary materials for building houses.

loans.use: To buy materials for building houses

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio tiene 42 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, tiene un hijo que depende de él, la familia vive en casa que es propia. Julio se dedica a la actividad de venta de papa, chuño y tunta, comercializa en las ferias de la localidad donde vive. Julio cuenta con una experiencia de 19 años en este rubro, mismo que lo desempeña junto a su esposa. La competencia es media, porque Julio es responsable con sus clientes y sus puestos de venta están en la plena plaza. El presente crédito Julio lo utilizará para la compra de ganado lechero y cancelación saldo capital. Este es su tercer crédito en la institución, en sus créditos anteriores trabajo de manera optima, no tiene obligaciones con las  Entidades Financieras.
texts.en:
Julio is 42 years old and married. He has one dependent son and he and his family live in a house they own. Julio sells potatoes and potato flour in the markets of his neighborhood. He has worked in this field for 19 years with his wife. His competition is not too fierce because Julio is responsible with his customers and his stalls are in good locations in the markets. This loan will be used to purchase dairy cattle and to pay off his capital balances. This is his third loan with the institution and he worked hard to pay off all his previous loans so that he has no further liabilities.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy cattle and pay off of capital balances

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma M. is a 56-year-old married woman who lives in Prk. Malabago, Pinaginpinan, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through operating her general store and by the buying and selling of rice and corn.

Alma’s husband, Nelson, who is 57 years old, helps his wife in the business and also maintains a job where he earns about $226 month.  They have two children who are 28 and 32 years old and have their own families.

Alma joined the Kiva field partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in September of 2006 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store and through the buying and selling of rice and corn. Now she earns an average monthly income of $226 from her business activities.

Alma is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP was used to fund the operations of her general store and the buying and selling of rice and corn.  It had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now borrowing her 7th loan, in the amount of 21,000 PHP, she intends to use it on her general store and also on her business of buying and selling rice and corn. Alma is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yacouba C. est âgé de 40 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec ses quatre enfants et sa femme dans le quartier Fana coura, sous préfecture de Fana, deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur Yacouba abandonna l’école en classe de huitième année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour se consacrer aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce d’articles divers. Yacouba est très sollicité et jouit d’une grande notoriété dans les activités d’achat et de  vente d’articles électroniques.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son troisième prêt individuel, après  avoir correctement  remboursés les deux précédents.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter,  20 téléphones portables et accessoires. 
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako à un prix abordable pour venir les revendre dans sa boutique sise au grand marché de Fana, à une clientèle composée de toutes les catégories sociales de la ville.
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les dépenses de la famille et le reste investi dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Yacoube C. is 40 years old and lives in a monogamous household with his four children and wife in the Fana coura area, in the Fana sub-prefecture in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Mr. Yacouba abandoned his education in eighth grade (in the Malian education system) to devote himself to income-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of various goods. Yacouba is highly sought-after and enjoys a good reputation in his business buying and selling electronic items. With the hope of better satisfying his growing clientele, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners), with whom he is on his third individual loan, after having properly repaid the two previous ones. He intends to use this loan to buy 20 mobile phones and accessories. He gets his supplies in Bamako at an affordable price, and then sells them at his store located at the grand market in Fana, to a clientele composed of all social categories from the city. He hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for his family expenses, with the remainder being reinvested in his business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mobile phones

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.es:
Juvenal tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el sector El Sandial del distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año se dedica a la agricultura, actualmente ha sembrado una hectarea de maiz en un terreno ubicado en la misma zona en donde vive. El nos cuenta que anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar como peón agrícola en diversos campos de cultivo cercanos y que poco a poco ha ido aprendiendo el manejo de diversos productos agrícolas. Juvenal depende de las ganancias que le genere esta actividad para solventar sus ingresos personales y ayudar al mantenimiento de su familia.

Su cultivo de maíz ya lleva varios dias instalado y Juvenal desea brindarle algunos riegos y aplicarle abonos y pesticidas. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz para asegurarse una buena producción.

Juvenal es un joven bastante responsable y trabajador, el sigue laborando como peón agrícola en otros campos de cultivo durante sus tiempos libres y ya se ha ganado el respeto y aprecio de los agricultores de la zona.
texts.en:
Juvenal is 19 years old, single, and lives with his parents and siblings in the area of El Sandial in Pitipo District. This community is in the Province of Ferreñafe, located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Juvenal has been farming for one year. He currently grows corn on a hectare of land located in the same area where he lives. Juvenal says he previously worked as a field laborer on different farms nearby and gradually learned how to manage different agricultural products. He depends on the income he generates from is crops to cover his personal expenses and help support his family.

Juvenal just planted a crop of corn several days ago and wants to provide some irrigation and also apply compost and pesticides. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that he can maintain his crop of corn and be assured of good production.

Juvenal is a responsible and hardworking young man. He continues to work as a field laborer on other farms during his free time and has already earned the respect and appreciation of other farmers in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & pesticides

loans.name: Tsetsenbal

texts.en: Tsetsenbal is 36 years old and lives with her three children in a ger, the traditional Mongolian tent, in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her parents live with them and help support Tsetsenbal and her business. During the day, she operates a trading business selling second-hand products such as shoes, clothing, and blankets. Previously, she had operated a food trading business which she started in 2003 with a working capital of 150,000 tugrugs (~ 105 USD). She has been working with Xacbank since 2004, and is a reliable client. Tsetsenbal is a very hard-working and open-minded person. The most important thing for her is her children's education. She says: “I am working hard to be financially able to pay for my children's education.” Tsetsenbal is requesting a 150,000 tugrug (~ 105 USD) loan to purchase second-hand shoes to resell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand shoes and resell them

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosela E., 40, lives in Fernan, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. She has four children, three in school and one still an infant. Her husband, Antonio, is a farm laborer who does odd jobs. To help her husband support the family, Rosela opened a sari-sari (general) store. She’s been in this business for eight years and has been able to sustain it even in times of crisis. She earns an average net income of P2,000.00 a month. She joined the PDP-LP Program cooperative just this year. As a new member, she is applying for a loan of P4,000.00 to add capital to her business. Future income will be used for basic needs, loan repayments, and savings. Rosela hopes that some day she will be able to send all her children to school and college for a better future. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing sari-sari store

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
To make a living, for over 20 years Victoria has owned and operated a business raising pigs for sale, earning consistently good profits. In 2006 she joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan from ASHI that was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies, Victoria is now requesting a new loan, her fifth, of 20,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and additional piglets for more revenue. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. This will allow Victoria to further grow her hog-raising business so that her children fulfill their dreams of completing college degrees and finding better jobs and giving her family a decent life.

Her long term goal is to purchase additional raw materials for her fishing business (a secondary business) so she can expand and sell more fish in the local community and other surrounding neighborhoods. She also hopes to have a successful pig farm someday.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and additional piglets for more income.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Composé des femmes mariées, les membres du groupe Badenya ont une moyenne d’âge de 23 ans et de 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Massabla-coura de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des relations de mariage, et font le commerce de charbon de bois (tels Oumou Sangaré), de bois de chauffe, des vêtements etc. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs stocks enfin de satisfaire l’attente des clients, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elles sont à leur sixième  prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursées. 
Madame Oumou  Sangaré fait le commerce de charbon de bois depuis le bas âge. Selon cette dame, elle a appris ce métier auprès de la co-épouse de sa maman. 
Avec ce prêt Oumou Sangaré compte acheter, 5 tonnes de charbon  de bois auprès des fournisseurs de Bougouni et environ pour ensuite les revendre en détail et au comptant dans le marché de Bougouni. Sa clientèle  est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt le elle espère obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000 FCFA alors que les autres membres du groupe comptent sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30000F CFA qui sera utilisé selon elles dans les frais de santé de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Composed of married women, the members of the group Badenya average 23 years of age and two children.  These women live in nuclear conjugal families with their children and husband, and they reside in the Massabla-Coura district of the city Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through ties of marriage, and they have businesses involving charcoal (such as Ms. Oumou Sangaré), firewood, clothing, etc. Concerned about increasing their inventory of goods, so at to satisfy customer expectations, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their sixth group loan.  All the preceding ones have been repaid.  Ms. Oumou Sangaré has been doing commerce in charcoal since she was young.  This lady says that she learned this trade from her mother's co-wife.  With this loan, she plans on buying five tonnes of charcoal from suppliers in and around Bougouni and then selling it retail for cash at the Bougouni market.  Her customer base is composed of women and men.  With this loan, she hopes to obtain a monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA, while the other group members plan on a monthly profit of 30,000 francs.  The women say the profit will be used for covering the health care costs of their children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying charcoal

loans.name: Gaëlle Francine Amélévi

texts.en: Gaëlle is 32 years old. She owns a general store where she sells some food products, home products, and beauty products. She’s had her store since 2007. Her husband also owns a business and the two of them have 2 children. She has requested her first loan from WAGES for 250,000 CFA. She would like to purchase detergent, various beauty products, milk and oil.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Kem Y., 52, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations.

Y. and her husband are workers at a rubber plantation and earn an income of USD 2 each per day. Y. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase motorbike parts to repair the motorbike she uses to commute to work easily.

In the future, Y. would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy motorbike parts to repair her motorbike

loans.name: Mkolemba Group

texts.en:
Meet Selina J. and the Mkolemba Group. Selina, aged 34, is married with six children. She has had a general store for two years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $68.

This will be Selina’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to build her small house and has paid them back successfully. She now wants a loan to buy rice, sugar and flour for her store.

Selina will share this loan with her loan group Mkolemba, which totals 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the photo, Selina is first on the right in the back row, wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and flour to sell in her store

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana B. is from the village of Amoyong, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 30 years old. Rosana is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Rosana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products, and also fruits like sweet bananas, in the local community. Rosana has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rosana is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rosana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital.

loans.name: Justie

texts.en: Justie N. is from the village of Pagahan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old and is married with eight school-aged children. Justie owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fourteen years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Justie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Francisca Alicia

texts.es:
María resiD. en mercedes Umaña Departamento D. Usulután, es V. y vive con una hija y una nieta, tiene una tienda y todas ellas dependen D. estos ingresos.
la tienda la inicio su hija hace quince años ahora la administra nía maría por la situación económica ellas decidieron solicitar el crédito para aumentar su mercadería.
el crédito lo invertirá en la compra D. granos básicos como aceite arroz frijoles maíz entre otros productos para surtir mas la tienda y así poder vender un poco mas y obtener mas ganancias.
su inversión le ayudara a que la tienda crezca mas tener los productos más necesarios que es lo que el cliente compra hoy en día por la misma situación económica en la que nos encontramos en nuestro país 
Sus aspiraciones son mejorar la tienda y D. esta forma tener más ingresos para que su hija pueda sacar sus estudios universitarios para que sea una profesional y luego poder ser útil a la sociedad.
texts.en:
María lives in Mercedes Umaña, Usulután department. She’s a widow and lives with a daughter and granddaughter. She has a grocery store that all of them depend on for their income. Her daughter started the store 15 years ago but now María is going to run it. Because of the economic situation they decided to request a loan to increase stock merchandise. The loan will be used to buy such basic items as: cooking oil, rice, beans and corn among other products to better stock the store and thus be able to sell a bit more and earn more profits. Her investment will help the store grow and to have more products in stock of those items that the customer buys daily because of the economic situation the country finds itself in. Her aspirations are to improve the store this way so that income will be higher in order for her daughter to finish her university studies so that she will become a professional and then be useful to society.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, rice, beans and corn.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina, who is 52 years old and married to a driver, has only one child who has finished school.  For the past year Amina has operated a food stall employing one person where she makes and sells rice, beef stew, tea and mandazi (doughnuts).  Her customers are people from the neighborhood.  Amina, who previously sold clothes to earn a living, is a member of a group called Happy Women in Faulu Kenya.  Previously guaranteed a loan of 10,000 Kes by the group members, she is now requesting a new loan of 20,000 Kes which she will use to buy ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La Sra. Celia vive en el Barrio Monte Alto de la localidad de la Guardia distante a 20 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es nacida en el departamento de Sucre, hace 15 años que llego a la ciudad de Santa Cruz en busca de días mejores, su actividad principal es la venta de refrigerio como ser empanadas, café, chocolate , y otros acompañantes, su esposo con el cual tiene 1 hijo se dedica a la construcción de viviendas, el destino del crédito solicitado es para comprar una heladera para guardar sus alimentos y los insumos de su negocio, están pagando su vivienda por lo que tienen que trabar duro para cubrir la deuda y sostener a su familia, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.

OJO la Sra Celia aparece en la foto acompañada de su esposo y su hijito.
texts.en:
Celia lives in the Monte Alto neighborhood in community of La Guardia, 20 km from the city of Santa Cruz. She was born in the Sucre department. Fifiteen years ago she came to the city of Santa Cruz, seeking better days. Her main activity is selling snacks such as empanadas, coffee, chocolate, and other food. Her husband, with whom she has 1 child, works in home construction. The loan she has asked for will be used to buy a refrigerator to keep her food and her business' ingredients in. They are paying for their home and so have to work hard to cover the debt and support their family. She is very grateful with the institution for the support it has offered. Attention: Celia appears in the photo with her husband and son.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Mercedes se dedica al comercio a la venta de granos básicos y leña. Es casada tiene 3 hijos todos ellos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación el cual tiene 15 años de tener este negocio. El crédito será destinado para la compra de granos básicos para aumentar su inventario y así obtener mayores ganancias
texts.en: Mercedes works selling basic foods and firewood. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are working and helping her economically. The business is located in her home, and she has operated it for 15 years. The loan will be used to buy basic grains to increase her inventory and thus obtain greater profits.

loans.use: Buying food products (basic grains)

loans.name: Khureltuya

texts.en: Khureltuya is 49 and the father of two children. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). His son who is aged 18 is a university student and the youngest one attends local secondary school. His wife works at the local kindergarten as an assistant teacher. He bought a minivan and started his transportation business in 2000. His route goes from Ulaanbaatar city to the outskirts of the city. He has gained valuable experience in previous years and has a loyal customer base. He is building a new house on their plot of land and wants to complete the construction work on the house. The loan he is asking for will be used to buy some construction materials for his uncompleted house. He is a very hardworking and reliable person.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for his uncompleted house.

loans.name: Daniel Adero

texts.en:
Daniel is 26 years old, a single man from the Usenge area on the outskirts of Kisumu city. He is divorced with two children who are under his care: Migan, three years old and in baby class, and Daniel, two years old.

Daniel has a phone accessories business that he has been running for the past two years. He is applying for a loan to buy new phones for sales to add to his stock. His monthly income is Kshs 12,000 and his business is doing well. This is the first loan that he is applying from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is a client here.

His desire is to open another shop in Bondo town where there is high demand for mobile phone accessories. He plans to own his own house in the future.

loans.use: Buy new mobile phones for sale

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida T. is a 45-year-old mother from Solong, Sibalom, Antique, Philippines. She is a loving wife to Winifredo  T., who is a farmer. They are blessed with six children. Their eldest child is already 21 years old, while their youngest is 10 years old. 

Since all of her children are still studying, they work really hard in order to provide for the needs of the family. They earn their living through a small variety store and farming. The income that they earn from this business is used towards basic needs and their children's educational expenses. 
 
As their children advance to higher levels of education, they need more money to address their educational expenses, especially for their eldest child, who is already in college. So Nida needs more capital for her business so that they earn more to sustain their basic needs.

For almost three years of membership in ASHI, she has maintained good performance because she doesn’t want to destroy the trust given to her by ASHI and its field partner. She has dreams for the future and believes only ASHI can help her achieve them.

loans.use: Additional capital for a variety store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills. 

She operates an open-air food market, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  Mary faces the major challenges of price fluctuation and competition in her business. She hopes to expand her business and establish a cosmetic shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, cooking oil, and a big umbrella to create shade for her customers. She decided to join Yehu so she could access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes, cooking oil, and a big umbrella to create a shade for her customers.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi  est un regroupement de neuf femmes toutes mariées dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Elles ont   une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et de 4 enfants et résident à Heremakono-Nord, préfecture de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).  Elles se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et excellent le commerce  d’articles divers  
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe, les prêts trois précédents  ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt DIATOU S., compte acheter des sacs de charbon de bois auprès des paysans des villages environnants de BOUGOUNI. Elle effectue sa vente, en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisé dans l’activité et l’autre partie dans les frais d’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of nine women, all married and living in traditional extended polygamous families, with their brothers, sisters, co-spouses, children and husbands. They are on the average 32 years old, with four children. They live in Heremakono-Nord, Bougoni Preferecture (the third administrative region of Mali). They know each other through business and family links and work selling various items.

In order to better meet the increasing customer demand, they have decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yirwaso. They are on their fourth group loan, having duly repaid three prior loans. With this loan, Diatou S. plans to purchase bags of charcoal from farmers in the villages surrounding Bougoni.  She sells retail, for cash and on credit to a customer base composed of both men and women. With this loan, she plans to achieve a monthly income of 40,000 West African Francs, a part of which will be used for the business and the other for [her] children’s education costs.

loans.use: Purchasing charcoal

loans.name: Adele

texts.en: Adele owns a business that sells foodstuff. She is 35 years old, married and has four children who are between four and thirteen years old. All her children attend school. Her husband works together with her selling vegetables. Adele has been selling foodstuffs for two years. Her loan will be used to buy more sweet potatoes, cassava, yams, and beans. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to re invest in her business. She dreams of buying a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff to sell.

loans.name: Silvana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Silvana de 29 años, es una joven emprendedora que desde que falleció su padre se ha dedicado a trabajar en una copiadora que el compro para que su hija trabaje. 

Poco a poco ella ha estado trabajando en la copiadora que le dejo su papa y ha invertido las ganancias que ha tenido en algunos artículos de papelería como cuadernos, plumas y otros en ropa para tener ingresos adicionales. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro por eso quiere seguir trabajando en su pequeño negocio y comprar con el préstamo blusas, camisetas y papelería. 

En el futuro quiere tener su familia bien constituida y poder alquilar su casa para tener un ingreso adicional.
texts.en:
Silvana is 29 years old.  She is an enterprising young woman who, since her father died, has worked in a stationery store that he bought so that his daughter could work.

She has been working in the store that her dad left her and has invested the profits that she has made in buying stationery products such as exercise books and pens, and clothes to make additional income.

Silvana currently works from 7.00am to 7.00pm.  She has a lot of aspirations for the future.  For this reason, she would like to continue working in her small business and use her loan money to buy blouses, t-shirts and stationery products.  In the future, she would like to have her family united and be able to rent her house out to make additional income.

loans.use: To buy blouses, t-shirts and stationery products

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette owns a business that offers secretarial services. She is 42 years old, married, and has no children. Her husband works in private ownership. Odette has been working in this business for ten years.  Her loan will be used to buy photocopiers and scholastic materials to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further expand her business and have a nice location for her business in the future.

loans.use: To add more photocopiers and scholastic materials to sell

loans.name: Mpalanyi

texts.en: 40 year old Mpalanyi I. is involved in a taxi transportation trade in Jinja. He has been a driver for almost 20 years now. Besides driving, the father of 4 also does some poultry farming. Weekly, he gets shillings 150,000. With this loan, I. says he is going to improve his taxi. He says he is going to purchase new tyres and also do servicing on his taxi.

loans.use: The purchase of new tyres and the servicing of his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Erdenedalai

texts.en:
Erdenedalai, age 27, lives with his wife, their two small daughters (ages one and three) and his mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger districts of the city. His mother is retired, so she babysits Erdenedalai’s kids and stays at home. 

Erdenedalai supports his family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia with the help of his wife.

When he first began his business, he had 1,800,000 MNT in working capital in 2006. At the beginning stages of his business, he rented a stall at Narantuul from another person who had a rental contract with Narantuul. This was an unstable business situation for him because the middleman could dismiss him at any time. Usually, it is very difficult to obtain a rental contract with Narantuul because the stalls are in such high demand. However, in 2008, Erdenedalai had the opportunity to sign a rental contract directly with Narantuul in order to make his business more stable.

As a result of his hard work, today he has 3,000,000 MNT in his working capital. Besides that, with the profit of her business, he bought a used car, as transportation has became an essential need for his family. Erdenedalai is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT in order to purchase more clothes for spring. 

His goal for 2011 is to build his own house, where his family can enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for spring to offer for sale in his retail stall

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa C. is from the town of Guinatan, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 38 and single. Felisa own a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over three years, earning approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Felisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her food products. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Bassel

texts.ar: باسل عمره 28 سنة اعزب يعمل في محل للحلاقة رجالي له في عمله 6 سنوات يحب عمله ويريد دائما تطويره وتحسينه يريد دائما تحسين ظروفه المادية والاجتماعية فهو يسعى جاهدا الى تأسيس عائلة محبوب من محيطه العملي له زبائن كثر من محيط ضيعته وجوارها يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء كرسي للحلاقة و شراء ذهب للخطوبة فهو يسعى الى هذه الخطوة وذلك من حبه الى تكوين عائلة
texts.en: Bassel is 28 years old and single. He works in a barber shop for men and he has six years of experience in this line of work. He likes his work and is always looking for ways to develop his business. He would like to improve his material circumstances and his social status because he would like to start a family. He is well-liked by his work community. He has many customers from his community and his neighborhood. With a loan from al-Majmoua, Bassel would like to buy some salon chairs as well as the gold required in his society for an engagement. He very much wants to go through with the engagement process soon, as he would love to start a family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy several new salon chairs for his barber shop.

loans.name: Nuevo Manantial 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Mariluz lives in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town north of Santo Domingo. Mariluz and her group of ten members are taking loans for their businesses. This group is named Nuevo Manantial 1 & 2 (New fountain).

Mariluz requires a loan to buy different styles of shoes, swimwear and underwear. This is her first loan with Esperanza International. She will take a step toward improving her business by investing this loan to increase her sales. She has had her business for over two years. Before that she was unemployed and a friend helped her by sending her underwear to sell. When she started to sell them she lived on the income and began to sell in bigger quantities.

She has three children, all of whom live together with her and their father. She will use the profits as savings. Her most difficult challenges are to travel and to take her business sales into a big store.

She says that her favorite thing is to read and study. Mariluz and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy shoes, swimwear and underwear.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor tiene 28 años D. edad y vive en casa D. sus padres junto con su esposo e hijo menor que se encuentra en edad escolar. Flor goza D. muy buenas referencias personales y laborales manifestadas por vecinos y amigos. La comunidad donD. vive es una comunidad pequeña la cual goza D. todos sus servicios básicos como agua y energía eléctrica. Esta comunidad se encuentra en el distrito D. Salas en Lambayeque.

Flor se dedica a la venta D. dulces, helados caseros, papas, gaseosas y pasteles, en un kiosco ubicado en el colegio más representativo D. la zona D. Salas. Flor desea construir un kiosco D. mejor calidad, para brindar un mejor servicio.

Ella solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles para la compra D. materiales como petates, calaminas y  triplay, para la construcción D. su nuevo kiosco. Esto ayudará  a Flor a tener una mayor clientela y por enD. mejorar sus ventas para tener un mejor nivel D. vida.
texts.en:
Flor is 28 years old and she lives at home with her parents, together with her husband and their school-aged son. Flor enjoys very good personal and work-related references set forth by her neighbors and friends. The community where she lives is a small community where all the basic services are enjoyed, including water and electricity. This community is in the district of Salas in Lambayeque.

Flor sells sweets, home-maD. icecreams, fries, soft drinks, and pastries from a kiosk located in the largest school in the region of Salas. Flor wants to build a better quality kiosk to proviD. a better level of service.

She requests from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase ingredients such as mats, corrugated materials and three-ply wood to build her new kiosk. This will help Flor to have a larger clientele and in turn, greater sales to improve the quality of her life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a kiosk.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RENOVACION”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia  Celestina, la socia  tiene 55 años de edad y La socia es casada; La socia  tiene 4 hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración y atención personal de sus tienda de abarrotes, la socia desea implementar dicha tienda y poder comprar productos de primera necesidad; arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite entre otros, la socia tiene su tienda de abarrotes y también se dedica  a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, ella trabaja vendiendo a sus amistades  y lleva sus catálogos y ofrece los productos de belleza una vez  que el llegan los pedidos ella los distribuye y al cabo de 2 semanas va a cobrar, los clientes le suelen pagar de a pocos o en dos partes es por eso que ella desea contar con un dinero para pagar en una sola y poder esperar cuando sus clientes le cancelen, la socia desea invertir el préstamo que le otorgaran en la compra de productos de belleza y almacenar para ir vendiendo de a pocos. La socia solicita el préstamo del crédito para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza para la venta.
 
La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "RENOVACION".  She lives in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.

Celestina, 55, is married and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with managing and attending to her grocery store.  To stock her business she wants to buy basic needs products such as rice, sugar, pasta, milk, and oil, among other items.  She also sells beauty products by catalogue to her friends on a credit basis, collecting payment every two weeks.  Since some of the customers pay a little at a time or in two payments, she needs to have cash to pay for her orders all at once and not have to wait for her customers to pay.  She wants to use the loan to buy beauty products that she will store and sell little by little.  

Celestina is very grateful for the loan which will help her improve her lifestyle, and she is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Gloria Eulalia

texts.es:
Gloria es una madre D. familia  D. 42 años D. edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta sólo con servicio D. luz, ubicada en el distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Se cacteriza por que sus pobladores desarrollan la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Gloria se dedica hace varios años a la crianza y venta D. aves D. corral como gallinas, pavos y gallos, al por menor, los cría en su corral que se encuentra en la parte posterior D. su casa para mayor seguridad D. sus animales, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y granos natural, una vez que han completado su desarrollo los venD. a los distintos mercados D. Piura y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus gastos familiares.

Para poder incrementar sus ventas necesita un préstamo D. 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para  comprar más alimentos que aseguren su crecimiento D. sus animales y así ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes, con las ganancias podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su hogar.  Gloria es una mujer responsble, trabajadora y empeñosa por querer mejorar  económicamente y cumplir el sueño que es el poderle dar una profesión a su hijo en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Gloria, 42, lives with her husband and son in her own house, which only has electricity.  It is located in the district of TambogranD. which belongs to the department of Piura.  The inhabitants here are mainly involved in agriculture, livestock farming, and handicrafts.

For several years Gloria has been raising and selling chickens and turkeys.  She has a small farmyard behind her house for the animals' safety.  She gives them natural feed and grains.  Once they are ready for market she takes thems to Piura.  The income she obtains is used to cover household expenses.

To increase sales she needs a loan in the amount of 500 PEN, requested through Edpyme Alternative, to buy more feed to ensure proper development of the anmals so she can offer them at a higher price to customers.  With the earnings she will pay back the loan and improve her family's lifestyle.  Gloria is a responsible, hard-working, enterprising woman who wants to get ahead economically and accomplish her dream of giving her son a professional career in the near future.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fruit to sell in her fruit vending business.

Sally has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional fruit to sell in her fruit stall.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 51, has operated his metal and welding shop in Naivasha town for the last six years. He is married to Jane and they have three school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 13,000 KES well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy a drill and grinder to replace the ones he currently has, which are broken.

In the future, John hopes to expand and open a hardware store to run side by side with his welding shop.

loans.use: to buy a drill and grinder.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina tiene 52 años, su actividad es la elaboración de pastes de baños. Hace más de 28 años que se dedica a este negocio, no ha sido fácil mantenerlo pues la materia prima con la que ella elabora sus productos están muy caros, la buena administración de su negocio ha hecho que Rosa progrese lentamente pero lo está logrando. Actualmente solicita este crédito para la compra de hilos, tela, esponjas entre otros. Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida de su vivienda.
texts.en: Rosa Argentina is 52 and works sewing bath towels, an activity that she has done for 28 years.  Her business is challenged by high material prices, but  Rosa has been able to grow her sales slowly over time. She seeks this credit to buy cloth, material and padding for her products.  She hopes her profits will allow her to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy cloth, material, padding

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells tomatoes, kontommire (used in making a popular Ghanaian stew), cabbage, eggs, and salted fish at Abura. She is married to a cleaner. Her loan will be used to buy more vegetables to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 54-year-old married woman with four children who she lives in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her major dream is to build a permanent residential house for rental purposes. 

Rose sells used clothes and has been in business for five years. She has a desire to diversify her income generating activities by venturing into food sales as well. Rose needs this loan to buy maize, cassava flour, and groundnuts (peanuts) for resale.

loans.use: To buy maize, cassava flour, and groundnuts.

loans.name: Petrona Paula

texts.es: Petrona Paula tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Tiene 1 hijo a cargo. Su actividad económica es un kiosco que está ubicado en el parque.  Pues Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Petrona ha trabajado con esfuerzo y dedicación durante los años. Sus resultados han sido favorables para que siga con su negocio. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos como golosinas, refrescos, pan, sopas, galletas, cigarrillos, café y gaseosas. Sueña con ampliar más su actividad y mantenerla activa.
texts.en:
Petrona Paula has been working with the Fundación for a long time.  She has a son in her care.  For over eight years she has been running a kiosk in the park.  For a long time Petrona has worked with much effort and dedication.  The profits from her business have been favorable allowing her to keep her activity running.

She is requesting a loan to buy products such as sweets, softdrinks, bread, soups, cookies, cigarettes, coffee and sodas.  Her dream is to expand her business and keep it active.

loans.use: To buy sweets, softdrinks, bread, soups, cookies, cigarettes, coffee and sodas.

loans.name: Guljamal's Group

texts.en:
Guljamal is the leader of this group. She is 21 and, together with her husband, she brings up a son and a daughter. Both children are of preschool age. Four years ago, with an initial investment of 15000 soms, the family started to breed livestock. With the profits gained from reselling livestock they earn money to meet the family's needs. The monthly profit from the business is 3000 soms. With the loan, Guljamal wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future she wants to purchase a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Julio Demetrio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Julio Demetrio; el tiene 71 años de edad y es viudo y tiene 6 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de librería y también tiene un internet, el socio vende artículos de escritorio como cuadernos,lápices,borradores entre otros artículos de escritorio y también atiende un internet desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de estos negocios las ocia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de librería e internet. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como lápices, cuadernos y borradores y también para el mantenimiento de las computadoras.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Julio Demetrio is a member of the "Kanchary" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Julio Demetrio is 71 years old, widowed, and has six children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his stationery store business.  He also has an Internet cafe.  Julio sells stationery supplies including composition books, pencils and erasers.  He also serves in his Internet cafe from 8.00am to 10.00pm.  Through these businesses, he gets his children ahead.  He would like to expand and improve his stationery store and internet cafe.  He is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as pencils, composition books and erasers.  He would also like to have maintenance work done on his computers.

Julio is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pencils, composition books and erasers, and to have maintenance work carried out on his computers

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia tiene 31 años, es una mujer amable y muy talentosa, convive con su pareja, Ella trabaja en una pulpería en donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos como huevos, leche, carnes, pollos, cremas, golosinas, granos básicos, detergentes, fósforos y otros. es por eso que solicita el credito para la compra de materia prima, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que dispone de tiempo, es independiente y no tiene que rendir cuentas a nadie, ella es muy responsables, está muy agradecida pues los préstamos recibidos anteriormente le fueron de mucha ayuda y fueron muy bien invertido, espera contar nuevamente con su ayuda.
texts.en: Rosa Emilia is 31 years old and is a friendly and talented woman who lives with her partner. She works in a grocery store where she offers a wide variety of products such as eggs, milk, meat, chicken, creams, sweets, dry grains, detergents, matches and more. This is why she is asking for a loan to buy the raw materials for her business. What she likes about her work is that she has time, is independent and is not accountable to anyone. She is very responsible and is very grateful as the previous loans she received were of great help and were well invested. She hopes to have your support again.

loans.use: to buy eggs, milk, meat, chicken, creams, sweets, dry grains, detergents, matches and more.

loans.name: Tushirikiyane Group

texts.fr:
Safia est une commerçante âgée de 31ans qui habite au centre ville de  Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce de produits alimentaires (riz et haricots) depuis 5 ans. Elle a commence cette activité lorsqu’elle était cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée a Dieudonné et ont ensemble 2 enfants dont 1 étudie. 
 Le crédit Kiva  de 320,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de produits alimentaires (riz et haricots) à revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Tushirikiyane»
texts.en:
Safia is a businesswoman aged 31 who lives in the center of town in Gitega in the middle of the country. She has been selling foodstuffs (rice and beans) for five years. She began this business when she was a farmer. She attended school up to 6th grade. She is married to  Dieudonné and together they have 2 children of whom one is enrolled in school. 

The Kiva loan of 320,000 Burundi francs that she will receive will allow her to grow her working capital to buy large quantities of foodstuffs (rice and beans) for resale so that she can make a lot of profit. 

Safia is a member of the community group called "Tushirikiyane".

loans.use: to grow her working capital to buy big quantities of foodstuffs (rice and beans) for resale.

loans.name: Edis Argentina

texts.es: Edis, se decidió a tener un nuevo crédito, porque quiere mejorar en su negocio  surtiéndolo D. frutas como:sandia,piñas y papayas, el objetivo D. ella es tener más productos D. la canasta básica y ofrecerles a sus clientes. Los créditos anteriores le han ayudado a mejorar sus ventas y obtener más ingresos, D. esa forma le ha permitido mejorar las condiciones D. su familia que antes tenían.
texts.en: Edis decided to get a new loan because she wants to make her business better by stocking up on fruits like watermelon, pineapple, and papaya so she can offer her customers more basic needs items.  Her prior loans have helped her achieve higher sales and earn more, allowing her to improve conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy watermelon, pineapple, and papaya.

loans.name: Glorie

texts.en:
Glorie is from Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 31 years old. Glorie is married, and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Glorie operates a cooking business venture, making and selling a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Glorie has been engaged in her business for over five years, and earns PHP 5,840 a month from these activities.

Glorie is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. In 2010, Glorie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
This is Thelma, 55, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Her husband is Rodrigo, who is also her business partner. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, Thelma is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Thelma maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Thelma's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Thelma hopes to grow her business in the coming years and acquire her own house someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana Patricia, Es Casada con don Regino Ana tiene 29 años de edad y tiene dos hijos menores de edad ella tiene un negocio de confeccion de uniformes y su esposo le ayuda a la elavoracion de uniformes,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de material para la confeccion,ya que en este tiempo ella empieza a elavorar los uniformes para el otro año,el sueño de ella es agrandar mas su negocio y poder ayuda a su comunidad dando trabajo a personas que lo nececitan,al mismo tiempo mejorar su vivienda y la de su familia.
texts.en: Ana Patricia is married to Don Regino. Ana is 29 years old and has 2 children, both minors. She has a business making uniforms and her husband helps her make them. She is asking for this loan to buy fabric with which to sew as at this time of the year she starts making uniforms for the next year. Her dream is to grow her business more and be able to help her community by providing jobs for those who need it while at the same time improving her house as well as her family's house.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials with which to make uniforms.

loans.name: 03.1.65 Quảng Hưng Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghệ has a service business building. She is requesting a loan to purchase a machine to restrain concrete when they ceil the ceiling or when She makes something by concrete, she use this machine to fix the thing.

Nghệ is 48 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the leader of a seven-member group, the 65 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. 

In 2010, Nghệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nghệ has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Nghệ has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Nghệ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nghệ hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a  restrain concrete machine.

loans.name: Gulshan's Group

texts.en:
Gulshan has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the expansion of her sewing center business. She is very skilful in her work and has trained many females in her community. She also receives orders from different clients and completes those orders to supplement the income for her family. With the loan investment, she will buy another sewing machine and hire a worker for her assistance. This will help her expand her business and increase her profits.
 
Her husband is a fruit seller and offers his clients fresh seasonal fruits. Gulshan has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Her daughters are embroidery experts and her sons stay at home. 

She is confident that she will get further success in her business after an investment.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and hire a worker

loans.name: Prisila

texts.en: Prisila is 66 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated. Prisila has a shop that sells vegetables, spices & food seasonings. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy vegetables, spices & food seasonings for resale. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Prisila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, spices & food seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Costa

texts.es:
La señora costa tiene 33 años está casada con el señor Javier, juntos tienen 4 hijos de los cuales tiene 2 gemelas, son una familia de escasos  recursos económicos pero muy unidos, gracias al trabajo del marido han logrado reunir y comprarse un  lote de terreno donde construyeron una pequeña casa donde actualmente viven en la zona de Alto Cotapachi de la ciudad de Cochabamba.
La principal actividad de la señora Costa es la cría y venta de cerdos, ella compra cerdos pequeños, para luego engordarlos y vender a un precio más alto, de esta manera ella genera un ingreso mas para mantener a sus hijos.
El destino del crédito es para la compra de cerdos, ya que estas fiestas de navidad término de vender todo los cerdos que había criado, este crédito le ayudara mucho porque comprara más cerdos los engordara y de esa manera generara más ingreso.
Entre sus sueños y metas esta tener una pequeña granja de cerdos, porque ella declara que le va muy bien en dicha actividad, y que sus 4 hijos puedan estudiar una carrera profesional para que de esa manera puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Costa is 33 years old and married to Javier. Together they have four children, two of whom are twin girls. They are a family of scarce economic resources but are very close. Thanks to Javier's work, they have succeeded in locating and buying a plot of land on which they built the small house they currently live in, which is located in the zone of Alto Cotapachi in the city of Cochabamba. Costa's primary activity is the raising and sale of pigs. She buys small pigs, and then she fattens them and sells them at a higher price. In this way, she generates more income in order to sustain her children. The purpose of this loan is to buy pigs. Since she sold all of her pigs during the Christmas season, this loan will greatly help her by letting her buy more pigs. She will fatten them and this way generate more income. Among her dreams and goals is to have a small farm of pigs, because she says this activity is going well for her and that her four children will be able to study a professional career and therefore have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Mujeres Soñadoras Group

texts.es: El grupo está conformado por cuatro socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Irene mujer de 37 años de edad, casada, con tres hijos de 20, 14 y 4 años, su negocio es la venta de ropa desde hace un año. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de mercadería como blusas, talladores, camisetas, camisolas, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, etc. Vilma mujer de 60 años se dedica al negocio de la elaboración y venta de nacatamales, Anita mujer de 29 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y Dominga mujer de 57 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de comida.
texts.en:
The group is composed of 4 enterprising members, one of whom is Irene, a 37-year-old women who is married and has 3 children, ages 20, 14, and 4. Her business, for roughly a year now, is selling clothing. The loan she requests is for purchasing merchandise such as blouses, t-shirts, camisoles, shirts, pants, dresses, etc. 

Vilma is a 60-year-old woman who makes and sells Nicaraguan-style tamales. Anita is a 29-year-old woman whose business is selling clothing, and Dominga is a 57-year-old woman whose business is selling meals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as blouses, t-shirts, camisoles, shirts, pants, dresses, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is aged 31 years and is still single. She has applied for a loan of ugx 1,200,000 (One million two hundred thousand shillings only) to buy maize flour to sell to her customers. With the loan, she will be able to buy in a large volume, and cheaply. This will increase her profit margin. 

She started in the year 2009 with high hopes of earning income to look after her family. Her business is located in a trading center and her clients are hotel people. She is a hard working woman who works 10 hours a day and 6 days a week, but is faced with a challenge of limited working capital. She hopes to boost her businesses after getting a loan. 

Her dream is to buy land. She appreciates the support from Kiva lenders. Pictured is Prossy with the UGAFODE credit officer (right to left).

loans.use: To buy corn flour

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: I changed to this business six (6) years ago and I have no cause to regret it. Though I am 61 years old; my numerous customers always give me satisfactions, says Mrs. Esther I.. She needs the above amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and drinks for sale

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Fisher by profession for twenty years, Mr. Faustin D. was born in 1966 in Agbanakin, where he currently lives. Having five people in his care, his only job is fishing, which is his main income-generating activity. The loans he obtained previously allowed him to buy a pirogue (fishing boat), and now, he has a certain freedom compared to his peers. This pirogue does not work as it used to and needs to be replaced; this requires means which he does not have.

Conscious of the danger facing him and the need to buy another pirogue and new nets, he is asking for a loan of $950 to deal with this. The loan will also serve to construct a shed where women will come to buy his fish; this will make his business competitive, give him financial autonomy, and allow him to decently meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Pêcheur de profession depuis vingt ans, Monsieur D. Faustin est né en 1966 à Agbanakin où il vit actuellement. Ayant cinq personnes en charge, il ne pratique que la pêche qui constitue pour lui sa principale activité génératrice de revenu. Les crédits précédemment reçus lui ont permis d’acheter une pirogue et aujourd’hui, il a une certaine autonomie vis-à-vis de certains de ses pairs. Cette pirogue ne répond plus tellement et mérite d’être remplacé ; ceci nécessite des moyens dont il ne dispose pas.

Conscient du danger qui le menace et le besoin d’acheter une autre pirogue et des filets neufs, il sollicite un crédit de $950 pour y faire face. Le crédit servira également à construire un hangar sous lequel les femmes viendront acheter des poissons ; ce qui rendra compétitive son activité et va lui conférer une autonomie financière et subvenir de façon décente aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a new pirogue (fishing boat), nets and to build a shed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow for his dairy farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her spare parts business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet K. is a young entrepreneur, aged 30. She is married with three children aged six, four and two years. Her first-born is in primary one while the rest spend their time with their grandmother.

Juliet sells matoke (green bananas), a staple food for Baganda and Banyankore. There is ready market because a big percentage of the population in Kampala eat matoke. In addition to matoke, she sells tomatoes, onions and cassava at wholesale. In a week she is able to make two trips, which give her net sales of about USD860 and a net profit of about USD170.

She started with a loan of USD100, and to date she has built a permanent house with her husband who sells motor spare parts. She plans to buy her own pick-up in future to help her transport her bananas and other food items. This will cut the cost of transport as well as supplying matoke to clients on time.

loans.use: Juliet wants to buy more bunches of matoke, at least a lorry-load per week, to meet the ever increasing demand.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Maria M.. I have a small business where I sell popular consumption items. I have worked in this business for 3 years and my clients are my neighbors. The revenues from my general store help me to purchase medicines and also to take some of the burden off my husband with other family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Maria M. tengo este pequeño negocio en donde vendo productos de consumo popular. hace 3 años que me dedico en esta actividad, mis clientes son mis vecinos. Con los ingresos que recibo de esta pulperia me ayuda para mis medicinas y tambien ayudo a mi esposo con otros gastos familiares.

loans.use: Purchase of churros, toilet paper, balls, candies, juices, pills, tooth paste, instant soup, salsas, chiles, salt, sugar, butter, and beans.

loans.name: Sophoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Sophoeun married in 1997 and has three children - one son and two daughters. She began weaving silk at home in 1993 after she learned to weave silk from her mother. Her husband, Mr. Kroeun Sophy, plants tomatoes, which he started in 1990. In addition, he also raises cows for reselling. They both did not receive very much education. Therefore, all of their children are being sent to primary school in the village nearby. They expect that with the existing business and receiving a loan from MAXIMA, their living conditions will be better in the future, so that they can afford to support all of their children's higher education.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA five times already. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of $200. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the new loom she has recently set up. She will also hire her neighbor to weave.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the new loom

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.en:
Amina, age 31, has a daughter who is 4 years old. She owns a salon, which she began 5 years ago. Her business is open from 8am to 8pm daily, and she makes a monthly profit of about $136.

In the past, Amina took out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business. She now hopes for a new loan to open another salon. She will be sharing this loan with her subgroup members who own shops and salons.

In the picture, Amina is the first from the right.

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Olih

texts.en: Olih, 39, is the mother of 5 children. She has a grocery store at her house where she sells spices, eggs, salty fish, etc., earning about $18 a day. Her husband, D., is a coolie at a construction site who earns about $10 a week. She is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her little grocery store

loans.name: Somoye's Ushirika Group

texts.en:
Somoye is 36 years old and is married woman with two 16-year-old children. She and her husband also take care of two other people, aged 60 and 65 years old. Somoye owns a small food vendor store that she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.
