Somoye now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food selling.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosas Group

texts.en:
Ana B. is a gracious 44-year-old woman who lives with her husband (36 years old) and her five children (ages: 25, 24, 22, 18, 6). She currently runs a small business out of her home selling clothes and shoes. During her free time she loves to go to her church or read her Bible. Her favorite foods are soup and beans, and her dream for the future is that she would one day have a large, beautiful store to sell her merchandise from.

This will be the first loan that this community of Maimon, Puerto Plata has applied for with Esperanza. For many of these women, credit has been a foreign concept and this is the first opportunity they have had to receive a loan. Maimon is located on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, where beautiful all-inclusive hotels and slums sit only minutes apart. It is our hope in Esperanza that this community will grow together throughout the next six months towards a better and sustainable future. On behalf of Esperanza and the women of Maimon, thank you for your support and generosity!

loans.use: Purchase shoes, sandals, jeans, khaki pants, T-shirts, dresses, skirts, blouses, collared shirts

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
Constantina has been a member of the AnabelL. Bank Communal for 3 years.

She is a single mother, 38 years old, and has two children. She sells potatoes, vegetables, grains and groceries in the Ayacucho jungle , distributing them wholesale and retail to several villages in the area. She plans to get loan to buy a motor taxi.

Constantina needs a loan of $1,100.00 to purchase a motor taxi and various vegetables.

Constantina dreams of having a stable business, raising her children, and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Amani R., Kiva volunteer.

Constantina es socia del Banco Comunal AnabelL. hace 3 años.

Constantina es madre soltera, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Constantina venD. papa, verduras, cereales y abarrotes en L. selva ayacuchana, reparte por mayor y menor en los diferentes pueblos D. L. zona. Constantina con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar una mototaxi.

Constantina necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. un mototaxi y diversas verduras.

Los sueños D. Constantina son tener una tienda estable, sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase a motor taxi and various vegetables.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Pascual Vicente R. is an entrepreneur who realized he had a brilliant opportunity for business in his city: there was not a single repair shop. He therefore had no doubt when he invested his money and formed his own repair shop. In addition to the store, Pascual is the owner of a body shop. He makes many sales in having these businesses together because the customers of one become customers of the other.

The income obtained from the workshop and from the spare parts shop allows Pascual Vicente R. and his family to have a decent living through the great effort they make day after day.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Pascual Vicente R. es un emprendedor que se dio cuenta de una brillante oportunidad de negocios en su ciudad: no había ninguna casa de repuestos. Entonces no dudo en invertir su dinero y así formo su propia casa de repuestos. Además de la tienda, Pascual es propietario de un taller mecánico. El quita muchas ventajas de estas empresas conjuntas debido a que los clientes se una de ellas se vuelven clientes de la otra.

El ingreso obtenido en el taller y en la casa de repuestos, hacen que Pascual Vicente R. y su familia tengan una digna, a través del gran esfuerzo que realizan día tras día

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for vehicles

loans.name: Jesús Rolando

texts.es:
Jesús, a young father, works making bricks. His daily routine consists of getting up very early, making his way to the quarry and mixing each one of the products needed for the perfect preparation of mixture for the brick. His effort is constant in spite of the harshness of the weather and his courage is nourished by the love of his two children, knowing that they won’t lack anything. Jesús is requesting your help in order to invest in his brick factory and support his wife with her embroidery work.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer. Jesús, joven padre de familia, se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos. Su rutina diaria consiste en levantarse muy de mañana, dirigirse a la cantera y mezclar cada uno de los insumos para la preparación perfecta de la mezcla para el ladrillo. Su esfuerzo es constante sin importarle las inclemencias del clima, esta valentía es alimentada por al amor de sus 2 hijos, para que a ellos no les falte nada. Jesús solicita su apoyo para invertir en su fábrica de ladrillos y apoyar a su esposa con su trabajo de bordados.

loans.use: Increase business capital for his brick factory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business of selling fried dishes.

loans.name: Oluwashehun

texts.en:
Oluwashehun O. is a photographer and also engages in video coverage and she sells film. She learned how to take pictures two years ago. Oluwashehun is 50-years-old and is married with three children. The family lives in Ojodu, Ogun State, Nigeria.

She is requesting a loan to buy more film and a small camera and flash for her business expansion. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more film and one small camera and flash

loans.name: Dina Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 24 años de edad, estudió quinto de secundaria, es casada y madre de una niña de tres años de edad. Vive en la avenida de los niños S/N, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000”- Mazocruz. Desde hace 04 años decidió integrar el Banco Comunal por falta de capital, en un inicio le prestaron S/.300 Nuevos Soles, con el cual compró 02  alpacas. Ella siempre trabajaba en el negocio de carne, apoyando a su madre, cuando ya tuvo su pareja a los 20 años de edad empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia también en la venta de carne. Ella compra alpacas, llamas y ovinos en Laraqueri, Toquepala, Carumas, etc. A su vez lleva mercadería para vender, como azúcar, arroz, fideos y otros, los cuales los vende en las ferias de los lugares ya mencionados. Generalmente entrega entre 20 a 30 degollados de carne a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual será pagado en 04 cuotas, comprará 05 alpacas que serán entregados en carne a los mayoristas.

Su meta es exportar carne de alpaca por la demanda que existe en el extranjero y también que su hija estudie y sea una profesional.
texts.en:
Isabel is 24 years old and studied until the fifth grade of secondary school. She is married, and the mother of one daughter who is three years old. She lives on Los Niños Avenue, Mazocruz district, in the province of El Collao, Puno.

She is a member of the communal bank "Generación 2000" in Mazocruz. She decided to become a member four years ago due to lack of capital. At the beginning, she was loaned 300.00 soles with which she purchased two alpacas. She has always worked in the business of selling butchered meat, supporting her mother. When she married at 20 years of age, she started working for herself in the same trade. She purchases alpacas, llamas, and sheep in the towns of Laraqueri, Toquepala, Carumas, etc. At the same time, she takes merchandise to sell such as sugar, rice, noodles, among others, which she sells at the markets in the aforementioned areas. Generally, she delivers 20 to 30 butchered animals per week to the wholesalers in the city of Tacna.

With this loan of 1,000.00 soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will buy five alpacas who will be delivered as meat to the wholesalers.

Her goal is to export alpaca meat given the demand for it outside the country, and she also hopes to see her daughter finish her education and become a professional.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of five alpacas.

loans.name: Pharn

texts.en: Mr. Pharn N. is 38 years old and makes a living selling oxen. Normally, he buys oxen from breeders and holds on to them for a while before selling them for a profit. He earns around 20000 Riel ($5) per day. He is married to Mrs. Prak Thun, 36, who has made a living for the past 18 years as a rice farmer and earns around 15,000 Riel ($3.75) per day. Pharn has two children, both of whom are very young and live at home. The family lives in Lveng Rusei Commune, Siem Reap Province. Currently, Pharn’s business is going well but he has applied for a loan to buy more oxen. He would also like to buy rice to resell when the price goes higher. Mr. Pharn's wife is pictured because he was not available when we took the photo.

loans.use: to buy oxen and rice for resale later

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Dy C., 24, is married and lives with her husband and child in the Siem Reap province, Cambodia. Since 2003, she has been growing rice crops and selling them, making about US$3 per day, while her husband, engaged in the firewood-sales business, earns approximately US$5 per day. 
Dy C. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase a cow. The cow will help Dy C. plow the farmland and will pull the cart that Dy C.'s husband uses to transport wood.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Joël

texts.fr:
Né en 1978 à Dogbo, Monsieur M. Joël est un jeune maçon  très dynamique et qui, de par la qualité de son travail, est arrivé à gagner la confiance de beaucoup de gens et de certains services publiques et privés. Marié et père de trois (03) enfants, il vit avec sa petite famille à Aného où il exerce son métier. Très sollicité et disposant de beaucoup de chantiers dans la préfecture, il n’arrive plus à surveiller les travaux pour lesquels il mobilise souvent ses apprentis et d’autres maîtres maçons.
Son irrégularité sur les chantiers est source de mécontentement de la part des gens qui lui confient les travaux. Pour faciliter ses déplacements et pour pouvoir coordonner et superviser ses chantiers, il a besoin d’un moyen de déplacement adéquat. Des moyens financiers faisant défaut, il sollicite un crédit  pour s’acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Born in 1978 in Dogbo, Mr. Joël M. is a very energetic, young mason. By the quality of his work, he manages to earn the trust of many people and certain governmental and private organizations. Married and the father of three, he lives with his small family in Aného, where he practices his trade. Though he is in high demand and works at many locations in the prefecture, he is no longer able to oversee the jobs for which he often mobilizes his apprentices and master masons. His spotty work site coverage is the source of discontent for people who entrust their projects to him. To facilitate the trips he makes to coordinate and supervise his work sites, he needs a means of adequate transport. Lacking the financial means, he is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a means of transport for his work

loans.name: Aysel

texts.en: Aysel N. is very young entrepreneur at 18 years of age. She just finished school and already has a business mind. Poverty in her family pushed her to work from a young age. Her parents have land where they raise crops to sell to the local bazaar traders. Aysel analyzed the commodity most demanded by the people living in her city and concluded that meat-selling is the most profitable business. From money she saved, she purchased one calf and now is raising it for sale in four more months. Her parents support her and have approved her asking for a loan to purchase two more calves. Let’s do our best to help this young and brave girl!

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Aparicio

texts.es:
Aparicio es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva Piedra en quechua.
Aparicio es casada, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos, Aparicio viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra ganado vacuno, los animales los vende en la feria de San Juan y también los beneficia en vende por mayor a los carniceros.
Aparicio necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno.
Los sueños de Aparicio son mejorar su negocio, tener capital propio y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Aparicio is a member of the Musuq Rumi Community Bank, which means New Rock in Quechua. He is a 48-year-old married father of six. He travels to the different flea markets in the region in search of heads of cattle to purchase, which he then sells at the San Juan flea market and also sells them at wholesale to butchers. Aparicio needs a loan of 2,000 soles, which he plans to use to purchase more heads of cattle. His dreams are to improve his business, establish his own wealth and improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase heads of cattle

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija N. is 28 years old and married.  She lives in Bekaaeith with her husband and their two children, where she also owns a small clothing store that offers clothing for men, women, and children.  Khadija's shop is in a very busy location, and she also offers low prices to her customers and thereby enjoys commercial success.  But in order to expand her business and attract even more clients, she is for the first time requesting a loan of $1000, which will be used to purchase a greater variety of clothes to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of clothes.

loans.name: Mirzohait

texts.ru: Мирзохаит мужчина 36 лет , женат имеет четверых детей. Его жена работает в колхозной ферме дояркой. За свою работу она получает вместо денег продукты питания. Сам Мирзохаит мастер по стройке жилых домов. Работа  Мирзохаита  сезонная, поэтому он дополнительно занимается бизнесом животноводства. Купив в кредит скот Мирзохаит  говорит , что погашение будет производить с дохода своей работы, т.к. весна и лето сезон строек. Сейчас у  него дома три коровы, число которых Мирзохаит хочет увеличить.
texts.en:
Mirzohait is a 36 year old man, he is married and has four children. His wife works at the collective farm as a dairymaid. As payment for her works she receives food products instead of money. Mirzohait himself is a construction worker for residential buildings. Mirzohait’s job is seasonal, which is why he also raises livestock. After purchasing livestock using his loan, Mirzohait says that he will pay the loan back using profits from his work, as spring and summer are construction season. Right now he has 3 cows at his home, Mirzohait would like to increase their number.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and sale of livestock

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia F. R. tiene mas de 25 años de dedicarse a la produccion y venta de rosquillas, actividad que realiza desde su casa de habitacion, a ella le ayudan sus hijas a la produccion de las rosquillas, y las distribuyen en diferentes negocios de la ciudad.
con los ingresos que le genera el negocio le ayuda a su esposo a cubrir con los gastos del hogar, en  el lugar donde ella vive es muy conocido por la produccion de rosquillas ya que son muy deliciosas y ricas, a esta actividad es la que se dedican la mayoria de los habitantes. tambien fabrican hojaldras y pan casero. ella necesita el credito para poder comprar mas materia prima y asi tener una mayor produccion
texts.en:
Otilia F. R. has for 25 years dedicated herself to the production and sale of doughnuts which she does from her home. Her daughters help her in the production of the doughnuts and they distribute them to different businesses in the city.

With the income that the business generates she helps her husband to cover the household expenses. The place where she lives is well known for the production of doughnuts as they are very delicious and tasty and this business is what most of the residents of the area do. She also makes puff pastries and homemade bread.

Otilia needs a loan to be able to buy more premium materials and thereby have a larger production.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese, corn, lard, flour, eggs, and firewood

loans.name: Bobo

texts.ru: Кодиров Бобо житель города Куляб. Возраст 44 года , разведен . Один воспитывает четверых детей. Имеет собственный магазин , где торгует продуктами питания , а так же хозяйственными товарами. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. так же он сможет увеличить ассортимент товара . Что привлечет новых клиентов и даст дополнительный доход.
texts.en:
K. Bobo is a resident of the city of Kulob. He is 44 years old and is divorced. He raises four children on his own. He has his own store where he sells food products and also household goods. Bobo plans to get a loan in order to increase his turnover, he will also be able to increase his product assortment. This will attract new customers and provide additional income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Amigos En Fe Group

texts.es:
el grupo Amigos en FE son unas personas muy unidas las cuales se tienen mucho aprecio entre ellas mismas, las actividades que realizan son las siguientes:
CARLOS SAMUEL V. P. el tiene en su casa de habitacion un molino para moler Maíz, y tambien venta de variedades como ser: Ropa de vestir, ropa interior, cosmeticos, sandalias de hule y otras. actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace un año, el se levanta a las 4:30 A.M a moler maíz y a las 7:30 A.M esta terminando de la molida, pero en el resto del dia se dedica a vender de manera ambulante con el negocio de variedades.- 
el Sr. V.,  es padre soltero y esta criando 2 hijos ya que el se separo de su esposa y es él 
quien mira por ellos, es un hombre que lo admiran los vecinos donde el recide por su responsabilidad como padre.
TERESA DE JESUS S. C. ella tiene 15 años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad ya que su madre tenia este tipo de negocio y ella era la encargada del mismo, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería C. PAVON ubicado en su casa de habitación; Doña Teresa, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos que depende a un 100% de ella, con los ingresos que le genera el negocio ella cubre los gastos de alimentación, Educación de sus hijos, y cubre los gastos finacieros que ella adquiere para su negocio.
ANGELA DEL ROSARIO S. S. ella se dedica a la producción y venta de tortillas de maíz, negocio que inicio por que la situación economica para su hogar no era muy favorable, ella vive en union libre y su compañero de hogar se dedica hacer trabajos de estructuras metalicas, es madre
de 2 hijos, que dependen de ellos, y con los ingresos que le genera el negocio ella colabora a su esposo a cubrir ciertos gastos del hogar, como ser alimentación y el estudio de su hija mayor.
texts.en:
The group “Amigos en FE” is made up of a handful of people who are united by their great mutual respect for each other. Their activities are as follows:

Carlos Samuel V. P. has a mill in his house to grind corn. He also sells various items such as clothes, underwear, cosmetics, rubber sandals and other things. He has been doing this work for almost a year. He gets up at 4:30am to grind corn which he finishes at 7:30am, but for the rest of the day he works as a peddler selling his various items.

Mr. V. is a single father and is bringing up 2 children now that he has separated from his wife and it is up to him to look out for them. He is a man much admired by his neighbours for his parenting skills.

Teresa de Jesus S. C. has 15 years’ experience because her mother had the same type of business which she was in charge of. Her business operates under the name of C. Pavon grocery store and is located in her house. Doña Teresa is a single mother and has 3 children who are 100% dependent upon her. With the income generated by her business she pays for their food, her children’s education and any costs arising from the business.

Angela del Rosario S. S. makes and sells corn tortillas, a business that came about because her financial situation at home was not very favourable. She lives with her partner who makes metal structures. She is mother to 2 children who are dependent upon her and with the income generated by her business she works with her husband to cover certain household expenses such as food and her eldest daughter’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy Sum Sandals, BEBE sandals, young men's sandals, rice, sugar, lard, corn flour, toilet paper, salsa, bleach, coffee, fire wood, corn and lime.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 43 year old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their three children. Laila has owned a clothing shop for five years. She also sells makeup. Laila requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her work for the summer season. This is her second cycle and she has always on time. 
Her previous loan helped her diversify her merchandise. Laila is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on doing her work because she wanted to depend on herself and supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Laila will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her work.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua M. sells fresh foodstuffs such as groundnuts (peanuts), rice and peppers in Abortoase. She did not receive any formal education. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a trader whose income is not enough to take care of the large family.

Akosua is responsible for paying all the utility bills including high electricity bills. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of the foodstuffs she sells to enable her take care of the large family she has. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of the foodstuffs she sells

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es social del Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre
Ana es casada  tiene 40 años, no tiene hijos.
Ana se esta dedicando a las ventas  de productos de belleza por catalogo, a la venta de zapatos por catalogo, y la venta de ropa, gracias Dios tiene bastantes clientas. 
Necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, que los va invertir en mercadería por fiestas patrias. 
El sueño que tiene Ana  es  seguir creciendo en el negocio y comprarse otro
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Bancomunal 24 de Octubre.

Ana is married, 40 years old, and does not have any children.

Ana sells beauty products and shoes through a catalog, as well as clothing. Fortunately, she has enough customers.

She needs a loan of 1200 soles, which she will invest in merchandise for the Independence Day holiday.

Ana’s dream is to continue growing her business and to buy another.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in merchandise for the Independence Day holiday

loans.name: Hidy

texts.en:
Hidy operates a small restaurant and bar. He is 32 years old and is married with two children.

Hidy hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase a generator and a deep-freezer which will help to attract more customers. He thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase a generator and a deep-freezer

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie E. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Winnie prepares and sells food snacks in the local community. Winnie has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month. In 2009, Winnie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Winnie is requesting her first loan from GDMPC, for 10000 PHP. which she will use to purchase raw ingredients for her food. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal El Sol.
Elsa es soltera, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, Elsa tiene un salón de belleza en un local alquilado, además vende golosinas y gaseosas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Elsa necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cremas, champú.
Los sueños de Elsa son tener una tienda grande en el centro de la ciudad y casa propia.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the communal bank, "El Sol." She is single, is 32, and has one son. She has a beauty salon in a rented location where she also sells candy and soft drinks. She does this every day. She needs a loan of 1050 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of creams and shampoo. Elsa's dreams are to have a large store in the middle of the city and to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase creams and shampoo

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 48 years old and married with 6 children. She sells provisions like milk, noodles, toothpaste, detergent, etc. She opens her shop daily from 7am-7pm. She is a hard-working woman. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Believe In Allah Group

texts.en:
Believe in Allah is a group of 5 borrowers led by Dabah D.. Dabah is married with 6 children aged one to 20 years old, whose educational levels are from first grade to first year in college. Dabah is illiterate due to the fact that during the early 1960s, Muslims parents didn't usually send their girl children to school.

Dabah's business is in buying charcoal wholesale and selling in retail to the residents of River View community, Northern Monrovia, Liberia. This community is isolated and poor. She has been running this business for 25 years and is grateful to the business for being there for her and her family.
The rainy season is the only obstacle to Dabah's business, because when it is wet, it can be very hard to produce charcoal. With her good relations with customers, her business has been doing well.

She is hoping to expand her business in order to build a house for her and her family. Dabah needs this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand business.

loans.use: Dabah needs this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Lalam

texts.en:
Lalam E. sells charcoal at home. She is requesting a loan to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. Lalam is 27 years old. Her husband is a security guard. She has 3 children who children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Faridah's Group

texts.en:
N. Faridah is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 35 years old and a very hardworking lady.

Faridah has a charcoal-selling business that she has owned for eight years now in Kito village. She usually buys her charcoal in bags from the villages and loads them on a truck to her selling place. She is happy that the loans have always helped her manage her business. She is a friendly lady and this has won her many customers, hence making more sales.

Faridah hopes to expand her business in future so that her standard of living improves. She is a married lady with six children aged 15 years to 1 month and she takes care of other orphans including paying their school fees. She needs a loan to help introduce another business selling firewood, so that she can make more profits.

loans.use: To buy firewood for business expansion

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is engaged in vending vegetables in their village. She sells her products three times a week in the market and she is thankful that she helps her husband with her simple business. Josefina has a vegetable garden in their backyard where she gets some of the vegetables she sells. For more income, she also purchases additional vegetables to retail. Josefina also accepts laundry business whenever she is not in the market and this gives her an extra income. 

Josefina is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 as her additional capital to further grow her business. She will use it to buy more vegetables to sell in the market. This will help her earn more income to use for the allowances of her children who are all studying.

Josefina is very blessed to have five intelligent children. Her three elder children are scholars of the Local Government Unit and she is only supporting the tuition fees of her two younger children who are both in elementary school. Josefina is married to Felomeno, who earns an income being a caretaker of an eight-hectare farm. The couple hopes for a good future for their child. That’s why they also do their part as parents to provide their other needs. Their family lives happily in the village of San Manuel, Naguilian, Isabela.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bawji

texts.en:
Bawji is a 45 year old single mother of two children aged between 17 and 20. Both her children go to school. She owns and resides in a five room house where she stays with seven people. Bawji takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day.

She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Bawji goes door to door selling African attire and ladies hand bags. She incurs transport costs to and from buying African attire and ladies hand bags from DRC (Democratic Republic of Congo). She works seven days a week. She receives an average of five customers a day and sells to all categories of people in retail. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding her family and school fees for her children. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. She has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for seven years, now servicing her sixteenth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more rolls of African attire (bitengi) and ladies hand bags. She aspires to see her business grow bigger, to start selling wholesale only, and to also own a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To buy more African ware and hand bags

loans.name: Tusooka Kwavula Group 2, Lugazi

texts.en: N. Jane is 34 years old and married with five children aged 4-16 years all in secondary and primary schools.  She also takes care of her siblings. Jane has had a retail shop in Nakazadde trading centre for four years and she is able to make 150,000 (local currency) as weekly profits from its sales. She is also a clerk in Scoul ‘a sugar corporation in Lugazi’ thereby being able to have a second income every month. She says that she is successful because of her loans that help her restock as well as the good customer care she offers to her customers.  She hopes to become a wholesaler in the future and to allow her children to pursue a their education. Jane needs a loan to be able to add more capital in her business for a steady supply of products to her customers. She is a very determined lady.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Onyebuchi

texts.en:
Onyebuchi has a pharmacy and a grocery store, where he sells medicine as well as such items as tomato paste, tinned milk, and tea. He has been in this business for four years and is doing well.

He wants to expand his business by buying more goods for sale. He hopes to receive a loan in the amount of N150, 000 loans in order to purchase goods in bulk. He is a focused, hard-working man who puts in long hours making every effort to keep his businesses sustainable. One of his greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction he is able to have with his customers.

Onyebuchi is 27 years old. He hails from the state of Ebonyi, and he lives and works in Lagos. He sends his thanks to Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and medicines for sale

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo C. M., tiene la edad de 40 años, es casado, y tiene 3 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 16 y 9 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de novillas de terneros y la compra de una vaca de leche,el señor cuenta con una área de pasto donde tendrá a los animales para su crianza, el está seguro de que puede darle un buen mantenimiento y así cuando las venda obtener una ganancia. Es la primera vez que se financea con  FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho, ya que por la ayuda ha logrado sacar adelante los diferentes proyectos que se ha planteado, además que está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, estudios y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Rodolfo Chacon Marin is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children, who are his top priority. His sons are 16 and 9 years old, respectively. He wants the loan to buy calves and a dairy cow. Mr. Chacon Marin has a pasture where he will raise the animals; he is sure he can care for them well and thus sell them for a profit. This is his first time financing with FUDECOSUR. He says that the credit committee has helped him a lot, since the aid has allowed him to move forward with the various projects he has considered taking on. He is also very happy with the facilities provided to him. In the future, he hopes to provide his children with a better quality of life, schooling, and improved economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Livestock

loans.name: Noi's Group

texts.en:
Nối Thị Đồng (id: 010117140052) was born in 1955. At the present time she is living in Xóm Ngoài 1 with her husband and three grown-up children.

For about four years, Nối Thị Đồng has been raising poultry and selling vegetables to earn a living. Specifically, those jobs provide her with an income of approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

From 2005, Nối Thị Đồng has taken part in SEDA’s program and has repaid her loans punctually. Currently, she needs to borrow 7,630,000 VND (approximately 420 USD) to invest more in her business, wishing that it will turn a profit so that her family may have a sum of money to buy more furniture.

In regard to other members in her group:

Năm Thị Nguyễn (id: 010117140053) is 55 years old. She wants to take out a loan of 7,194,000 VND (approximately 395 USD) to sell clothes.

Hà Thị Nguyễn (id 010117140054) is 41. She also wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND (approximately 395 USD) to raise poultry and to open a forge.

Hưng Thị Nguyễn (id: 010117140005) is 53. She needs to take out a loan of 6,758,000 VND (approximately 370 USD) to invest in selling sugarcane.

Nhung Thị Nguyễn (id: 010117140055) is 39. She would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND (approximately 345 USD) to grow vegetables.

loans.use: To invest more in her businesses

loans.name: Suzzi

texts.en: Suzzi L. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to buy beans, rice and posho (a hot, sticky dough or porridge made from maize or cassava) to sell. Suzzi is 28 years old and is married to a policeman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice and posho to sell

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda, de 43 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo Pedro (47) y sus 2 menores hijos.
Desde hace 3 años instaló en su vivienda una pequeña librería, al principio acondicionó su sala para ello, pero tiempo después acondicionó su mercadería en estantes y colocó una puerta para atender con mayor comodidad. A ella le gusta mucho vender útiles escolares y de escritorio porque es un trabajo tranquilo y lo puede realizar en su casa, sin descuidar la crianza de sus pequeños. Lo que no le agrada es el polvo que hay en la zona por donde vive, ya que constantemente deteriora su mercadería. Hermelinda atiende desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche y también ofrece algunos adornos y muñecos de peluche, los cuales tienen bastante demanda, por ello está muy satisfecha, ya que con las ganancias de su librería - bazar puede ayudar en los gastos del hogar a su esposo. 

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando. Con el dinero solicitado tiene planeado invertir en la compra de más cuadernos para abastecer su librería, ya que empezó la época escolar y éstos tendrán mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Pedro (age 47) and their two dependent children. Three years ago, she established a small bookstore in her home. From the start she set it up in her living room, and shortly thereafter installed shelves for holding merchandise and a door to make it feel more comfortable. She enjoys selling school supplies and stationery because it is quiet work that can be performed at home without having to leave her children. What she does not like is the dust that accumulates in the area where she lives because it constantly causes her merchandise to deteriorate. Hermelinda operates her store from 7am until 9pm and also sells decorations and stuffed toys that have sufficient demand. She is very happy because the income generated from her bookstore-bazaar has allowed her to help her husband with the household expenses.

This is her first loan with MFP. Hermelinda is grateful to everyone who made it possible for her to access this loan that will allow her to continue working. With the money she is requesting, she plans to buy more notebooks to restock her bookstore. The school year has already started and these products are in great demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks to increase her inventory

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Yem S. is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is engaged in the business of selling various kinds of groceries at home. She also buys vegetables from local farmers in her province for resale and she plants bananas on her own plot of farmland, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover her family expenses. Her husband is a driver for his brother’s car, earning an income of USD 4.10 per day. Their standard of living has improved since they have had these businesses. S. is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to buy bananas for sale when the price is good. She also wants to dig a well. This is her second loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy bananas and dig a well

loans.name: Soknak

texts.en:
Mrs. Soknak N., age 48, is a widow with three children: two sons and one daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Soknak has been a silk weaver since she was 29 years old. Besides selling her own products, she also buys silk fabric from weavers in her village and sells to the middleman who comes to buy it at her house.

Soknak is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business and to buy finished silk fabric for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials (raw silk) for continuing her weaving business and to buy finished silk fabric for resale

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.en:
Baltazar M. is from the village of Westfield in Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 44 years old. Baltazar is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Baltazar sells bamboo products in the local community. Baltazar is just starting this business.

In 2010, Baltazar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Baltazar is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional bamboo products to sell. This will be Baltazar's first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shirts

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie G., 42, is making sure that her family has enough provided for their daily needs. Married to Jaime G., a jail officer, they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own electronic cellular phone load business for quite some time now.

Angie has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her loading business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 16,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying load for different networks and thus replenish her inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying load for different networks and thus replenish her inventory

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: Mr. Kang R. is an older man. He is married with six kids. His wife appears in the photo here. Half of his children are employed in various jobs, while the remaining three are going to school. His wife is the financial earner. She has the skill of raising pigs in a pigpen next to their house. Kang R. has been earning a living by working as a wooden house builder. Besides this work, he also uses some tools to fish in and around the river. The family has faced the fact that their older house has broken down, and it is affecting their living situation. Kang R. hopes to build a new house to live in, but he doesn't have enough money to start this process. Therefore, in order to build a new house, Kang R. decided to look to Kiva for a loan to add to his savings.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: God Give Group

texts.en:
Rose G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Give. She is 44 years old, married and has six children who range in age from 17 to 27. Her children attend school. She also cares for three siblings.

She was only able to attend school through the twelfth grade due to lack of financial support. 

For three years, Rose has been selling crushed rocks in the ELWA Rock Hill Community outside Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 42,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more rocks to be crushed. 

She describes herself as a strong and determined woman. Her goal is to improve her business and become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy more rocks to be crushed

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza C. is from the village of Gingoog City. She is 23 years old. Analiza is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Analiza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Analiza is just starting this sari-sari store business, aside from having a motorcycle used to transport passengers from their village .

In 2009, Analiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Analiza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Thiem

texts.en:
Mrs. N. is a 41-year-old married woman. She is a villager who lives in a medium-sized home with family members in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She and her husband use this land to grow different kinds of crops, including potatoes, morning glories and rice.
Mrs. N. grows crops every year and has had great success. However, she doesn’t have capital to use on her field during this coming rainy season. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to begin growing. With any remaining money from the loan, Mrs. N. will buy three piglets to raise for extra income.
Note: Mrs. N.'s husband is shown in the photo above.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma Chávez L.  es una señora  de 45 años de edad, quien vive con su  esposo y sus 3 hijas en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada San Gabriel, localizada en Yolillal, Upala en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural  con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi montañosa.. Sus actividades principales son  la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería
Doña Irma y su familia se  ha dedicado a la producción de leche  durante mucho tiempo, por lo que ha podido experimentar todos los cuidados que demanda, además de la instrucción recibida por parte de sus familiares  a lo largo del tiempo. 
Ella Necesita un préstamo  ¢250,000 (doscientos cincuenta mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera asi seguir con el negocio de la leche, la cual ya le ha generado bastantes ingresos
Doña Irma forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Gabriel, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  sétimo crédito y dice que con el espera poder seguir creciendo como microempresaria y sacar su negocio adelante.
texts.en:
Irma Chávez L. is 45 years old, and lives with her husband and 3 daughters in a rural coastal town in Costa Rica called San Gabriel, located in Yolillal, Upala in the Alajuela province. She lives in a rather large rural community, with a semi mountainous topography. Her main work is in basic grain farming, and she is also is a small scale cattle farmer. Irma and her family have worked in milk production for a long time, throughout which she has been able to experience the great attention which it demands, in addition to receiving the instruction of her family members. Irma needs a loan of 250,000 CRC that she will use to purchase a milk cow to continue with her milk business, which has generated large profits. Irma is a member of the Communal Credit Company of San Gabriel, one of the 100 organizations partnered with EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her seventh loan, and she mentions that with it she hopes to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur and hopes to move her business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Purchase a Milk Cow.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu Z. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi, in the Kampala region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, one of whom is currently in school.  She has a business running a salon, which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Nulu has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more braids to use.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, she hopes to generate greater profits and pay for school fees and food.  In the future, Nulu hopes to expand her business further and eventually purchase a house.  She is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by showing her how to learn about customers and to be patient. 

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new type of loan to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance, and offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and to give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: to buy more braids

loans.name: Edy

texts.es: Edy tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de su suegra. Desde hace 10 años que se dedica a realizar telares artesanales en la casa de su madre donde tiene un taller. Desde entonces los tejidos que elabora, lo hace con la mayor delicadeza a fin de que su clientela se sienta satisfecha por el servicio que presta. Actualmente hace telares de pequeñas cintas que se utilizan como accesorios en los trajes típicos de su zona y de esta manera logra tener los ingresos económicos para su hogar, adicionalmente a esto también se dedica a la agricultura y  crianza de animales que es complementario a su trabajo y le ayudan para  tener siempre disponible los alimentos que necesita. Su gran deseo es mejorar sus ingresos y modernizar sus herramientas de trabajo. Este es su 14avo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de lana al por mayor de distintas calidades y colores.
texts.en:
Edy is 31 years old and lives with at her mother-in-law’s house with her husband and two children. For the past ten years, she has been producing hand-woven crafts from a workshop at her mother’s house. The items she produces are made with the utmost care and her customers are very satisfied with her work. At the moment she produces small hand-woven belts that used to accessorize the traditional clothing of the area. This helps her to generate income for her household. In addition, she engages in farming and raising animals to complement her craft work so that she can earn what she needs to feed her family. Her greatest wish is to improve her income and modernize the equipment for her work.

This is her 14th loan with MFP. Edy is very happy to know that she has a source of financial support. She has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. In addition, she is grateful for being part of her Communal Bank because all of the members have been responsible and supportive. Edy would also like to thank those responsible for approving this loan request because the funds will help advance her business. The loan she is requesting will be invested in a large amount of wool in varied qualities and colors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a large amount of wool in varied qualities and colors

loans.name: Heyler Geovanny

texts.es:
El joven Heyler Geovanny C. L. es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como contador en el área de Tesorería,  es soltero y no tiene hijos, solicito créditos para cubrir gastos personales.
El Joven Heyler C. L. lleva ya 6 créditos con ceprodel y siempre ha pagado en tiempo y forma.
texts.en:
Heyler Geovanny C. L. works for the City of Chinandega as an Accountant in the Treasury.  He is single and has no children.  He asked for funds to cover personal expenses.

He has had 6 loans with Ceprodel and has always repaid on time.

loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao S., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for fertile farmland for growing vegetables. S. is employed at a factory earning an income of USD 1.60 per day. Her husband sells phones earning an income of about USD 1.80 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family has to spend USD 30 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more phones to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: To buy more phone to sell

loans.name: Janet Akinyi

texts.en:
Janet Akinyi A. is 35 years old and is married to Raphael A. who is a businessman. They have four children in school, and they live in Eldoret-Kenya. She is a storekeeper and has been in this business for fifteen years, earning a monthly profit of 15,000 KES. Her husband’s business dealings are a source of additional income for the family.

Janet learnt about KADET LTD through a credit officer. She is now applying for her first loan of 50,000 KES from KADET, which she intends to use to open up two other stores in town. The anticipated profits gained will be used to expand the businesses.

In the future Janet wishes to have rental houses of her own and have a good life.

loans.use: To open another two stores in town

loans.name: Kalim

texts.en:
Kalim is 47 years old and married to Raphael, with whom she has three children. She has been in the food retail selling business for 11 years and is getting an income of 19000 KES a month. She sells items like sugar, flour, rice, sweets, and many other items. 

Kalim is taking her first loan with KADET to buy 3 bags of sugar and flour. She hopes to have more shops in the area which will be managed by her children in future.

loans.use: purchase more bags of sugar and flour to resell

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with five children, four of whom graduated while one still attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and rent bills.

For over thirteen years, she has operated her business of selling leso (Kikoi’s) and bed sheets from home to her neighbors and passersby.  Halima faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors who buy clothes in credit. She hopes to establish a cloth selling shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a bale of Leso’s (Kiko’s) and bed sheets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of Leso’s (Kiko’s) and bed sheets for resale.

loans.name: Mairamkul's Group

texts.en:
Mairamkul U. is married. She is 38 years old and has two small sons, both of them of preschool age. Her husband supports the family financially by working as a loader. Mairamkul raises money by selling convenience goods, mainly those for cooking national dishes. During the last four years of regular income, the family has managed to obtain necessary household appliances. 

In order to put their young sons on their feet, this couple wants to increase their family income, so they are planning to increase their goods circulation. Getting a loan may help to realize this plan. In the future Mairamkul wants to develop her business and to obtain a car.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase convenience goods for resale

loans.name: Kadenge Koin

texts.en:
Kadenge Koin, age 22 years, trades livestock at Bissil market in Kajiado.  He is married to Lemomo who is a housewife and they have no children. Kadenge was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Kitengela office.

He has been in the livestock trading  business for a period of one year and his monthly profit is 2,000 KES.  This loan of 15,000 KES is his first loan from KADET and he intends to use it to purchase cows and goats for trade.  If the loan boosts the business, Kadenge will start a butchery business.

Kadenge’s dream is to  own a pickup and start transporting animals to the Kenya meat commission.  He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase cows and goats for trade.

loans.name: Crisóstomo

texts.es:
El señor Crisóstomo D. L. C.  tiene un negocio D. venta D. abarrotes y papelería, el cual es L. fuente D. ingresos D. su familia.
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mercancía D. abarrotes y ampliar el local para L. mercancía D. L. papelería, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para L. inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio.
Es por eso que solicita su cooperación para este préstamo y poder invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Crisóstomo D. L. C. has a grocery and stationery shop which is his family’s source of income.

The business is lacking groceries and it needs to be expanded to accommodate stationery items but he currently lacks funds to invest and he doesn’t want to decapitalize the business.  This is why he’s asking for cooperation in the loan to be able to invest in the business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and expand the business.

loans.name: Jessica Del Socorro

texts.es: Jessica del Socorro ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de cosméticos y un  mini cyber ubicado en su casa de habitación. Anteriormente ya había solicitado créditos con el fin de invertir en su negocio, siempre está pensando en mejorar la condición de su actividad, ya que es por medio de su negocio que mantiene a su familia. Ella ha buscado la forma de mejorar cada día para proporciónale a su familia lo necesario con estos dos negocios. Este crédito es para la compra de cosméticos, papeles y artículos necesarios para su negocio.
texts.en: Jessica del Socorro works in cosmetics, and has a small cyber cafe located in her home. She has previously requested loans to invest in her business, she is always concerned with improving her business, as she maintains her family through this business. She looks for ways to improve every day, so she can provide her family with what they need through these 2 businesses. This loan will be used to purchase cosmetics, papers, and other items necessary for her business.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN sont des femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne 26 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à TIOLA un des villages  de la sous préfecture de NIENA région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
NIADIOUGOU D., qui est un des membres du groupe, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10kg de poissons. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de NIENA. Les poissons sont revendus en famille à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes au comptant et en détail. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Fotemogoban group are married and on average 26 years old with four children. They live primarily in polygamous families in Tiola, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Niena, Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

In order to meet the demands of their customers, they are working for the first time with the microfinace institution Soro Yiriwaso.

Niadiougou D., one of the group's members, plans to buy ten kilos of fish with her loan. She gets her fish at the big market in Niena. The fish are then sold retail for cash to family members, primarily women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA, which will be used for daily family expenses. She would like to increase her sales to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: Purchase of fish

loans.name: Kiseera Kyonka-Jinja Group

texts.en: 22 year old W. Eriah's source of livelihood for the past seven years has been poultry sales. The happily married mother of two has been operating her business in Gabula-Jinja. She says that she uses profits from her rental business which she still operates to get established. Hard work has been her motto. Monthly this business generates her shillings 200,000 and she says with this loan, she is going to carry out refurbishments on her rental structures. She belongs to Kiseera Kyonka group-Jinja

loans.use: The refurbishments costs on her rental structures

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, provincia D. Cusco, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maritza; La socia tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos, (33,30,14); la socia es jubilada y se dedica a elaborar chompas ella teje lindas chompas D. lana para mujeres, varones y niños; la socia  también venD. ropas, para niños y adultos; la socia desea en esta oportunidad el crédito para poder comprar ropa y también invertir una parte D. dinero en la compra D. madejas D. lanas, hilos, agujas y botones. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocioy desea comprar lana.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Amauta" located in the district and province of Urubamba, department of Cusco. 

The member is Maritza, 50 years of age, married with three children (33, 30 and 14). She is retired and dedicates her time to making sweaters. She knits beautiful wool sweaters for women, men and children and also sells clothing for adults and children. The member wishes to take advantage of the loan being offered to buy clothing and also invest part of the money in the purchase of skeins of wool yarn, thread, needles and buttons. The member seeks the loan to invest in her business. 

The member is happy with the loan that has been granted and promises to make her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma, a 41-year-old married woman with five children, works hard to support her family. Alma earns a living through food vending and the sale of her fisherman husband's catch in the local community. She also makes rice cakes and other delicacies that she sells around the neighborhood. Alma is asking for a loan to purchase a boat engine for her husband, which will help her business to continue.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine

loans.name: Samier

texts.ar: سمير متزوج عمره 44 سنة وله ولدان يعمل في بناء وتركيب الجفصين والأسقف المستعارة له في عمله 13 سنة يحب عمله ويبدع فيه كثيرا فهو عمل ابتكاري ويتميز بالجمال والدقة في العمل له زبائن كثر من محيطه والضيع المجاورة والمهندسين يوجد لديه بعض المصاعب المادية التي تعيق تطور عمله حيث انه مجتهد ومكب على العمل بشكل كبير يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للعمل جفصين واسقف مستعارة حتى يزيد من الطلب على عمله ويحسن من مدخوله الشهري وتعليم ومساعدة الأهل في نفس الوقت فهو محب لعائلته واقاربه ويريد مساعدة من حوله ووضعهم في ظرف مادي واجتماعي جيد
texts.en: Samier is 44 years old and married with two children. He works installing hanging ceilings, and he has 13 years of experience in this line of work. He likes his work. He is innovative and inventive in his work, and he stands out in his field due to his attention to detail and due to the beauty of his business's craftsmanship. He has many customers from his own community, from surrounding towns and from architects. He is currently facing some material difficulties which are hindering him from developing his business, even though he puts a lot of effort into his work and he is diligent in his work. With a loan from al-Majmoua, Samier would like to buy supplies for his ceiling and ceiling lighting business so that he can increase his clientele and, in turn, his monthly income. With his increased income, he would like to contribute towards his family's education and their general well-being. He loves his family and his relatives very much, and he would like to help those around him to them all in good financial and social circumstances.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his business of installing hanging ceilings.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Oropesa,  provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Santusa, es conviviente; la socia tiene 29 años de edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos de 11, 9, 6 años de edad, la socia alquila un horno, la socia elabora  panes y para ello ella compra harina, manteca, azúcar, la socia vende todos los días en el paradero de Oropesa los panes, ella los pone dentro de una canasta grande y embolsados y los ofrece a todos los buses y carros en general que pasan por la carretera principal destino las ciudades de Arequipa y Puno.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de panes.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Santusa belongs to “Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” communal bank.  It is located in Oropesa village, in the Quispicanchis province of the Cusco department.  Santusa has a live in partner.  She is 29 years old and has three children that are 11, 9 and 6 years old.  

Santusa rents an oven and makes different kinds of bread, for which she buys flour, butter and sugar. She sells her bread at Oropesa’s bus stop every day.  She puts the bread in a big basket and in packages, then offers it to all buses, cars and, in general, to all who pass through the main bus stop headed to Arequipa and Puno.

Santusa asks for this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of ingredients that she uses to make bread.  She is very thankful for the loan and is committed to completing the loan payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina nació en la ciudad de Taray (Cusco, Perú), tiene 42 años edad y vive en la ciudad Taray junto con sus cuatro hijos y su pareja. (Taray se encuentra a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco y se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes y por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola).

Sabina nos cuenta que en el mes de febrero del año 2010 su ciudad sufrió un desastre natural pues el rio se desbordo y ella y sus vecinos perdieron sus negocios y de algunos sus casas se cayeron. Pero los pobladores son personas emprendedores y trabajadores y a pesar de las adversidades supieron salir adelante. 
 
Desde hace varios años Sabina tiene varios negocios como por ejemplo venta de chicha de Jora y a la venta de comida, ella tiene un restaurante o picantería implementada con las necesidades básicas como sillas, mesas, cocina y otras cositas mas. Ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar la comida pues la comida tiene que estar listo para el medio día. Ella siempre compra insumos para preparar la comida como por ejemplo carne y verduras pues estos son fáciles de malograse.  En esta oportunidad Sabina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos que se pueden guardar y que nos se malogren como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más.  

Sabina pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de la Agonía de Taray” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el cuarto año de funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Sabina was born in the city of Taray (Cusco, Perú).  She is 42 years old and lives in Taray with her four children and spouse.  (Taray is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco and is noted for its beautiful scenery and for being a tourist, livestock raising and farming area.)

Sabina tells us that in February, 2010 her town suffered a natural disaster: the river overflowed its banks and she and her neighbors lost their businesses and some of the houses fell apart.  But the residents are enterprising, hard working people who despite adversities knew how to get ahead.

For several years now Sabina has had several businesses.  For example: the sale of chicha de jora (corn based beverage) and food sales.  She has a restaurant or snack shop equipped with all basic needs like chairs, tables, stove and a few other things.  She rises very early to prepare the food because it has to be ready by noon.  She always buys ingredients to prepare the food, like meat and vegetables, because they are easily spoiled.  On this occasion, Sabina needs the loan to buy ingredients that can be stored and will not spoil like rice, sugar, noodles and others, for example.

Sabina is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s  “Señor de la Agonía de Taray” communal bank.  It’s in its fourth year and is doing very well.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, noodles and others.

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: Martha Del Socorro tiene la actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella tiene 54 años de edad. Ella tiene 3 hijos y trabajan de manera independiente. Su negocio se dio por los deseos de salir adelante con su medio de vida. Ya que tuvo bastante influencia de clientes, y le genero ciertas ganancias y decide invertir un poco más en este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos como calzado, cosméticos, ropa en general y bolsos Su mayor sueño es ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y proporcionarles mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Martha Del Socorro operates a business selling all kinds of products.  She's operated the business for 11 years.  She is 54 years old and has 3 children.  She works alone.  She started the business because she needed a means to support herself.  She's built a good customer base now, one that generates a steady income, so she's decided to invest a bit in growing the business.  She's applying for a loan so that she can products--footwear, cosmetics, clothing, etc.--that she will resell.  Her goals are to provide a better service for her customers and make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Anarose

texts.en:
Anarose is a farmer working in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice, but also raises pigs to sell at the market. She works hard to support her family.

Anorose's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and livestock feeds. She hopes to earn better income and have her own savings.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and livestock feeds

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 30 years old married to Daniel, who is a farmer. The couple is blessed with three children whom Jennifer he supports. For the past four years, she has been buying and selling milk at the Mutwot trading center. Jennifer earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES.

Jenifer is requesting a 40,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to buy and pay milk suppliers. This will be her third loan. She has successfully repaid her previous loans. 

Jenifer plans to use her anticipated profit to build and start a retail shop. In the future, she hopes that her family will be financially stable and also that she will prosper in her business.

loans.use: to pay milk suppliers and trade milk

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Yean, 47, is a tailor, and can make $2 per day. Her husband stays at home. They have three children, one is studying and two are working in the garment factory. 

Every month, Yean has to spend $20 on food, $10 on school fees, and $14 on other expenses. She would like a loan of $1200 to buy land for her husband to farm. She will keep going on her career and extend it more if it does well.

She plans to send her children to study at least through high school.

loans.use: To buy farmland for her husband to work

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah, 35, has run a boutique for ten years in Naivasha. She is a widow and the mother of two school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET customer and this is her second loan. She intends to use this loan to add childrens wear, skirts and blouses to her stock.

Hannah’s future dream is to enlarge her boutique to increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Agusto

texts.es: El señor Oscar, es habitante del municipio de la concepción, junto a su esposa la cual actualmente labora en una casa privada para poyar con los gastos del hogar,  los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda ya que el zinc esta deteriorado por las cenizas del volcán, don Oscar desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de café, la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden la plantación ya que carecen de fertilizantes e insumos. Agradece Afodenic  que atrávez de fondo Kiva se lo otorga un financiamiento para inducir en tiempo y forma el cultivo ya que si esto no fuese posible la producción se perdería.
texts.en: Sr. Oscar lives with his wife in the town of Concepcion.  His wife works as a cleaner and they share household costs.
