Don Oscar wants to repair the house where they live because the roof of the house has been damaged by volcano ash.  Don Oscar has made a living from coffee farming for several years.  He has to contend with the plant diseases that destroy his crop because he doesn't have the fertilizers and other supplies that he needs for a healthy crop.  He is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for delivering the funding he needs quickly because without the extra funds he would lose his crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for house expansion.

loans.name: Zebogul

texts.ru: Зебогул проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст, 56 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Зебогул имеет высшее образование. Она по профессии финансист. В этой области проработала 25 лет. Сейчас она занимается животноводством. В основном она занимается купле - продажей крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Zebogul lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 56 years old, married and has three children.  Zebogul has a higher education.  Her profession is a financier, and she spent 25 years working in this field.  Currently, she is involved in animal husbandry.  She primarily buys and sells cattle.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia tiene 56 años, vive con su esposo en la casa que ambos adquirieron. Tiene su granja de cuyes desde hace 1 año, anteriormente solo se dedicaba a la agricultura pero por recomendación de sus vecinos empezó a criar cuyes de manera tecnificada, ya que por medio de capacitaciones que recibió ha logrado ejercere esta actividad. Hoy tieen grna nuemero de cuyes, cerca de 200 que son comercializados de manera semanal y quincenal, de acuerdo la cantidad que requiere el cliente. Considera que su  actividad es un éxito, por tantop desea implementarse de más herramientas y amplair la graja de cuyes. Es la primera vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP, un día su vecina le extendió la invitación de integrar el grupo solitario de la que hoy es una de sus socias y esta segura de afrontar puntualmente cada cuota de crédito. Con el dinero comprará cebada al por mayor y mejorar la alimentación de sus cuyes.
texts.en:
Amelia, age 56, lives with her husband in the house that they both acquired.  She has had a guinea pig farm for one year.  Previously she only devoted herself to farming.  However, upon the recommendation of her neighbors, she started to raise guinea pigs using modern farming techniques.  Through the training she received she managed to engage in this business activity.

She now has a great number of guinea pigs, close to 200.  They are sold weekly and biweekly according to the quantity that the customer needs.  She considers her business activity to be a success.  Therefore, she wishes to have more tools in place and expand her guinea pig farm.

This is the first time that she has requested a loan with MFP.  One day her neighbor invited her to become part of her communal bank, and she is now a member of that group.

She is sure that she will punctually make each loan payment.  She will use the money to buy barley wholesale and improve her guinea pigs’ feed.

loans.use: to buy barley and fodder for her guinea pigs.

loans.name: Isolde

texts.en:
Isolde is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 
Isolde has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock for her shop.
Isolde is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Julia Teresa es casada, tiene 36 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales no están estudiando, se dedica a la sastrería a la confecciona de camisas de todos los tamaños, inicio este trabajo gracias apoyo de sus amistades, lleva hasta el momento 15 años de experiencia trabajando como operaria.

Solicita un préstamo para ampliar su capital de producción específicamente para la compra de materiales para confecciona, telas e hilos, espera e el futuro tener su propios negocio.
texts.en:
Julia Teresa is 36 years old, married, and finished her four years of primary education.  She has two children who are not in school.  Julia Teresa works as a tailor, making shirts in all sizes.  She started out in this line of work thanks to the support of her friends.  She now has 15 years experience working as a sewing machine operative.

Julia Teresa is requesting a loan to increase her capital, specifically buying dressmaking materials, fabric and threads.  She hopes, in the future, to own her own business.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking materials

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Rosalbina; ella tiene 58 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia sigue en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende arroz,azucar,leche y fideos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,ella por medio de este engocio sigue sacando adelante a su familia,al socia quiere ampliar y seguir mejorando el negocio de tienda de abarrotes .La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,leche,fideos y galletas.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosalbina is 58 years old and married with two children. She has a grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, milk, and noodles. She works there from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. This business is helping her give her family a better life. She would like to expand and improve the business, and is requesting a loan to buy products for her shop like rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and cookies.

Rosalbina is very happy about this loan and promises to pay it off in full.

loans.use: to buy products for her shop like rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and cookies.

loans.name: Marto

texts.en: Marto is 23 years old and lives in Barnersville. She is single, and she is a high school graduate. For the past three years she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, salt and onions for her business. She likes the way people respond to her business. Her plans are to build a house and attend college in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, salt and onions for her business.

loans.name: Maria Tomasa

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y dos hijos ella se dedica a vender frutas y verduras en el mercado, todos los días miércoles y domingos son los dos días de comercio.
Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como: tomate, chile, zanahoria, repollo, el cual le permitirá tener más variedad y ofrecerles a sus clientes y obtener mejores ingresos. 
El objetivo de María es mejorar sus ingresos  y optar por un mejor estilo de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and two children. She devotes herself to selling fruits and vegetables in the market. She sells every Wednesday and Sunday which are the two market days. 

She needs the loan to purchase more merchandise, such as tomatoes, chile peppers, carrots, and cabbage. This will allow her to offer more variety to her customers and make better earnings. 

María's objective is to improve her income and choose a better lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, chile peppers, carrots and cabbage.

loans.name: Samey

texts.en: Samey, 31, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Samey and her husband sell food. This couple works so hard every day to earn income to help cover the family expenses. Samey is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase shoes to resell which will allow her family to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy shoes to resell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Lilia is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Lilia is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home used products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo,soaps and many. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Lilia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. In 2007, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to to save as a reserve for future emergencies				.

loans.use: to purchase additional product to sell

loans.name: Susana Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Susana y su esposo Jaime  tienen una forrajera la cual atienden juntos y esta les brinda una estabilidad económica  la cual les permite vivir cómodamente a ellos y a sus hijos, con el préstamo que se les otorgo ellos quieren satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y  así poder hacer crecer mas su negocio y esto lo lograra comprando costales de alimento, pacas de alfalfa, medicamentos para caballos, vacas, borregos y pollos,  agradece  el apoyo  brindado para la realización de  su proyecto.
texts.en: Susana and her husband Jamie have a farm that they run together and it provides them financial stability so that they and their children can live comfortably.  They want to use the money from this loan to satisfy their customer demands and be able to grow the business.  They will buy sacks of feed, packs of alfalfa, and medications for horses, cows, sheep, and chickens.  They appreciate the support they get to complete their project.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and medicine.

loans.name: 06.05.08-Đông Vệ Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Lý is applying for a loan to purchase materials to maintain her refreshment bar. (small bar with coffee, tea, soft drinks, fast food) She operates a food stall/restaurant, selling beverages. She has been involved in this business for five years.

She is 47 years old and and is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Lý is the group leader of the 06.05.08-Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2011, Lý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Lý faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Lý hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to maintain the refreshment bar. (small bar with coffee, tea, soft drinks, fast food…)

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 46 years old, married with three children aged 18, 20 and 24.  She runs a greengrocery to earn a living.  She has been in this business for three years and has employed one person. In her business, she mainly sells vegetables; potatoes, tomatoes and onions. She says her business environment is competitive.

Since Christina joined Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save her money. This has helped her to manage her finances. Her desire is to be selling vegetables in five years' time. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes and onions

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Noralyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Noralyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Noralyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo lives in Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro; with 3 children and his wife, Alrnulfo works hard every day to cover his family expenses. He is a very lovely father and says that when he sees his children playing is one of the most beautiful satisfactions in his life. Since he was a kid, he worked as assistant of a carpentry, later he worked in a company, but his salary did not revenue to cover the education of his children, for that reason, Arnulfo decided to start his own business. With 6 years of experience, he has demonstrated to have capacity to manage his business and make it grow up.

He needs a loan of $475 USD to give credit to his clients without troubles of work capital and produce on his maximum capacity. Arnulfo and his family need your help to his business grows and they thank your love for them.

** \\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

Arnulfo vive en Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro; con 3 hijos de familia además de su esposa, Alrnulfo trabaja todos los días para cubrir los gastos familiares. El es una persona muy entregada a la familia, dice que el ver jugar a sus niños, es una de las satisfacciones más bonitas en su vida. Desde niño era ayudante de una carpintería, después trabajo en una empresa, pero su sueldo no alcanzaba a cubrir la educación de sus hijos, por lo que Arnulfo decidió emprender su propio negocio. Con 6 años de experiencia, ha demostrado tener capacidad para manejar su negocio y crecer.

El necesita un préstamo de $475 USD para poderle brindar crédito a sus clientes sin la necesidad de descapitalizarse y seguir produciendo a su máxima capacidad. Arnulfo y su familia necesitan de tu ayuda para que su negocio crezca y agradecen tu cariño.

loans.use: Give credit to his clients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret would like to purchase high-quality seedlings and organic manure.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is married: he and his wife have three children aged 18, 29 and 30. He has always been a salesman: previously he distributed motorcycle spare parts but then it became difficult to import these products and he decided to start sewing uniforms and embroidery ten years ago. He started with just one sewing machine and later he acquired another. He has seen his business grow little by little with the help of his wife: together they have worked tirelessly to ensure their children’s advancement.

In order to be able to speed up production and offer a better service to his customers, Daniel is asking for a loan of $1200 dollars which he will use to buy a specialised machine for embroidery: this will be of great help in expanding his business. He intends to repay this money within 6-12 months. You can play a crucial role in the growth of this business: Daniel and his family thank you sincerely for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Daniel es casado, tienen tres hijos de 18, 29 y 30 años de edad. Él siempre ha sido comerciante, antes distribuía refacciones de motocicletas pero después se le dificultó importar estos productos y decidió iniciar con la confección de uniformes y bordados desde hace 10 años. Comenzó con una sola máquina de costura y después adquirió otra, ha visto crecer su negocio poco a poco con la ayuda de su esposa, juntos han trabajado arduamente para sacar adelante a sus tres hijos.

Para poder agilizar la producción y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, Daniel solicita un préstamo por $ 1,200 dólares el que comprará un máquina especializada en bordados, que será de gran utilidad para el crecimiento de este negocio, él esta dispuesto a devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser pieza fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, Daniel y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase sewing machine

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina supports herself and her son with a small business selling women’s shoes in Melitopol, Ukraine. In business for twelve years, she has built a successful and profitable enterprise. During a typical month she makes around $1600 in profits and has built up about $8000 worth of inventory for her business. Marina has been a good client with Nadiya Ukraine, paying all loans back with no problems. She appreciates the support that she has received by having financial services available. Marina has requested a loan for $1000 to help her purchase additional shoe inventory. She looks forward to continuing to develop her business in the future.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia U. is a married mother of four children.  She is 29 years old. She hails from Benin City, Edo State in Nigeria.  Everyone in the community needs kerosene.  Felicia hopes to receive a loan of $400 so that she can buy more kerosene to sell.  This will improve her turnover and profit.

loans.use: to buy kerosene to sell

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula, 39, is a very wise, practical and positive woman. She is known in her village for her sympathy and her smile that shines light on everyone who approaches her. She lives with her husband (currently unemployed) and her well-loved 10 year-old daughter.

Paula has always had a truly responsible attitude with regard to her family. Immediately after her husband lost his job, she got her act together and tried to find a way to financially support the family. First, she started a small cafeteria which she operates early in the morning, and at night. She serves bananas with boiled or fried eggs, boiled manioc, mangú (a purée of boiled plantains) which is a much appreciated dish by people. She also prepares natural fruit juices and at night, she sells empanadas and some typical Dominican hamburgers.

Recently, eager to increase her income, Paula received from our organization a loan which she repaid in the due time. She invested the loan in the purchase of bulk clothing which she sold in her community. She could make a profit from that activity. Now, this entrepreneur has requested a loan to buy a larger amount of clothes so that she can considerably increase her sales volume. Profits made from her business will help her handily repay the loan and keep doing her exceptional best for the sake of her family.

loans.use: To buy a larger amount of clothing in bulk to increase her sales volume and make more profit from her business.

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Red and yellow and pink and green… Mama H. makes and sells a rainbow of batik cloths. She established her business in 2004 and has received one loan from SELFINA which has been repaid in full. She now requires a loan of $525 to expand her business by buying new dyes and cloth. Her business, along with her husband Kayumba’s salary, supports their two children as well as five other dependents. With your assistance Mama H. will continue making rainbows-- purple and orange and blue…

About the microloan partner:

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Zubeda would like to purchase additional cloth and dyes for her batik business.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam!  This is 29 year-old Mwajuma R..  She is married with two children.  In 2005, Mwajuma established a hairdressing and clothing business.  Mwajuma has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $850 in order to purchase additional stock and equipment.  She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing.  Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women.  Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her hairdressing and clothing businesses.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! Tatu M. is 45 years old and she is married with five children. In 2005 Tatu established a general store and now seeks a loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA:
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing whereby SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA will purchase equipment from said client, extend a loan to her, and then lease the same equipment back to her – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, financial institutions do not consider Tanzanian women to be credit-worthy because they lack tangible assets that could serve as collateral. As a result, Tanzanian women with low income receive poor financial support and meager access to basic needs and services. SELFINA thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Gulzar's Group

texts.en:
My name is Gulzar B.. I am a widow and the group leader from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. My sons manufacture cardboard boxes. They need a loan to buy a few items for their business. They are the breadwinners and work very hard to earn income for the family.

Another in my loan group, Asma B., needs a loan to buy a movie camera for her husband so he can be hired to shoot movies at various occasions. The third woman in the group, Guddo B., will use her share of the loan to purchase raw materials required to make shoes. This is a group loan and we are mutually responsible for its' repayment.

loans.use: Purchase cardboard and raw materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is the mother of seven children and she has 15 grandchildren.  She is currently taking care of three of her grandchildren while their parents work.  Mary travels to the village of Tanoso to purchase earthenware bowls  that are used as a traditional blender for vegetables.   The blending is accomplished by using one's hands to rub the vegetables against the ridges of the bowl.

Mary has been selling the bowls for over five years, but since she has started taking loans she has been able to expand her inventory and, consequently, her sales.    The loan will help reduce travel expenses and allow her to purchase more bowls for her inventory. 

Mary is a member of the trust group Yesu Mo (Thank God).  The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.  
.

loans.use: To purchase additional earthenware bowls

loans.name: Eang

texts.en: Eang L. sells fish in Kampong Cham province. She is 39 years old and has been developing her business since 1996. Depending on business, she can make up to 5 US$ per day. Klei Chan, her husband, is 40 years old and working as a construction worker. He earns 4 US$ per day. They have five children still living in the famiL. home and one child who is married. Construction becomes a more and more difficult job as Klei Chan grows older and the famiL. wants to branch into a business the kids can help sustain in the parent's old age. They want to rent farmland to grow yams on and eventualL. hope to afford their own field. Klei Chan is pictured here as his wife was unavailable to photographed when CREDIT loan officers came to visit.

loans.use: To rent farmland.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Mr. Fermin Benitez is 36 years old and is married to Mrs. Rumelia Suarez who is 29 years old, they live in the area of Tacuruty in the city of San Estanislao, they have a son who is of school age. They have a grocery store in their own home, with well formed clientele and a good income, by means of the good prices and good attention to the clients. Their project for the future is to finance a mini market now that their clientele is large.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Fermìn Benitez tiene 36 años de edad esta casado con la señora Rumelia Suarez de 29 años de edad, viven en la compañía de Tacuruty de la ciudad de San Estanislao, tienen un hijo que esta en la edad escolar. Tiene una despensa en su domicilio particular, con clientela ya formada y un buen ingreso, mediante los buenos precios, a la buena atenciòn a los clientes. Su proyecto para el futuro es habilitar un mini mercado ya que cuenta con un local muy amplio, para realizar dicho proyecto .

loans.use: to purchase bread products, dairy products, flour, cleaning products, sweets, etc.

loans.name: José Pelayo

texts.es:
Jose comes from a humble family but with a great desire to look for a better life. Because of lack of money he could not study a professional career but did not lose the hope that one day he will realize this dream. Because of this, Jose decided to work full time as a security guard for a company. In addition to his noble and risky profession, Jose and his loving mother have a small grocery store and thanks to this store they are improving their economic condition. Because of the great quantity of requests and suggestion they receive from their clients they are in need of additional capital to invest in increasing their merchandise so they can offer a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

José proviene de una familia humilde, pero con inmensas ganas de buscar una mejor condición de vida. Por la falta de dinero no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero no pierde las esperanzas de que algún día pueda alcanzar este sueño. Para ello, José decidió trabajar a tiempo completo como personal de seguridad en una importante empresa de su localidad. Adicionalmente a su noble y arriesgado oficio, José y su querida madre poseen una bodeguita de abarrotes y gracias a ello están mejorando su condición económica. Pero por la gran cantidad de solicitudes y sugerencias que reciben de sus clientes se ven en la necesidad de contar con mayor capital de inversión para incrementar su mercadería y ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for store.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Clothing sales has turned into an important source of income for Susana, and diligent and hardworking young woman who has been engaged in this business for 5 years. She began working with the unconditional support of her father, who encouraged her and gave economic support to begin and grow her business. She sells door to door on one of the busiest streets in the city of Juliaca. In the beginning, it did not appear that her business would make money, and many times she felt ready to quit, but her perseverance and will to succeed pulled her through, and today she does not regret it. Her business has grown considerably, and seeing the many orders for dresses that she offers, she has recognized the need to increase her merchandise, which is the reasy that she is seeking your help.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de ropa se convirtió en el ingreso económico más importante de Susana, joven diligente y laboriosa que desde hace más de 5 años viene dedicándose a este negocio.Emprendió esta actividad con el apoyo incondicional de su padre, quien la animó y colaboró económicamente para el inicio y fortalecimiento de su negocio. Ella vende en forma ambulatoria en una de las calles más comerciales de la ciudad de Juliaca, al principio parecía no resultarle rentable y muchas veces estuvo a punto de renunciar, pero su constancia y voluntad de superación la hicieron resistir, y hoy no se arrepiente de eso.Su negocio va creciendo considerablemente, y viendo las innumerables solicitudes de las prendas de vestir que ofrece, se ve en la necesidad de aumentar su mercadería, con ese propósito solicita vuestro apoyo.

loans.use: Increase in merchandise for her clothing business in order to fill client orders.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel O. is thirty three years old. He is married with two kids who are currently in school. Emmanuel is a dealer in electrical and electronic parts like televisions, sound systems, speakers, electric fans, etc. He also provides repairs and service for his customers. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He requests a loan to enable him to procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes the loan will enable him to increase savings to expand his shop to include refrigerators and parts. He belongs to the community group called Alive Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Emmanuel would like to increase his stock of electrical and electronic gadgets and parts for his electronics repair shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy grass, sugar, cookies, milk, egg, meat, wine, coffee, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Hou

texts.en:
Hou P. is 51 years old and lives in the Siem Reap Province with his wife and their daughter. Both he and his wife, who is 49 years old, are farmers and have farmed since 1979. Each of them earn about a $1.25 per day. Their daughter, who is 18, is a grocer making about $10 per day. She contributes her income to the entire household's income.

Hou P. is requesting a loan of $600 to renovate his daughter’s grocery store in order to have more space to stock more items. In the future, he would like to expand their grocery stand further.

Hou P. is requesting a loan through Kiva’s field partner CREDIT – Micro Finance Institution. CREDIT-MFI has a repayment rate of 99.8% with a portfolio at risk 30+ at 0.33% (taken from their 2007 Annual report). CREDIT – MFI structures their non-agriculture Kiva loans with a declining balance interest rate. Agriculture loans are structured as balloon repayments with monthly interest rate payments and principle repayments at the end of the loan. To learn more about CREDIT-MFI please visit their Kiva Field Partner page or their website at

http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=9

http://www.credit.com.kh/

loans.use: To renovate his daughter’s grocery store

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Tran Thi T. is 35 years old.  She has been in TYM since 1998.  For the first loan, she borrowed and invested in raising pigs.  Now she owns a grocery shop, and this is her family’s main business.  With an income of about 3 million VND ($175 US) per month, her family’s life is getting more and more stable.  For the next loan, she wants to borrow 10 million VND ($600 US) to invest in her grocery shop.

loans.use: To invest in her grocery shop.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra is raising a 10-year-old daughter all by herself, and she is very active and full of energy.  She is an entrepreneur from Mukachevo, selling women’s lingerie in a local store called “Alisa.”  Alexandra started her business four years ago, and has had about 24,000 Grivnas in capital turnover.  This type of merchandise is in constant demand.  

She is seeking to expand her business even further in order to generate additional income from increased sales.  This time Alexandra is asking for a 2,500 Grivnas loan to increase her stock.  We believe her diligent work, determination and positive attitude will help her achieve her business goals and be successful in all her endeavors.  
This is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Banaletta

texts.en:
N. Banaletta runs a restaurant in the Lyatonde trading center. Her main menu includes local dishes and delicacies like luwombo, nakkati, matooke, yams and cassava.

To serve her increasing customer base, N. is requesting a loan to purchase more foodstuffs like rice, flour, cooking oil, and cereals. Her ambition is to have a modern fast foods restaurant. She is the loving mother of seven children, three of whom are still in school. The income from her business enables her to sustain her family.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs like rice, flour, cooking oil, and cereals.

loans.name: Veronica De La Concepcion

texts.es: Verónica de la Concepción S. M. tiene la edad de 32 años, es soltera, y tiene tres hijos. La actividad económica de Doña Verónica es costura, y ella inició este negocio con gran sacrificio porque ella tuvo que trabajar por mucho tiempo y salvar muchas de las ganancias para comprar una maquina eléctrica lo que le permitía terminar de manera más rápida. Los propósitos de Doña Verónica con este préstamo son de mantener la actividad económica y guardar más ganancias para contratar más empleados. Sus sueños son de obtener un taller amplio en el que pueda proporcionar trabajos a su misma familia.  También a ella le quiere dar la oportunidad a personas que realmente quieren trabajar para sacar a sus familias adelante. En este sentido, a Doña Verónica le gustaría darle mejoras a su vivienda para tener un lugar seguro donde estar con su familia y de esta manera proporcionarle una buena vivienda en donde puedan vivir sus hijas en tiempos futuros.
texts.en:
Verónica de la Concepción S. M. is 32 years old, single, and has 3 children. Doña Verónica owns a business working as a seamstress. She made a great sacrifice because she had to work a lot at the beginning to save money to buy an electric sewing machine that allowed her to complete her work faster. The purpose of this loan is to maintain this work and to save more money in order to hire more employees. She dreams of owning a large factory in which she could offer jobs to her own family. Also, she wants to provide the opportunity to people who wish to work in order to better provide for their families future. In this sense, Doña Verónica would like to make improvements to her home so she can have a safer place for her and her family. This way, she will provide a good household where her children can live in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is already 48 years old, married to Marcelino C. who is a tricycle (local three-wheeled vehicle) operator in Cauayan City. They have eight children: Marlon - 26 years old, elementary graduate; followed by Medelino, 22 years old, high school graduate; next are the twins Michael and Armando who are already 20 years old, elementary graduates; followed by Mamer, 18 years old and a high school graduate; next to him is the only rose among the thorns - Marcybelle, 14 years old, 3rd year high school student; Marvin, 10 years old, grade four at the moment; and the youngest is Mel John, 5 years old. They live a simple life and strive to make plans possible for the future of their big family through the assistance of her husband.

For almost 10 years, Annabelle successfully maintained her business which is selling clothes for adults and children, slippers and doormats so as to be able to send her younger children to school. Anabelle struggles so much in making door mats to add to her current products to increase her income and to pursue her plan to request a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 that will be utilized in her business to further develop her selling of RTW’s (Filipino clothing).

Hard work and patience are the keys to achieving all her ambitions, both in her business and family welfare, said Annabelle.

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Enlarge the area to grow cabbage

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
S. Johnson has been trading in the local market of Moore, in the central region of Ghana, where she stays with her family.  She is 28 years old married with two children who attend school.  Her husband is a trader.  S. is a busy petty trader who sells tomatoes and other food stuff like beans, onions, pepper, carrots, green pepper and cassava, plantains on top of table in the community market.  She strives very hard to make ends meet for her family.  She treks to the northern part of Ghana to buy her food stuffs and has been in business for four years now.  

S. does not have sufficient working capital to run the business which slows her business progress.  With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to purchase increased stock to revive the business.  She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory.  

She would be grateful for assistance.  S. belongs to a village bank called ‘Akukudrofo’ which means ‘Brave people.’.

loans.use: Increased stock of supplies to sell.

loans.name: Qurbonbi

texts.ru: Шарипова Курбонби проживает в городе Куляб. Одна воспитывает четверых детей. Разведена. Занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке города. Привозит товар из города Душанбе. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 10 лет. Бизнес развивается неплохо , но для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот она планирует получить кредит. Таким образом она планирует увеличить ассортимент товара и привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
S. Qurbonbi lives in the city of Kulob. She raises four children on her own. She is divorced. Qurbonbi works in sales. She has a sales location at the city market. She brings her products from the city of Dushanbe. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her business is developing well, but in order to increase her turnover she plans to get credit. This way she plans to increase her product assortment and attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Alegres De Corazon Group

texts.es: La. Sra. Celia Mery Q. C. atiende en su pensión hace quince años, solicita el credito por la necesidad que tiene de hacer estudiar a su hija que esta en la universidad, como es viuda la señora no cuenta con ningún apoyo de sus familiares y necesita del programa para que su hija continue estudiando y termine la carrera que escogio.                                                                                                                                                                           La Sra. Rosmery C. G. tiene tres hijitos menores, le abandono su esposo en el tercer hijo y tiene la necesidad de un credito para continuar apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios escolares.   Su actividad es la de venta de papa en un mercado de la zona de El Tejar, ella compra al por mayor para luego vender al raleo (por menor).                                                                                                                La Sra. Delina S. B. tiene una tienda de comestibles quiere aumentar su capital de trabajo para apoyar a sus hijos que estan estudiando en colegio y tiene la necesidad de un credito  para mejorar su condicion de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Celia Mery Q. C. has been running her pension for fifteen years and requests a loan which she needs to allow her daughter to study at the university. Since she is a widow, she cannot count on any help from family members and needs the assistance of the program so that her daughter can continue to study and complete the career she has chosen. Mrs. Rosmery C. G. has three minor children, has been abandoned by her husband with whom she had the third son, and has need of a loan to continue helping her children with their studies. Her work is the sale of potatoes in the market of the zone known as El Tejar. She buys at wholesale and then sells at retail. Mrs. Delina S. B. has a grocer's shop. She wants to increase her working capital to be able to help her children who are studying in high school. She needs a loan to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy inventory at wholesale (rice, noodles, sugar, oil, etc.); to continue childrens' education

loans.name: Murad

texts.ru: Ахмедов Мурад – мужчина 44 лет. Женат отец 5-х детей. Мурад занимается откормом скота. На полученный займ он хочет купит 2 средных бычка и через 6 месяцом когда они станут большими продать. Мурад очень хороший плотник он имеет собственную бригаду. Жена и дети ухаживают за домашнем скотом. Жена и дочери Мурада занимаются переработкой пряжи. Мурод имеет 10 летный стаж работы в сфере скотоводства.
texts.en:
Murad A. is 44 years old. He is married and has five children. Murad makes his living fattening cattle for subsequent sale at the meat market. He wants to use this loan to buy two medium sized calves and when they grow up in six month he will sell them for profit. Murad is also a very skilled woodworker, he has his own team of men who work with him. Murad's wife and children take care of his herd and the women also spin wool for sale. Murad has ten years of experience in raising cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two calves

loans.name: Mor

texts.fr:
MOR D.  est un patissier de profession qui est à la retraite depuis dix ans ,pour entretenir sa famille il fait de l'aviculture avec l'aide de ses enfants ;il a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit qu'il a remboursé sans difficulté
avec ce pret,il envisage de renforcer son stock de poussins pour améliorer sa marge bénéficiaire
texts.en:
Mor D. is a pastry chef by trade. He has been retired for 10 years. To support his family he raises poultry with the help of his children. He has already had one loan that he reimbursed without difficulty.

With this loan, he intends to add to his chicks so that he can make more money.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raising poultry

loans.name: Rosa Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y es madre de 03 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa y vive en la Comunidad de Chinchero Sector San Bartolomé.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi medio año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de lanas para la confección de Artesanías.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lana industrial por conos, ella elabora chompas, chalinas, solo por pedido.

Su mayor  deseo es seguir trabajando, para poder educar a  sus hijos.

A ella le gustan la forma de trabajo y la unión que hay en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the community bank “Cajas Reales” that is located in the Chucuito district, Puno province, department of Puno. She is 27 years old, has a commonwealth partner and is a mother of three children. She has completed secondary school and lives in the Chinchero community, San Bartolomé sector.

She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost half a year. Her first loan was for 500.00 Nuevos Soles (about $165USD), which she used to buy yarns for artisan projects.

Now she needs a loan of 800.00 Nuevos Soles to buy cones of industrial yarn. She will make jackets and scarves for orders only.

Her greatest wish is to be able to continue working to be able to educate her children.

She likes the method and unity of working with a community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cones of industrial yarn

loans.name: Joseph

texts.fr: Joseph E. est un jeune homme de 37 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est tailleur à Adeta. Il exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans et il est doué dans son métier. Joseph désire avec ce crédit acheter une machine à coudre et des tissus pour l’exécution de ses œuvres.
texts.en:
Joseph E. is a young man, 37 years old, married, and the father of two. He is a tailor in Adeta. He has been in this business for five years and is talented in this trade of his. He would like to use this loan to buy a sewing machine and some fabrics for fulfilling his work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and some cloth

loans.name: Mrs. Ratha Chuor Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
The Mrs. Ratha C. Village Bank Loan group consists of 19 people who live in BoE. Krum Leu village in Kandal province. All of the people will use their loans for different purposes.

The members selected Mrs. Ratha C. for the village bank president. She has 4 children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Mrs. Ratha C. owns a hectar field to cultivate rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Ngin Sinat, is a blacksmith in the local village. 

Although Mrs. Ratha C. and her husband try to work hard, they still have little income to improve their living condition. Also, Mrs. Ratha C.'s husband wants to start a fishing business so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fishnets for her husband. 

Fifteen members in this loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are most beneficial for Cambodia's poor, who can repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fishnets for a fishing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Akossiwa Marguérita

texts.fr: Cette femme est une vendeuse ambulante de bijoux dans le quartier d’Adakpamé à Lomé ; elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2003. Ce commerce lui permet d’aider financièrement son mari tailleur à subvenir aux besoins de leurs 02 enfants. Elle vend ses bijoux dans les institutions aussi bien privées que publiques. Elle dispose de beaucoup de clientes qui la sollicitent beaucoup. Elle se rend le plus souvent au Bénin, le pays voisin pour s’approvisionner ; actuellement elle n’a plus presque de stock, c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour lancer des commandes de nouveaux bijoux.
texts.en:
Akossiwas is a travelling sales woman selling jewelry in the Adakpame district of the city of Lome. She has been running this business since 2003. Her business permits her to help her husban, a tailor, provide for the needs of their 2 children. She sells to private and public run businesses. She has a large client base, who patronize her frequently. She goes to Benin as often as she can, the neighboring country, to replenish her inventory. She is sold out of her inventory and this is why she is requesting a loan fro Wages (Kiva Field Partner). She wants to start a new campaign selling the new jewelry.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase jewelry

loans.name: Casimira

texts.es:
Casimira es artesana confecciona mantas de vicuña y alpaca mismo que son comercializados en distintas feria populares de la Ciudad de El Alto, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre su gastos personales, tiene su casa propia ubicado en la Zona San José de Yunguyo de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de materia prima (lana), de esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.

Es el primer crédito, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por casimira.

loans.use: CAPITAL DE OPERACIONES

loans.name: Jocyline

texts.en: Jocyline M., 46 years old, lives in Dasmarinas, Cavite, with her five children, two of whom are in college and high school respectively. For the last five years, Jocyline has been managing her general store located at her house. She has also been working hard on her piggery business. Along with her general store, she raises pigs to earn income to support her and her children’s education. She also sells fresh pork meat, taking her pigs to the butcher when they are ready for slaughtering. She earns P18,000 from these business activities. Jocyline became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative just last year. She has now applied for a new loan with the cooperative in the amount of P11,000 to have funds available for the expansion of her general store. She will use a portion of the loan for the renovation of her house. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her general store and to renovate her house

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase K. is 35 years old and is married with four children aged between 4 and 12. Anastase lives in the Gasabo district where he owns a butcher shop. This is his sixth year of successful operation in business! The hours of his business are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Although Anastase has been in the butcher business since 2003, his capital reserves are still too low to adequately satisfy the product needs and wants of his customers. He believes that a certain amount of additional capital to grow his business would allow him to offer more product and better quality.

For that reason, Anastase is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders to be able to purchase more weight of meats for sale which will bring him more revenue and, hopefully, more profit as well.

With this loan, and a successful business strategy, Anastase hopes to build a secure future for his family.

loans.use: To buy a cow to slaughter

loans.name: Elisa Augusto

texts.pt:
Elisa Augusto B. nasceu na Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, tem 37 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 14, 12 e 6 anos de idade. Fez 9ª classe, não continuou na altura por falta de condições financeiras, mas pretende regressar a escola no próximo ano. Vive na casa própria em Boane com a sua família, o marido trabalha como pintor. Sustenta a sua sogra que vive em Inhambane enviando dinheiro, para compra de produtos alimentares.

Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo em 1992 com o seu esposo, a procura de melhores condições de vida. Trabalha num Orfanato (casa do Gaiato) como cozinheira a 9 anos, entra a 7h ate as 17h e aufere um salário de 4.000.00mt, onde poupa algum por mes na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua colega. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção ( Blocos,chapas de zinco, cimento, areia e outros) para continuar com a sua obra. Os anteriores empréstimos foram de todos para a mesma actividade.

Compromete se a pagar bem este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais créditos afim de concluir a sua obra e oferecer melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Elisa Augusto Baya was born in the Province of Inhambane, south of Mozambique, she is 37 years old, she is married and has 3 children who are 14, 12 and 6 years old. She finished the 9th grade and wasn't able to finish school due to lack of financial resources, but she expects to return to school next year. She lives in her own house in Boane with her family, her husband works as a painter. She also supports her mother in law who lives in Inhambane sending her money to buy food. She left Inhambane in 1992 and went to Maputo with her husband, looking for better live conditions. She works at an orphanage (casa do Gaiato) as a cook for the past 9 years, she enters at 7am and leaves at 5pm and earns a salary of 4.000MT, and she is able to save some money every month in her bank account. She never had any other loans, and learned about Hluvuku thru a co-worker. This is her 4th loan for 15.000MT which she expects to use to buy construction material (blocks, cement, zinc sheets, sand and others) to keep on building her house. The other previous loans were for the same activity. She promises to pay well this loan in order to access to more loans in the future, finish her house and offer more comfort to her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, sand and others)

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, 38, has three businesses: a piggery, rice farming, and a sari-sari (variety) store. The eldest of her five children is still 15 years old and that's why she works hard in order to support them.

Marilou requested a loan of 8,000 Php from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy supplies needed for her businesses. She would like to expand her businesses in order to earn more for the sustenance of her family.

loans.use: To buy feeds and farm supplies

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a 40 year old married father of five children. All of Jackson's children are in school.  Jackson does small scale farming due to limited space and lack of capital. Jackson is unable to lease more farming space and buy farm inputs.  With a loan of Kshs 30,000, he will be able to use half to get farming space and the remainder to buy farm seeds and prepare the ground for planting.

loans.use: Lease more farm space and purchase seeds

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana, age 46, is a very hard-working married woman who works hard to provide for her five children, four of whom are in school. She trades in cereals like maize and gari, which is prepared from milled cassava. She sells gari grains in bulk in the market. She acquires her stock from the nearby communities and distributes her wares during market days.

She has a large customer base, but her problem has to do with having adequate funds to buy enough stock. With this loan assistance, she believes she will have full resources in order to realize good profits.

loans.use: To buy cereals like gari and maize grains for sale

loans.name: Estrella Oriental Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal " Estrella Oriental"  Esta representado por la señora Cecilia Andrea y conformado por 12 miembros las cuales 11 son mujeres y un solo varón, todas son amigas muy unidas, activas y emprendedoras las cuales van cursando un segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y capacidad D. pago. Entre las actividades que realizan esta la venta D. venta D. ropa, ropa americana, venta D. comida en pensiones en sus domicilios, venta D. tarjetas calendarios, otras se dedican a la coinfección D. prendas D. vestir, cortinas y la repostería tradicional, algunas cuentan con locales comerciales en sus domicilios propios en casetas en alquiler y otras trabajan D. forma ambulante; algunas tienen ingresos extras con la venta D. cosméticos por catálogo. 

Más a detalle se pueD. mencionar lo siguiente: Cecilia Andrea que es la presidenta del grupo se dedica a la venta D. comida tiene una experiencia D. 15 años en el rubro, Bertha se dedica a la venta D. tarjetas desD. hace 2 años, Elar tiene un puesto donD. venD. celulares	desD. hace 3 años, Karina es peluquera y atienD. en su salón D. belleza desD. hace 2 años, Hilda cuenta con una venta D. comida la que atienD. desD. hace 1 año, Renalia se dedica a la venta polleras desD. hace 2 años atrás, Josefa que se dedica a la venta D. ropa desD. hace 20 años atrás, Fabiola venD. comida hace 1 año, Senovia también se dedica a la venta D. comida solo que ella tiene una experiencia D. 12 años, Melvis también se dedica a la venta D. comida y tiene más experiencia (14 años), Delicia venD. ropa desD. hace 1 año, Marisol percibe un ingreso por concepto D. arrendar una movilidad ella se dedica a este negocio desD. hace 10 años. 

En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores siempre están presentes pero las socias se las arreglan para sacar adelantes sus negocios ya sea diversificando su mercadería o con la venta ambulante en zonas periféricas D. la ciudad que eles permite generar el movimiento necesario para el sustento D. sus familias. 

El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. material D. trabajo, insumos al por mayor y la mejora D. sus viviendas para darles mayor comodidad a sus familias. En cuanto a las expectativas D. las socias todas desean poder tener su casa propia por lo que su esfuerzo es para ello ya que desean darles un techo estable a sus hijos y un mejor futuro para cada uno D. ellos.
texts.en:
The Estrella Oriental Communal Bank is represented by Cecilia Andrea and comprised of 12 members. Eleven are women, and there is only one man. All of them are very united friends, who are active and entrepreneurial. They are in their second cycle, and they demonstrate responsibility and the capacity to pay. Among the activities they do is selling clothes, American clothes, selling food in boarding houses in their homes, and selling calendar cards. Others make articles of clothing, curtains, and traditional pastries. Some of them have commercial businesses in their own homes or rent stalls. Others work as street merchants. Some have extra income from selling cosmetics by catalog. In detail, the members' businesses are as follows: Cecilia Andrea, the group's president, sells food and has 15 years of experience. Bertha has been selling cards for the past two years, Elar has had a cell phone stand for the past three years, Karina is a hairdresser and has been working at her salon for the past two years, Hilda has been selling meals for the past year, Renalia has been selling pollera-style skirts for the past two years, Josefa has been selling clothing for 20 years, Fabiola has been selling food for the past year, Senovia also sells food but has 12 years of experience, Mevlis also sells food and has 14 years of experience, Delicia has been selling clothing for the past year, and Marisol generates income by renting out her car; she has been doing so for the past 10 years. As far as competition goes, it is always there. But, the members adjust to get ahead in their businesses. They diversify their merchandise or travel to sell in outlying areas of the city. This allows them to generate the necessary movement to support their families. The loan is to get working materials, wholesale supplies, and to improve their homes to make their families more comfortable. As far as the members’ expectations go, they wish to be able to have their own houses. That is why they put forth so much effort; they want to give their children a stable roof over their heads. They want to give each one of them a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Thơm's Group

texts.en: Thơm Thị

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Mabb

texts.en:
Mr. Mabb T. is a 26 year old who lives in the village of Pongro in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Raem Laem, are farmers who own a 5 hectare field to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, they also raise pigs, making a small income to support their family. This couple has one child who is too young for school. 

Mr. Mabb T. is now requesting a 1,000,000 riel loan from AMK to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline to support the crops. 

His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Maria Ismelda

texts.es:
La Sra. María Ismelda B. V. es agricultora y comerciante del área rural del Municipio de Pueblo Nuevo.

Ella solita un financiamiento en Ceprodel para la compra de granos tales como el maíz y retenerlo para venderlo en tiempo de verano donde los precios de este son mas altos y el grano es mas escaso.

Este negocio empezó cando María B. empezó a comprar granos en poca cantidad en época de cosecha y venderlo en tiempo de escases hasta comprar cada ves mas granos, ella se a dedicado a esta labor desde hace aproximadamente unos quince años,  cabe señalar que en años anteriores ella era estudiante de secundaria.

Ella espera que con la compra y retención de estos granos pueda venderlos en mejor precio cuando sea el tiempo de escases y esto le generara mejores ganancias y por ende mejores ingresos familiares y de esta manera espera que su negocio crezca cada ves mas.

Este es el crédito numero ocho que Doña María B. solicita en Ceprodel en un periodo de cinco años. Estos financierito le han beneficiado positivamente ya  que a través de esto a logrado asistir sus cultivos de granos básicos y tener segura la cosecha para es sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
María Ismelda B. V. is a farmer and merchant in the rural zone of Pueblo Nuevo. She is asking Ceprodel for funds to buy corn to store and then sell in Summer when prices are higher and the grain is scarcer. The business began when María B. began to buy small amounts of grain during harvest time and then sell it during times of shortage; each time she bought more grain and has been doing this work for about 15 years now. It is worth noting that in the years prior to this she was in secondary school. She hopes that by buying and storing these grains she will be able to sell them for a better price at a time when the grain is scarce. This will generate better profits and thus better family income; she hopes that her business will grow more each time. This is her 8th loan with Ceprodel in a period of 5 years. These loans have been beneficial to her because she has been able to care for her crops and insure a good harvest for the support of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S., aged 46, is married and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. He has four children. S. is a soldier in the city, earning an income of $5 USD per day to help cover family expenses. His wife sells groceries and runs a food shop at her home, earning an income of $7 USD per day. She has been running this business since 2005. The family's standard of living has been improved since S.'s wife has had this business. S. is requesting a loan of $300 USD to buy more groceries to stock his wife's store. This is his fifth loan from Kiva partner, CREDIT.
The photograph shows S.'s wife.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock his wife's store

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Mrs. Ban C. is a 56-year-old widow who currently lives in a village located in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She was not available for the photograph so her daughter is pictured instead. Ban C. has given birth to two children: one daughter and one son. Her daughter is now married but still lives with her in her home.

To pursue a daily income, Ban C. owns a farm where she grows crops and has had this job for years. Also she depends on the income from her son and her son-in-law, who are local construction laborers.

Ban C. will be using her loan to pay the bill for connecting a new electricity line for family use.

loans.use: To pay the bill for connecting a new electricity line for family use

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch C., age 23, is married and resides with her husband and children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is a farmer who grows pumpkins and watermelons for an income of about USD $2.00 per day. Her husband is a militant for the province, earning an income of USD $2.50 per day to help cover the family's expenses.  

C. is requesting a loan of USD $1000 to purchase a plot of farmland to grow more melons and pumpkins. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick O. is a 38 year-old business man. He is married with three children and he also has five more dependents, of whom four are in school. He is a resident of Akesi village, Nebbi Town Council.

Patrick owns a retail shop business which he has been running for over three years. He will use his loan to purchase retail shop items such as biscuits, toilet papers, soap, salt, packed milk, sugar, drinks and so forth, to sell.

His future hope is to enlarge his shop for more profits.

loans.use: To purchase retail shop items such as biscuits, toilet papers, soap, salt, packed milk, sugar, drinks and so forth, to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester D., 43, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Nelson D., a construction worker, and they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn enough so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own clothing stall, where she sells ready-to-wear-clothing, for quite some time now.

Ester has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her clothing business.

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as added capital for her expanding business, enabling her to buy more products to be incorporated into her current product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Muhumuza Women's Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
A determined N. Shallon has, over the last ten years, been overseeing her growing spare-parts business in Ntungamo town. With a monthly net profit of 100,000 Ugandan shillings a month, this married lady has enjoyed the good circumstances that have come with running this lucrative business. As a result, she has made enormous progress in as far as educating her children is concerned.

Shallon’s business story began with a now defunct secondhand clothes business. With the profits from it, she was able to make progress in her bid to establish herself in her new business. Her first priority after acquiring this loan is to purchase more hardware stock with the sole objective of turning her business into a bid supplies store in her operating area. She also has a side commercial motorcycle business that she runs which also helps her supplement her profits.

Shallon is a lady with a purpose-driven ambition as she is looking at not only business expansion but also the quality education of her children. With this loan, she wants to buy more car and motorcycle parts that she will later resell.

Shallon belongs to a group of members who hold each other accountable and insure one another in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more car and motorcycle spare parts for resale

loans.name: A Changeable God Group

texts.en:
Helena D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called A Changeable God. She is 47 years old, single and has five children who range from 15 to 27 years old. 

She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. 

For 25 years, she has been selling dried fish in West Point Market in Monrovia, Liberia.
 
She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more dried fish. She describes herself as a peaceful person.

Her dream is to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome M. is from the village of Poblacion, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 49 years old and married with six school-aged children. Salome runs a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily use products and also runs a small eatery. Salome has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Salome joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Salome from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Deun

texts.en: Mrs. Deun L. has been in the farming business for years. She plants rice crops on her own land, from which she earns a living. Her husband assists her with the farm work. Deun L. has been married for years and has two children, both attending school. Deun L. hopes to improve her daily income. To help meet her goals, Deun L. has applied for a loan to use as capital in order to buy mature rice in bulk from other farmers to store for a while before selling it for a profit.

loans.use: To buy mature rice in bulk from other farmers to store for a while before selling

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
Don Florentino es un señor de 39 años de edad  quien vive con su esposa y  4 hijos  en una de Reserva habitada por uno de los grupos  Indígenas mas importantes de Costa Rica los  “Guaimí”.    Esta Ubicada en San Vito de Coto Brus una zona caracterizada por su elevada Ubicación y por estar a solamente una hora del Parque Internacional La  Amistad. Sus principales actividades económicas son la Agricultura, la artesanía y el Turismo  el cual ha aumentando en los últimos años.
Una de los productos más comercializados por los Guamies son los Frijoles. Y don Florentino lleva toda su vida produciendo este grano,   para consumo de su familia y principalmente para la venta. El negocio de los frijoles ha estado un poco bajo debido a que no hay dinero para invertir pero, gracias a este tipo Organizaciones hoy don Florentino  tiene la posibilidad de solicitar un préstamo de ¢100.000 (cien mil colones) para la compra de semilla de frijol y los respectivos insumos que necesite para tener la mejor cosecha de frijol posible.
El asegura que con su negocio mejorara la calidad de vida su familia y les podrá comprar mas ropa y zapatos que necesitan sus hijos para ir a la escuela.
Don Florentino es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Ku Kwata, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y también es la primera vez  que la ECC recibe un préstamo con Fondos de Kiva.
texts.en:
Mr. Florentino is a 39 year old man who lives with his wife and 4 children in a Reserve inhabited by one of the most important indigenous groups of Costa Rica, the "Guaimi." It is located in San Vito of Coto Brus, and area characterized for its elevated location and for being only an hour away from the International Park of Friendship. The main economical work is agriculture, making local art, and tourism which has increased in the last few years.

One of the Guaimis' best selling products is beans and Mr. Florentino has spent his entire life growing grains for his family's consumption but mainly for sale. The bean business has been low due to the lack of money. Thanks to this type of organization Mr. Florentino has the opportunity to request a ¢100.000 (one-hundred thousand colones or Costa Rican Currency) loan for the purchase of bean seeds and the related materials he will need to have the best bean crop possible.

He assures that his business will improve his family's quality of life and he will be able to buy more clothes and shoes for his children to go to school.

Mr. Florentino is a member of the Communal Credit Company Ku Kwata, one of the partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and also the first time ECC receives a loan with funds coming from Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bean seeds and other supplies.

loans.name: Tumurbaatar

texts.en:
Tumurbaatar S. is 54 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in Uvurhangai Province in Mongolia. His son, Boldoo, 22, currently attends university and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Tumurbaatar started selling dairy products in a local market, and in 1993 opened a small cafe in his town where he and his wife produce quality meals for their customers. Since opening, this business has expanded, and he continues to sell his dairy products. For the future, Tumurbaatar plans to build a new cafe on land that he bought in order to grow his business. "I hope to build a new restaurant near the market, so that our business can grow 2-3 times larger than now," he says.

A very successful businessman,Tumurbaatar is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase grocery products and meat for his business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products

loans.name: Nohemi Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nohemi  está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Yahaira Tomasa B. quien vende carne y delantales desde hace tres años. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Felix R. quien vende ropa usada y nueva y comercializa productos Avon mientras Jenny Lorena U. vende ropa.
texts.en:
The Nohemi Group is composed of three hard-working and forceful women, one of whom is Yahaira who has sold meat and aprons for three years. The other members of the group are Gloria, who has a tiny bakery and sells Avon products, while Cecilia has a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MEAT AND PRODUCING APRONS TO SELL

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
María del Pilar es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad, que vive junto a su esposo y a sus cuatro hijos en el sector San Martín del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que produce principalmente frutas como limón y mango. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Piura, perteneciente a la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

María del Pilar se dedica a la venta de comida, ella prepara diversos platos de comida y los ofrece en venta tres veces por semana en un puesto ubicado frente a la puerta principal del mercado de su distrito, gracias al tiempo que lleva en el negocio actualmente ya cuenta con un grupo de clientes fidelizados que prefieren su negocio por la buena sazón con la que prepara sus comidas y por el buen trato con el que los atiende.

Los ingresos que ella percibe los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a sus hijos. María está pensando en ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas insumos de tal manera que pueda preparar mas platos de comida y por consiguiente su nivel de ventas aumente. Para realizar su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que siempre vela por el desarrollo de los suyos. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder instalar un restaurante.
texts.en:
Maria del Pilar is a 32 year old mom that lives with her husband and four children in San Martin sector of the Tambogrande district, an agricultural area that mainly produces limes and mangoes.  It is located in the province of Piura which belongs to the region of the same name, more than three and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque.

María del Pilar sells food, she prepares different dishes and offers them for sale three times a week in a stand located across the main entrance of the district market, thanks to the time she has been in business she currently has a group of loyal clients that prefer her business because of the great flavor of well seasoned food and the good service she provides.

The income that she gets is used to help her husband and get her kids ahead.  Maria is considering expanding her business by buying more ingredients and this way make more dishes and increase her sales.  To achieve this objective she thought it would be convenient to request a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Maria is a very hardworking woman and she always looks after the development of her people.  Her biggest dream is to grow as an entrepreneur and be able to open a restaurant.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for food sales

loans.name: C1184 Jyambere Group

texts.en:
Laurence is was born in 1964 and is married with two children; the first one is 5 years old and the younger is two years old. Laurence is businesswoman and her husband is also in business; both work hard for the purpose of making progress in their family.
